enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official name of the nonprofit organization used in external communications, templates, legal documents, and donor-facing materials.
examples: HopeBridge Community Services
GreenFuture Youth Initiative
ShelterAid Collective
validationRules: noSpecialCharacters: allow letters, numbers, spaces, apostrophes, ampersands, hyphens, and periods

enhancedVariables.name: MISSION_STATEMENT
enhancedVariables.description: A short, focused statement that summarizes the nonprofit's core purpose, target population, and primary approach or impact.
examples: To empower low-income families through workforce training and placement services.
To protect urban green spaces by engaging volunteers in restoration and education.
To provide trauma-informed mental health support to survivors of domestic violence.

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The name of an individual, foundation, or corporate donor to be used in personalized donor communications and receipts.
examples: Maria Gonzalez
The Anderson Family Foundation
MetroTech Solutions, Inc.

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_LOCATION
enhancedVariables.description: The physical address or named location where a program or service is delivered (facility, neighborhood, partner site).
examples: Eastside Community Center, 412 Oak St, Springfield
Mobile Outreach Van — Downtown Plaza (near 5th and Main)
Riverbend School Gymnasium, Community Room B

enhancedVariables.name: DATE
enhancedVariables.description: A calendar date referenced in communications or scheduling (event date, meeting date, report date).
validationRules: notInPast: optional depending on use case

enhancedVariables.name: TIME
enhancedVariables.description: A time of day used for scheduling (start time, end time, appointment time) often tied to a DATE variable.
validationRules: format:HH:MM (24-hour) or allow AM/PM with validation

enhancedVariables.name: CONTACT_INFORMATION
enhancedVariables.description: Primary contact details for staff or departments used in templates (phone, email, and optional mailing address or office hours).
examples: Phone: (555) 123-4567; Email: info@hopebridge.org; Mon–Fri 9am–5pm
Volunteer Coordinator — volunteer@greenfuture.org; (555) 987-6543
Main Office: 412 Oak St, Springfield; Phone: (555) 222-3333; reception@shelteraid.org
validationRules: shouldContain: at least one valid email or phone
phoneFormatValidation: for any phone numbers present

enhancedVariables.name: STAFF_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of an individual staff member used to sign communications, provide a contact, or appear in templates.
examples: Amira Patel
James R. Thompson
Lindsey O'Connell

enhancedVariables.name: STAFF_TITLE
enhancedVariables.description: The job title or role of a staff member (e.g., Executive Director, Volunteer Coordinator) used in signatures and role descriptions.
examples: Executive Director
Development Manager
Program Coordinator — Youth Services

enhancedVariables.name: NUMBER
enhancedVariables.description: A generic numeric value used across templates (counts, quantities, number of attendees, donation amounts when not currency-specific).
examples: 24 (number of volunteers attending)
150 (meals served)
3 (number of sessions)

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official name of a program or service offered by the nonprofit, used in outreach, reporting, and templates.
examples: After-School STEM Mentorship Program
Neighborhood Food Access Initiative
Career Pathways Job Training

enhancedVariables.name: PERCENTAGE
enhancedVariables.description: A percent value used in impact statements, reports, or funding communications (e.g., percentage increase, proportion reached).
validationRules: format: numeric with optional decimal followed by optional % sign

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_OUTCOME_METRIC
enhancedVariables.description: A succinct metric name or label used to report program outcomes (e.g., 'graduation rate', 'meals distributed per month'). Note: multiple distinct KEY_OUTCOME_METRIC variables may be used across templates.
examples: Employment Placement Rate
Children Served Per Month
Housing Stability (%)

enhancedVariables.name: BENEFICIARY_FIRST_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The first name of a program recipient or beneficiary used for personalization in success stories, testimonials, or case notes (use with consent and privacy policies).
examples: Luis
Asha
Michael
validationRules: sensitiveDataWarning: ensure consent before public use

enhancedVariables.name: BRIEF_TESTIMONIAL_QUOTE
enhancedVariables.description: A short, attributable quote from a beneficiary, volunteer, or donor used in marketing and impact communications; must be consented for use.
examples: "This program gave me the confidence to find steady work." — Asha
"Volunteering here changed how I view my community." — Daniel
"Their support helped our family stay together." — Maria

enhancedVariables.name: STRATEGIC_GOAL
enhancedVariables.description: The organization's high-level objective that guides programs and resource allocation over a multi-year period; used to explain purpose and impact to donors, staff, and partners.
examples: Reduce local childhood asthma hospitalization rates by 30% in five years through home remediation and education.
Increase affordable housing units by 250 within the next three years by acquiring and rehabilitating properties.
Grow youth workforce development participation to 1,000 trainees annually and achieve 70% job placement within six months.

enhancedVariables.name: TIMEFRAME
enhancedVariables.description: A date, range, or period that defines when an activity, goal, event, or reporting window begins and ends; used for planning, scheduling, and communicating timelines.
examples: June 1, 2025 (one-day workshop)
Fiscal year 2024–2025 (July 1, 2024 to June 30, 2025)
validationRules: Required when used in scheduling or reporting contexts
Prefer ISO date or clear range format (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD to YYYY-MM-DD)
If single date, validate as date; if range, validate both start and end and ensure start ≤ end

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_PROGRAM_EXAMPLES
enhancedVariables.description: Concrete examples of programs or services the nonprofit runs that illustrate how mission is translated into action; useful for donor communications and FAQs.
examples: After-school STEM tutoring for 120 elementary students with homework help and mentorship.
Mobile legal clinics offering pro bono eviction defense consultations twice monthly.
Food box distribution paired with nutrition education reaching 500 families per month.
validationRules: Optional but recommended for donor-facing content
Maximum 1000 characters per example if a single field; allow multiple entries if possible

enhancedVariables.name: FUNDRAISING_ROI
enhancedVariables.description: A metric or narrative describing the return on investment for fundraising activities, often expressed as dollars raised per dollar spent or cost per dollar raised.
examples: $3.50 raised for every $1 spent on our annual gala (net revenue $175,000 on $50,000 cost).
Digital peer-to-peer campaign yielded $8,000 in donations on $2,000 ad spend (ROI 4:1).
Monthly giving acquisition cost: $40 per donor, lifetime value estimated $600.
validationRules: If numeric, allow currency and ratio formats (e.g., $X spent / $Y raised or X:1)
Optional but validate numbers are positive
If percentage or ratio included, validate format (e.g., 3.5 or 3.5:1 or 350%)

enhancedVariables.name: CHARITY_RATING
enhancedVariables.description: The external rating or assessment assigned to the nonprofit by independent evaluators (e.g., Charity Navigator), used to show credibility to stakeholders.
examples: 4-star rating from Charity Navigator
BBB Accredited Charity with A+ rating
Gold-level Transparency seal from GuideStar (Candid)
validationRules: Optional but should match known rating taxonomy when provided
If free-text, limit to 100 characters and forbid special characters that could be injection risks
If select, provide common vendor options plus 'Other' with optional text

enhancedVariables.name: RATING_ORGANIZATION
enhancedVariables.description: The name of the independent organization or platform that issued the charity rating or assessment (e.g., Charity Navigator, GuideStar, BBB Wise Giving).
examples: Charity Navigator
Candid / GuideStar
Better Business Bureau Wise Giving Alliance
validationRules: Optional but recommended when Charity_Rating is provided
If select, include common rating organizations and an 'Other' text option

enhancedVariables.name: CFO_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the nonprofit's Chief Financial Officer or the primary finance contact; used in financial reports, donor inquiries, and official correspondence.
examples: María L. Santos
David R. Chen
Aisha K. Thompson
validationRules: Optional but recommended for financial disclosures
Allow letters, hyphens, apostrophes; disallow numbers or special symbols outside name characters

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official title of an event organized by the nonprofit used in invitations, registration, promotion, and logistics communications.
examples: Annual Fundraising Gala: Lights for Learning 2025
Community Health Fair & Free Screenings
Volunteer Orientation and Training Session — March 2025
validationRules: Disallow control characters; trim leading/trailing whitespace

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: The scheduled date or dates for an event or activity; used for calendars, invites, reminders, and scheduling resources or volunteers.
validationRules: Accept ISO date format (YYYY-MM-DD); allow optional time or range fields
If range provided, validate start ≤ end and timezone if relevant

enhancedVariables.name: CORE_VALUES
enhancedVariables.description: The guiding principles and ethical commitments that shape the nonprofit's culture, decision-making, and program priorities.
examples: Equity, Community-Led Solutions, Transparency, and Sustainability
Compassion, Integrity, Collaboration, and Accountability
Inclusion, Evidence-Based Practice, Respect, and Innovation
validationRules: List format encouraged (comma-separated or bullet style)

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: A short descriptor of the nature of an event (e.g., fundraiser, workshop, volunteer shift) used to route communications and plan logistics.
examples: Fundraiser / Gala
Volunteer Orientation
Community Workshop / Training
validationRules: Provide standard options (Fundraiser, Training, Outreach, Meeting, Volunteer Shift, Other)
If 'Other' chosen, require a short description (max 100 characters)

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_PURPOSE
enhancedVariables.description: A concise statement explaining why the event is being held and what it aims to achieve (e.g., fundraising, awareness, service delivery, volunteer recruitment).
examples: Raise unrestricted operating funds to support core programs and emergency relief.
Train neighborhood volunteers in harm-reduction outreach techniques.
Provide free legal consultations to low-income renters facing eviction.
validationRules: Required for promotional and donor-facing materials

enhancedVariables.name: ATTENDEE_COUNT
enhancedVariables.description: The expected or actual number of participants or attendees for an event; used for budgeting, venue selection, and volunteer staffing.
examples: Expected: 250 seated dinner attendees
Approximately 60 volunteer shift sign-ups per day
500 community attendees at outreach fair (peak 200/hr)
validationRules: If provided, must be an integer ≥ 0
Optional but required for logistical planning
For estimates, allow an 'approximate' flag or note

enhancedVariables.name: AUDIENCE_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: A brief profile of the intended audience or beneficiaries for an event, program, or communication (demographics, needs, or stakeholder type).
examples: Low-income parents with children aged 0–5 in the Eastside neighborhood.
Prospective volunteers aged 18+, interested in environmental restoration work.
Local small business owners seeking free financial literacy resources.
validationRules: Recommended for targeted outreach and tailoring content
Avoid collecting personal data or identifiable client information

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_ACTIVITIES
enhancedVariables.description: The primary actions, sessions, or components that will occur during a program or event; used in agendas, promotional materials, and operational plans.
examples: Welcome remarks, keynote presentation, breakout workshops, silent auction, closing reception.
Intake screening, harm-reduction supplies distribution, brief counseling, referral follow-up.
Volunteer check-in, safety briefing, site clean-up, tool return and debrief.
validationRules: Recommended to be provided as a short list (comma-separated or bullets)
Avoid overly technical jargon; keep items actionable and time-bound if possible

enhancedVariables.name: MISSION_ALIGNMENT
enhancedVariables.description: A brief statement describing how an event, program, or activity supports the nonprofit's core mission and strategic goals. Used to justify relevance to stakeholders, funders, or volunteers.
examples: This fundraising gala supports our mission to provide after-school tutoring and mentoring for under-resourced youth in the city.
The community garden project advances our goal of improving food security and environmental education in low-income neighborhoods.
Our volunteer tax-preparation clinic aligns with the mission by increasing financial stability for low-income families.

enhancedVariables.name: DEMOGRAPHIC_INFORMATION
enhancedVariables.description: Key demographic details about participants, beneficiaries, or target populations (e.g., age ranges, income brackets, race/ethnicity, languages) used for reporting, program design, or compliance.
examples: Majority of participants: adults aged 25–44; 60% female; 45% identify as Hispanic/Latinx.
Program serves low-income households with annual income below $35,000; 30% are seniors 65+.
Client base: primarily Spanish speakers (40%), with outreach also in English and Vietnamese.

enhancedVariables.name: START_TIME
enhancedVariables.description: The official scheduled beginning time for an event, meeting, appointment, or program session, typically expressed in local time and including AM/PM or 24-hour format.
examples: 14:00 (2:00 PM) — doors open at 13:30

enhancedVariables.name: CHECK_IN_TIME
enhancedVariables.description: The designated time window when attendees, clients, or volunteers should arrive to register or check in before an event or appointment.
examples: Check-in begins at 5:30 PM and runs until 6:15 PM.
Clients should arrive 15 minutes before their appointment for check-in (e.g., 09:15 for a 09:30 start).
Volunteer check-in: 08:00–08:30 on the day of the service.
validationRules: ifRange, start must be before end

enhancedVariables.name: VENUE_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official name of the physical location or facility where an event, service, or meeting will take place (e.g., community center, school gym, conference hall).
examples: Riverside Community Center
St. Mark's Episcopal Church Hall
Downtown Convention Center — Grand Ballroom

enhancedVariables.name: VENUE_ADDRESS
enhancedVariables.description: The full postal address for the venue, including street number, city, state/province, and postal code for directions, mailings, or mapping.
examples: 123 Maple Ave, Suite 200, Springfield, IL 62704
450 Harbor Drive, 3rd Floor, Seattle, WA 98101
78 Elm Street, Apt 1, Brooklyn, NY 11201

enhancedVariables.name: STREET_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The specific street or road portion of a venue or contact address (without city/state/postal code), useful for mapping or short display fields.
examples: Maple Ave
Harbor Drive
Elm Street

enhancedVariables.name: LOCATION
enhancedVariables.description: A flexible field describing where an activity occurs; can be a neighborhood, campus area, virtual meeting link, or general location description used across programs and communications.
examples: Westside Neighborhood Park (playground near the picnic shelters)
Zoom Meeting — link will be emailed 24 hours prior
Main Library, 2nd-floor conference room B

enhancedVariables.name: GPS_ADDRESS
enhancedVariables.description: Latitude and longitude coordinates or a GPS-friendly address format used for navigation apps and mapping to ensure precise directions to a venue.
validationRules: format:decimal degrees 'lat,lon' or 'Lat: x, Lon: y'
lat between -90 and 90, lon between -180 and 180

enhancedVariables.name: VEGETARIAN_MENU_ITEMS
enhancedVariables.description: A list or description of vegetarian meal or snack options to be provided at events, used for catering notes and dietary communications.
examples: Grilled vegetable skewers, quinoa salad, and vegetarian lasagna (gluten-containing).
Mixed green salad, hummus and veggie wrap (whole-wheat), fruit platter.
Stuffed peppers (rice and black beans), roasted vegetable medley, garlic bread.

enhancedVariables.name: VEGAN_MENU_ITEMS
enhancedVariables.description: A list of fully plant-based menu items available for an event, used to accommodate vegan attendees and for labeling.
examples: Vegan lentil shepherd's pie, roasted root vegetables, and mixed greens with vinaigrette.
Chickpea and vegetable curry with basmati rice; vegan naan on request.
Plant-based taco bar: seasoned jackfruit, black beans, vegan tortilla shells, pico de gallo.

enhancedVariables.name: GLUTEN_FREE_MENU_ITEMS
enhancedVariables.description: A list of food options that are free from gluten, used to inform attendees with celiac disease or gluten sensitivity and for caterer instructions.
examples: Quinoa and roasted vegetable salad, grilled salmon, and fruit cups (all gluten-free).
Corn tortilla tacos with chicken and black bean salad (no wheat ingredients).
Chickpea flour pancakes, mixed berry compote, and yogurt (gluten-free).

enhancedVariables.name: CATERING_CONTACT_EMAIL
enhancedVariables.description: The primary email address for the catering vendor or internal catering coordinator used for confirmations, menu finalization, and last-minute changes.
examples: catering@greenplateevents.org
events@tasteandservecatering.com
hospitality-coord@communitycenter.org

enhancedVariables.name: DIETARY_REQUEST_DEADLINE
enhancedVariables.description: The cut-off date and time by which attendees must submit dietary restrictions or special meal requests so the caterer can accommodate them.
examples: Please submit dietary requests by 2025-09-01 17:00 (5:00 PM).
Dietary restrictions due two weeks before the event: 2025-06-10.
Deadline: 72 hours prior to event start.

enhancedVariables.name: CONFIRMATION_TIMEFRAME
enhancedVariables.description: The period in which attendees, registrants, or clients will receive confirmations (e.g., email/text) after signing up or booking, often expressed relative to the event or action.
examples: Registrants will receive confirmation within 48 hours of signing up.
Confirmation emails sent immediately upon registration and reminder 24 hours before the event.
Volunteer shift confirmations issued 5 business days after application review.

enhancedVariables.name: SENDER_EMAIL
enhancedVariables.description: The email address of the staff member or generic inbox sending event or partner communications; used in From and reply-to fields for outreach and transactional messages.
examples: events@communitycare.org
jane.doe@communitycare.org
volunteer-coord@cityfoodbank.org

enhancedVariables.name: REGISTRATION_SITE
enhancedVariables.description: The public URL for event registration or sign-up pages where attendees can complete registration and view event details.
examples: https://communitycare.org/events/summer-gala/register
https://forms.gle/abcd1234registration
https://cityfoodbank.org/volunteer-signup
validationRules: must be a valid URL (http or https)

enhancedVariables.name: REGISTRATION_EMAIL
enhancedVariables.description: Contact email specifically for registration questions or support related to an event or program.
examples: register@communitycare.org
events-support@cityfoodbank.org
signup-help@literacyforall.org
validationRules: required when registration contact is provided

enhancedVariables.name: REGISTRATION_PHONE
enhancedVariables.description: Phone number attendees can call or text for registration assistance, accessibility requests, or last-minute changes.
validationRules: valid E.164 or national phone format

enhancedVariables.name: SUPPORT_HOURS
enhancedVariables.description: The hours during which registration or event support is available (time zone should be specified).
examples: Mon–Fri, 9:00 AM–5:00 PM PT
Saturday 10 AM–2 PM (local time)
24/7 automated support; live help Mon–Fri 8 AM–6 PM EST
validationRules: use clear range format (days and times)

enhancedVariables.name: ID_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: Any identification documents attendees must bring or present to check in (e.g., government ID, student ID, proof of vaccination).
examples: Photo ID (driver's license or passport) required at check-in
Student ID or proof of enrollment required for discounted tickets
No ID required — just a registration confirmation email
validationRules: optional depending on event security needs
avoid collecting unnecessary personal data in this field

enhancedVariables.name: PARTNER_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The legal or commonly used name of a partner organization collaborating on a program, event, or service delivery.
examples: Neighborhood Health Partners
City Public Library — Youth Services
Green Streets Coalition

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_TEMPLATE
enhancedVariables.description: URL pointing to a template document (e.g., outreach email, MOU draft, volunteer schedule) that partners or staff can copy or download.
examples: https://drive.google.com/template/0BxyzExample
https://communitycare.org/templates/volunteer-shift-template.docx
https://intranet.local/templates/partner-mou-template
validationRules: optional if no template is provided

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_FORMS
enhancedVariables.description: URL or folder link containing intake, consent, or partner forms required for a program or collaboration.
examples: https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=example
https://communitycare.org/forms/intake
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1a2b3cForms
validationRules: ensure link permissions are correct for intended audience

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_PORTAL
enhancedVariables.description: Direct link to a partner or volunteer portal where users can log in to access resources, submit reports, or manage registrations.
examples: https://partners.communitycare.org/login
https://volunteer.cityfoodbank.org/portal
https://portal.literacyforall.org/partners
validationRules: indicate if single-sign-on or credentials required

enhancedVariables.name: YOUR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of the staff member preparing the message or coordinating with partners; appears in signatures and contact sections.
examples: Miguel Alvarez
Samantha Lee, Program Manager
Aisha Rahman (Volunteer Coordinator)
validationRules: avoid special characters beyond standard name punctuation

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_FLOORPLAN
enhancedVariables.description: A URL linking to the event venue floor plan or site map (useful for vendors, partners, accessibility planning, and volunteers).
examples: https://communitycare.org/events/gala/floorplan.pdf
https://venue.example.com/maps/ballroom-level1
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0floorplanExample/view
validationRules: must be a valid URL when provided
recommended to specify version or date

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_STEPS
enhancedVariables.description: URL to step-by-step instructions, onboarding checklists, or standard operating procedures partners/volunteers should follow.
examples: https://communitycare.org/onboarding/volunteer-steps
https://docs.example.com/partner-setup-steps
https://drive.google.com/steps/checklist
validationRules: must be a valid URL when included
clarify applicability and last updated date

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_GUIDELINES
enhancedVariables.description: Link to policies, brand guidelines, accessibility guidelines, or program-specific rules partners need to follow.
examples: https://communitycare.org/policies/brand-guidelines.pdf
https://intranet.local/accessibility-guidelines
https://partnerhub.example.org/guidelines
validationRules: ensure public or partner access permissions are set

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_MOU
enhancedVariables.description: URL to the Memorandum of Understanding or partnership agreement template or the signed MOU document for reference.
examples: https://communitycare.org/agreements/sample-mou.pdf
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0mousignedExample/view
https://partnerportal.example.org/mous
validationRules: must be a valid URL when MOU exists
confirm access permissions for external partners

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_CHECKLIST
enhancedVariables.description: A URL linking to a checklist relevant to the task (e.g., partner onboarding, volunteer shift prep, or program intake steps). Use for directing staff, volunteers, or partners to a step-by-step list of required actions or documents.
examples: https://org.example.org/onboarding/checklist
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1a2b3c/checklist-view
https://intranet.nonprofit.local/volunteer-shift-checklist
validationRules: must be a valid URL (http or https)

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_SAMPLES
enhancedVariables.description: A URL pointing to sample documents or templates (e.g., sample agreements, outreach emails, intake forms) that staff or partners can use as references.
examples: https://org.example.org/templates/partnership-agreement-sample.docx
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0Bsample-templates
https://resources.nonprofit.org/email-samples/donor-thank-you
validationRules: if provided, must be a valid URL (http or https)

enhancedVariables.name: PARTNER_TYPE_#
enhancedVariables.description: The type of partner organization involved with the nonprofit (e.g., school, faith-based organization, funder). Multiple numbered instances are expected (PARTNER_TYPE_1, PARTNER_TYPE_2, etc.) to list several partner types.
examples: Community health clinic
Local public school district
Corporate foundation (grant partner)
validationRules: multiple instances allowed (1..4 by provided metadata)
prefer values from a controlled vocabulary when available (e.g., 'School', 'Healthcare Provider', 'Funder', 'Volunteer Group', 'Government Agency')

enhancedVariables.name: BRIEF_MISSION_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: A concise (one- or two-sentence) statement of the organization's mission or the mission of a program relevant to the template's context.
examples: We provide after-school STEM tutoring to underserved middle school students to close the achievement gap.
Our mission is to secure stable housing for families experiencing homelessness through rapid rehousing and supportive services.
To empower low-income entrepreneurs by offering training, mentorship, and small business microgrants.

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_POPULATION
enhancedVariables.description: The primary group(s) the program or service is designed to serve (e.g., age ranges, demographic groups, geographic communities, or people with specific needs).
examples: Low-income families with children under 5 in County X
Unemployed adults over 50 seeking job training and placement
Survivors of domestic violence in the metropolitan area
validationRules: encourage use of clear descriptors (age, geography, need)
avoid personal data (no individual names or identifiers)

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_FOCUS_AREAS
enhancedVariables.description: Key thematic or service areas the program addresses (e.g., food security, mental health counseling, workforce development).
examples: Nutrition assistance and community food pantries
Youth leadership development and academic support
Job readiness training and employer partnerships
validationRules: prefer comma-separated list or short bullets
limit to core focus areas (3–6) when possible

enhancedVariables.name: PHONE_NUMBER
enhancedVariables.description: Primary telephone contact for the program, coordinator, or department used in communications and scheduling.
validationRules: must be a valid phone number format (E.164 recommended)
allow international formats and common punctuation

enhancedVariables.name: EMAIL_ADDRESS
enhancedVariables.description: A contact email address for program inquiries, partner communication, or general information related to the template context.
examples: info@nonprofit.org
volunteercoordinator@nonprofit.org
grants@foundationpartner.org
validationRules: must be a valid email address format
reject disposable email domains if formal communication

enhancedVariables.name: COORDINATOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the staff member or volunteer who coordinates the program, shift, or partnership referenced in the template.
examples: Maria Sanchez
David J. Thompson
Aisha O'Connor

enhancedVariables.name: EMAIL
enhancedVariables.description: An email contact used in templates; may duplicate EMAIL_ADDRESS but included where a generic 'EMAIL' placeholder is expected. Use for outreach, follow-up, or internal notifications.
examples: programs@nonprofit.org
support@nonprofit.org
contact@partneragency.org

enhancedVariables.name: SIZE
enhancedVariables.description: A descriptor of size relevant to the context (e.g., organization size, program cohort size, contract monetary size). Clarify units in the prompt usage (staff count, annual budget, participants enrolled).
examples: Medium (50–150 staff)
Cohort size: 25 participants
Small organization — annual budget under $250,000
validationRules: required when used to determine scale
encourage standardized formats (e.g., Small/Medium/Large or exact numbers with units)
if numeric expected, supply number and unit separately

enhancedVariables.name: LIST_DEPARTMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: A comma-separated list or short bullet list of the organization's departments or teams relevant to the template (e.g., Programs, Development, Finance).
examples: Programs, Development, Finance, Operations, Volunteer Services
Education; Advocacy; Grants; Communications

Youth Programs
Donor Relations
HR
IT

enhancedVariables.name: ENTRY_LEVEL_ROLES
enhancedVariables.description: Common entry-level job or volunteer roles within the organization used for recruiting, onboarding, or role guidance.
examples: Program Assistant, Volunteer Coordinator Trainee, Outreach Intern
Client Intake Worker, Food Pantry Assistant, Administrative Support
Data Entry Clerk, Youth Mentor (volunteer), Event Usher
validationRules: provide role title and brief context if possible

enhancedVariables.name: LEADERSHIP_ROLES
enhancedVariables.description: Senior or leadership positions within the organization (e.g., Executive Director, Program Director, Board Chair) referenced for governance, sign-off, or escalation paths.
examples: Executive Director
Director of Programs
Board Chair / Treasurer
validationRules: indicate person or vacant if relevant

enhancedVariables.name: GOVERNANCE_STRUCTURE
enhancedVariables.description: A short summary of the organization's governance model (e.g., Board-led, advisory council, hybrid), including key oversight bodies and decision-making lines.
examples: Board of Directors (9 members) provides strategic oversight; Executive Director manages operations.
Advisory Council with sector experts; decisions routed to the Board for approval.
Federated model: central nonprofit with regional affiliate boards and local directors.
validationRules: required for policy/procedure and governance templates
prefer clarity on board size, decision authority, and reporting lines

enhancedVariables.name: LIST_POLICY_DOCUMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: A summarized, staff-facing list of the organization's key policies and where to find them (titles and brief purpose). Multiple documents are expected to be listed, e.g., HR, finance, safety, confidentiality.
examples: Employee Handbook — covers onboarding, leave, code of conduct (stored in HR Drive /Policies/Employee_Handbook.pdf)
Expense Reimbursement Policy — rules for travel and expense approval (Finance Portal > Policies > Expense_Reimbursement.pdf)
Child Protection Policy — mandatory procedures for safeguarding minors (Shared Drive /Programs/Safeguarding/Child_Protection.pdf)
validationRules: Required: At least one policy listed
Encourage inclusion of document title and storage location/URL

enhancedVariables.name: APPROVAL_PROCESS
enhancedVariables.description: A concise description of the standard approval workflow for the policy or action referenced (who approves, steps, and typical timeline).
examples: Purchase approvals: Staff request → Supervisor review (2 business days) → Finance approval → PO issued
Program content changes: Program Manager drafts → Director reviews → Executive signs off within 5 business days
Hiring approvals: Recruiter posts role → Hiring manager shortlists → HR conducts checks → CEO final approval
validationRules: Should mention approver roles and expected timeframes

enhancedVariables.name: UPDATE_FREQUENCY
enhancedVariables.description: How often the policy, document, or calendar is reviewed or updated (recurrence cadence used for scheduling reviews or communications).
examples: Annually (every January) — full policy review and board sign-off
Quarterly — program reporting template updated each quarter
As needed — emergency procedures reviewed after any incident
validationRules: If 'Other' selected, require explanation in adjacent textarea

enhancedVariables.name: EXCEPTION_APPROVERS
enhancedVariables.description: List of named roles or individuals authorized to approve exceptions to standard policies or procedures, and any limits on their authority.
examples: Finance Director (approvals up to $5,000), CFO (above $5,000)
Program Director for timeline exceptions up to 30 days; Executive Director for longer extensions
HR Manager for paid time-off exceptions; CEO for contract exceptions
validationRules: Optional but recommended when policies allow exceptions
If monetary limits mentioned, ensure numeric values are formatted (e.g., $5,000)

enhancedVariables.name: HR_CONTACT
enhancedVariables.description: Primary HR contact information (name, role, phone and/or email) for staff to reach about policies, payroll, benefits, or HR processes.
examples: Aisha Khan, HR Manager — aisha.khan@nonprofit.org — (555) 123-4567
HR Helpdesk — hr@nonprofit.org — (555) 800-9000 (Mon–Fri 9am–5pm)
John Lee, Director of People & Culture — john.lee@nonprofit.org — ext. 201
validationRules: Include name and at least one contact method (email or phone)
Email must be valid format; phone numbers should follow E.164 or local format

enhancedVariables.name: FINANCE_CONTACT
enhancedVariables.description: Primary finance contact for questions about budgets, reimbursements, purchase orders, and financial policies (name, role, email/phone).
examples: Maria Gomez, Finance Director — maria.gomez@nonprofit.org — (555) 222-3344
Accounts Payable — ap@nonprofit.org — upload invoices via Finance Portal
Treasurer (board contact) — treasurer@nonprofit.org — for grant budget approvals
validationRules: Include role and at least one contact method
Email validation and phone format checks

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_CONTACT
enhancedVariables.description: Primary contact for questions about program delivery, participant eligibility, or service schedules (name, role, phone/email).
examples: Samantha Ortiz, Program Manager — samantha.ortiz@nonprofit.org — (555) 444-7788
Intake Team — intake@nonprofit.org — use this email for referrals and eligibility questions
Youth Services Coordinator — youth@nonprofit.org — drop-in hours Tue/Thu 10am–3pm
validationRules: Include availability or office hours if relevant

enhancedVariables.name: LEGAL_CONTACT
enhancedVariables.description: Contact information for the organization's legal advisor or counsel for questions about compliance, contracts, or legal risk.
examples: Outside Counsel: Baker & Partners — legal@bakerlaw.com — (555) 999-1010
In-house Counsel: Priya Rao, General Counsel — priya.rao@nonprofit.org — ext. 305
Legal Intake: legal@nonprofit.org — for contract reviews and NDAs
validationRules: Include name/firm and at least one contact method
If providing external counsel, include any retainer or approval notes

enhancedVariables.name: EXECUTIVE_CONTACT
enhancedVariables.description: Primary executive leader contact (CEO/Executive Director) information for escalations or official approvals (name, title, email/phone).
examples: Karen Mills, Executive Director — karen.mills@nonprofit.org — (555) 666-7777
Interim CEO: Marcus Lee — marcus.lee@nonprofit.org — for strategic approvals
Executive Office: exec.office@nonprofit.org — use for meeting requests and escalations
validationRules: Include title and at least one contact method

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_HR_PORTAL
enhancedVariables.description: A direct URL to the organization's HR portal or intranet page where staff can access HR resources, forms, and benefits information.
examples: https://intranet.nonprofit.org/hr
https://workplace.nonprofit.org/employee-portal (login required)
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/HR_Portal
validationRules: Must be a valid URL starting with http:// or https://
If internal access required, note 'login required' in adjacent text

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_ANNUAL_CALENDAR
enhancedVariables.description: URL to the organization's master annual calendar with key dates (board meetings, reporting deadlines, program cycles, holidays).
examples: https://calendar.nonprofit.org/annual-calendar-2025
Google Calendar shared link: https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0?cid=example@group.calendar.google.com
Internal SharePoint calendar: https://sharepoint.nonprofit.org/teams/calendar/annual

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_COVERAGE_PLANNING_TEMPLATE
enhancedVariables.description: URL to the coverage or staffing planning template used to plan shift coverage, on-call schedules, or program staffing.
examples: https://drive.google.com/coverage-planning-template
https://intranet.nonprofit.org/templates/coverage-planning.xlsx
SharePoint: /Templates/Staff_Coverage_Planner
validationRules: Must be a valid URL if provided
Include file type or instructions if template requires specific software

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_FORM
enhancedVariables.description: Generic URL placeholder for any relevant form referenced in the policy (e.g., incident report, leave request, intake form).
examples: https://forms.nonprofit.org/incident-report
https://forms.office.com/r/LeaveRequestForm
https://drive.nonprofit.org/forms/client_intake_form.pdf
validationRules: Must be a valid URL when provided
If form is internal, indicate access restrictions

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_PURCHASE_REQUEST_FORM
enhancedVariables.description: Direct link to the organization's purchase request or procurement form used to initiate purchases and obtain approvals.
examples: https://procurement.nonprofit.org/purchase-request
Purchase Request Form (Google): https://forms.gle/purchase-request
Internal ERP link: https://erp.nonprofit.org/purchase-requests/new
validationRules: If form requires login, note authentication requirement

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_EXPENSE_REPORT_TEMPLATE
enhancedVariables.description: URL to the official expense report template employees use to submit reimbursements, with guidance on receipts and allowable expenses.
examples: https://drive.nonprofit.org/templates/expense_report.xlsx
https://finance.nonprofit.org/forms/expense-reimbursement
Concur link: https://www.concursolutions.com/expenseReportForm
validationRules: Include notes about required attachments (receipts) if applicable

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_APPROVED_VENDOR_LIST
enhancedVariables.description: URL linking to the organization's current list of pre-approved vendors and suppliers used for purchasing, contracting, or in-kind procurement.
examples: https://nonprofit.org/resources/approved-vendors-2025.pdf
https://drive.google.com/file/d/approved-vendors-list/view?usp=sharing
https://intranet.nonprofit.local/policies/approved-vendors
validationRules: Must be a valid URL (http or https)
If internal link, allow intranet hostnames

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_PERFORMANCE_DOCUMENTATION_FORM
enhancedVariables.description: URL to the form staff use to document performance issues, corrective actions, or employee performance reviews.
examples: https://nonprofit.org/forms/performance-documentation
https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=perfdoc123
https://intranet.nonprofit.local/hr/performance-documentation-form
validationRules: Ensure access permissions are appropriate for intended audience

enhancedVariables.name: LINK_TO_COACHING_CONVERSATION_GUIDE
enhancedVariables.description: URL to an internal guide or checklist to help managers conduct coaching conversations with staff or volunteers (e.g., one-on-one guides, feedback frameworks).
examples: https://nonprofit.org/hr/coaching-conversation-guide.pdf
https://sharepoint.nonprofit.org/hr/coaching-guides/one-on-one
https://nonprofit.docs/coaching-framework
validationRules: Optional but recommended for manager-facing templates
Check that link is accessible to intended user group

enhancedVariables.name: POLICY_DOCUMENT
enhancedVariables.description: Reference (URL or filename) to the specific policy document being cited or provided, such as a volunteer policy, safety policy, or HR policy.
examples: Volunteer_Handbook_2024.pdf
https://nonprofit.org/policies/child-safeguarding-policy
SharePoint:/Policies/Expense_Reimbursement_Policy.docx
validationRules: Required when responding to policy questions
If URL provided, must be valid; if file name, ensure file exists in org repository

enhancedVariables.name: VOLUNTEER_COORDINATOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the staff member responsible for coordinating volunteers for a program or event.
examples: Maria Gonzalez
Aisha Thompson
Jordan Lee
validationRules: Allow letters, spaces, hyphens, and apostrophes

enhancedVariables.name: COORDINATOR_EMAIL
enhancedVariables.description: Email address of the volunteer coordinator or primary contact for volunteer inquiries.
examples: volunteer.coordinator@nonprofit.org
m.gonzalez@nonprofit.org
volunteers@nonprofit.org
validationRules: Must be a valid email format
Prefer organization domain; max length 254 characters

enhancedVariables.name: COORDINATOR_PHONE
enhancedVariables.description: Primary phone number (desk or mobile) for the volunteer coordinator or contact person.
validationRules: Must be a valid phone number format (E.164 recommended)

enhancedVariables.name: PRIMARY_IMPACT
enhancedVariables.description: Short statement describing the main impact or outcome the program or volunteer role aims to achieve (the primary benefit to clients or community).
examples: Improve food security for 200 families monthly
Increase high-school graduation rates in our service area
Provide weekly companionship to older adults to reduce isolation
validationRules: Avoid jargon; use plain language describing a measurable outcome when possible

enhancedVariables.name: NUMBER_OF_VOLUNTEERS
enhancedVariables.description: Planned or current number of volunteers needed or assigned to a program, event, or shift.
validationRules: Optional upper limit depending on program (e.g., <= 1000)

enhancedVariables.name: VOLUNTEER_HOURS
enhancedVariables.description: Typical or expected number of hours a volunteer will commit per shift, week, or project (can be a range or average).
examples: 3 hours per shift
5–10 hours per month
2 hours weekly
validationRules: Accept numeric values, ranges, and short descriptive phrases
If numeric-only mode used, allow decimal hours >= 0

enhancedVariables.name: BRIEF_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: Concise summary (1–2 sentences) describing the volunteer role, service, or program for use in communications or listings.
examples: Help sort and pack food donations at our community pantry each Saturday morning.
Mentor local high-school students in weekly after-school tutoring sessions.
Support administrative tasks, including data entry and donor thank-you notes, in our main office.
validationRules: Should be written in plain language and role-focused

enhancedVariables.name: MINIMUM_AGE
enhancedVariables.description: Minimum age required to participate in the volunteer role or program, including any conditional allowances (e.g., with guardian supervision).
examples: 16+ (with parental consent for 16–17 year olds)
12+ when supervised by an adult volunteer
validationRules: Required for roles with age restrictions
Accept numeric ages with optional qualifiers (e.g., 16+, 18+ with training)
Ensure compliance with local child protection laws if under 18

enhancedVariables.name: TIME_COMMITMENT
enhancedVariables.description: Specific scheduling expectations for the role: how often and for how long volunteers are expected to serve (e.g., shift length, frequency, or program duration).
examples: One 4-hour shift every Saturday for 6 months
2 hours weekly for a 12-week tutoring session
Occasional events (2–3 times per year) with 6–8 hour shifts
validationRules: Required for scheduling and volunteer agreements
Accept descriptive phrases or structured values (e.g., '4 hours/weekly')
If using dates, validate date formats and logical ranges

enhancedVariables.name: TRAINING_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: List of mandatory or recommended training sessions, certifications, or background checks volunteers must complete before or during service.
examples: Mandatory: Volunteer orientation (2 hours) and background check
First aid certification required within first month
Online child safeguarding module (30 minutes) and on-site shadowing
validationRules: Required for roles with certifications or legal requirements
Specify if training is mandatory or optional and include expected timeline

enhancedVariables.name: REQUIRED_SKILLS
enhancedVariables.description: Key skills or qualifications needed to perform the volunteer role effectively (could include language skills, technical abilities, certifications, or soft skills).
examples: Bilingual (English/Spanish) and strong customer service skills
Comfortable lifting up to 25 lbs and basic inventory tracking
Experience mentoring teenagers and patience with learning differences
validationRules: List skills as short phrases or bullets; note whether skills are required or preferred

enhancedVariables.name: BRIEF_EXPLANATION
enhancedVariables.description: A short, plain-language summary explaining the purpose or function of a volunteer program or process that can be used in FAQs or onboarding materials.
examples: Volunteers assist at our weekly food distribution to help pack boxes and greet guests.
This program connects trained volunteers with local seniors for weekly companionship visits.
A one-day event where volunteers prepare hygiene kits for distribution at community shelters.

enhancedVariables.name: BRIEF_MISSION_STATEMENT
enhancedVariables.description: A concise mission statement (1–2 sentences) describing the nonprofit's overarching purpose and primary beneficiaries, suitable for public-facing communications.
examples: We empower low-income families by providing access to nutritious food and job training.
Our mission is to ensure every child has a safe place to learn and grow through mentorship and tutoring.
We mobilize volunteers to reduce homelessness by providing emergency shelter and re‑housing services.

enhancedVariables.name: APPLICATION_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: A URL that directs prospective volunteers or participants to the online application or sign-up form for a program or role.
examples: https://nonprofit.org/volunteer/apply
https://secure.volunteerportal.com/org123/signup
https://forms.google.com/our-program-application

enhancedVariables.name: ORIENTATION_SCHEDULE
enhancedVariables.description: Details about upcoming orientation sessions including dates, times, locations (or virtual links), and duration to help volunteers plan attendance.
examples: Monthly in-person orientation: First Saturday of each month, 10:00–12:00 at 123 Main St.
Virtual orientation sessions every Tuesday at 6:00 PM via Zoom (link emailed after registration).
Next orientation: June 14, 2025, 9:00 AM–11:30 AM at Community Center Room B.

enhancedVariables.name: MINIMUM_COMMITMENT
enhancedVariables.description: The minimum time or engagement expected from volunteers (e.g., hours per week, months of service) that sets clear expectations for participation.
examples: Minimum commitment: 3 hours per week for at least 3 months.
One-time event volunteers must commit to a 6-hour shift.
Ongoing mentors should meet with their mentee for 1 hour weekly for 6 months.
validationRules: prefer format examples (e.g., '3 hours/week for 3 months')

enhancedVariables.name: CANCELLATION_NOTICE_PERIOD
enhancedVariables.description: The required lead time volunteers should provide when canceling a scheduled shift or commitment (expressed in hours or days).
examples: Please provide at least 24 hours' notice before cancelling a scheduled shift.
For weekly commitments, notify your coordinator 3 business days in advance.
Event cancellations require 72 hours' notice to allow reassignments.

enhancedVariables.name: RESCHEDULING_METHOD
enhancedVariables.description: Preferred process or channels volunteers should use to reschedule shifts (e.g., online portal, email, phone) and any steps required.
examples: Reschedule through the volunteer portal: login → My Shifts → Change Shift.
Email the scheduler at shifts@nonprofit.org with your name, original shift, and requested new time.
Call or text the scheduling coordinator at (555) 123-4567 to arrange a different date.

enhancedVariables.name: SUBSTITUTE_POLICY
enhancedVariables.description: Rules allowing volunteers to arrange substitutes, including approval requirements, notification steps, and any restrictions.
examples: Volunteers may find a substitute approved by the coordinator; substitute must be background-checked.
No substitutes allowed for supervised roles—notify coordinator 48 hours before to request a reassignment.
You may swap shifts with another registered volunteer via the portal; both volunteers must confirm the swap.

enhancedVariables.name: PORTAL_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: The web address for the volunteer management portal where users can sign up, view schedules, and manage their profiles.
examples: https://portal.nonprofit.org/login
https://scheduling.volunteerhub.com/orgXYZ
https://signup.retina.org/volunteer-portal

enhancedVariables.name: SCHEDULER_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the person responsible for scheduling volunteers or managing shift assignments, used for contact and attribution.
examples: Aisha Rodriguez, Volunteer Scheduling Coordinator
Mark Chen, Program Operations Lead
Dana Patel, Volunteer Manager

enhancedVariables.name: SCHEDULER_EMAIL
enhancedVariables.description: Email address of the scheduling contact where volunteers send questions, cancellation notices, or rescheduling requests.
examples: volunteer.scheduling@nonprofit.org
scheduling@communitycenter.org
shifts@nonprofit.org

enhancedVariables.name: SCHEDULER_PHONE
enhancedVariables.description: Phone number (voice or text) for the scheduling coordinator used for urgent communications or last-minute changes.

enhancedVariables.name: REVIEW_TIMEFRAME
enhancedVariables.description: How long reviews (application reviews, volunteer approvals, or program assessments) typically take, stated as a time range or target SLA.
examples: Applications reviewed within 5–7 business days.
Background reviews usually completed in 3 business days; placement within 2 weeks.
Program intake review: up to 10 business days.
validationRules: format: number + 'days'|'business days'|'weeks' or range (e.g., '3-5 business days')

enhancedVariables.name: BACKGROUND_CHECK_TIMEFRAME
enhancedVariables.description: Estimated duration for completing background checks required for volunteers, often given as a range and noting possible delays.
examples: Background checks typically take 3–5 business days.
May take up to 2 weeks for out-of-state records to clear.
Instant ID checks completed same day; full checks 7–10 business days.

enhancedVariables.name: NOTIFICATION_METHOD
enhancedVariables.description: Primary channels used to notify volunteers and participants (e.g., email, SMS, phone call, app notifications) and any guidance on which is preferred.
examples: Primary notifications via email; urgent shift changes sent by SMS.
We use our portal to post schedule changes and email for confirmations.
Automated reminders are sent 48 hours before shifts via text and email.
validationRules: if 'sms' selected, ensure phone number is provided

enhancedVariables.name: HANDBOOK_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: URL linking to the volunteer or staff handbook that outlines policies, procedures, and expectations for program participants and volunteers.
examples: https://www.example-nonprofit.org/volunteer-handbook.pdf
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1a2b3c/view?usp=sharing
https://intranet.example.org/handbooks/2025_volunteer_handbook.html
validationRules: must be a valid URL (http or https)

enhancedVariables.name: VIDEO_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: Web link to an orientation or training video used for onboarding volunteers, staff, or program participants.
examples: https://youtu.be/abcd1234
https://vimeo.com/123456789
https://www.example-nonprofit.org/training/volunteer-orientation.mp4
validationRules: must be a valid URL (http or https)
allow common video hosts (youtube, vimeo) or direct file links

enhancedVariables.name: REQUIRED_DOCUMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: A short list or bullet text of documents volunteers or clients must submit before participation (e.g., ID, background check, consent forms).
examples: Government ID, Signed Liability Waiver, Completed Background Check Form
Proof of income, Signed service agreement, Photo ID
Volunteer application, TB test results, Emergency contact form

enhancedVariables.name: FOLLOW_UP_TIMEFRAME
enhancedVariables.description: The timeframe in which staff or volunteers should follow up with an applicant, donor, or client (e.g., within 3 business days).
examples: Within 3 business days
48 hours after intake
By the end of the following week (5 business days)
validationRules: prefer human-readable timeframe (e.g., '48 hours', '3 business days')

enhancedVariables.name: ONBOARDING_CONTACT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Primary contact person responsible for onboarding new volunteers or participants, used for questions and coordination.
examples: Maria Lopez, Volunteer Coordinator
Sam Patel (Program Onboarding Specialist)
J. Nguyen — Volunteer Services Lead
validationRules: letters, spaces, commas, and common punctuation allowed

enhancedVariables.name: CONTACT_EMAIL
enhancedVariables.description: Email address for inquiries related to the template context (events, onboarding, program support).
examples: volunteers@example-nonprofit.org
events@communityhelp.org
intake@services.example.org
validationRules: must be a valid email format (local@domain)

enhancedVariables.name: CONTACT_PHONE
enhancedVariables.description: Phone number for the contact person or office handling questions, registrations, or support.
validationRules: must be a valid phone number (E.164 preferred or local formats allowed)

enhancedVariables.name: VOLUNTEER_ROLE_#
enhancedVariables.description: Name of a volunteer role or position. Multiple numbered instances are expected (e.g., VOLUNTEER_ROLE_1, _2, _3) to list several positions.
examples: Food Pantry Assistant
Event Registration Volunteer
Mentor — Youth Tutoring Program
validationRules: disallow control characters; allow letters, numbers, punctuation

enhancedVariables.name: ONBOARDING_STEP_#
enhancedVariables.description: Ordered step in the onboarding process. Multiple numbered instances are expected (e.g., ONBOARDING_STEP_1, _2, _3) to describe the sequence.
examples: Complete online application and submit references
Attend 60-minute orientation session
Submit background check and signed waiver

enhancedVariables.name: BENEFIT_#
enhancedVariables.description: A listed benefit or incentive for volunteers or participants; multiple numbered instances are expected (BENEFIT_1, _2, _3).
examples: Letter of recommendation after 100 service hours
Free training and certification provided
Volunteer appreciation events and small stipend

enhancedVariables.name: POLICY_#
enhancedVariables.description: Short reference or title of an organizational policy relevant to the template (e.g., confidentiality, attendance). Multiple numbered instances expected.
examples: Confidentiality and Data Handling Policy
Attendance and Punctuality Policy
Child Safeguarding Policy
validationRules: each policy title max length 200 characters
avoid URLs; use concise policy titles

enhancedVariables.name: DATE_#
enhancedVariables.description: Specific calendar date used in messages or scheduling; multiple numbered instances (DATE_1, DATE_2) may be used for start/end or event dates.
validationRules: DATE_1 can be before or equal to DATE_2 when representing ranges

enhancedVariables.name: TIME_#
enhancedVariables.description: Specific time value for events, meetings, or deadlines; multiple instances (TIME_1, TIME_2) allow distinct start/end or check-in times.
validationRules: required when used with DATE variables

enhancedVariables.name: VALUE_#
enhancedVariables.description: Core organizational value or principle used to personalize communications; multiple numbered instances expected (VALUE_1..VALUE_3).
examples: Equity — we prioritize fair access to services
Community-driven — programs shaped by participant voices
Transparency in reporting and use of funds
validationRules: optional but recommended for mission-aligned messaging
avoid long paragraphs; keep to a single principle or short phrase

enhancedVariables.name: SERVICE_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The specific program or service being referenced (e.g., food distribution, counseling) to tailor communications and routing.
examples: Food Pantry Pickup
Case Management — Housing Support
After-school Tutoring Program
validationRules: should match an existing program/service code or name
if free-text allowed, max length 100 characters

enhancedVariables.name: LIST_KEY_PROGRAMS
enhancedVariables.description: A concise list of the nonprofit's primary programs or service lines offered to clients or the community. Multiple program names and a one-line purpose for each are expected.
examples: After-School Tutoring — academic support for K–8 students from 3–6pm
Transitional Housing Program — temporary housing and case management for families experiencing homelessness
Workforce Readiness Workshops — job skills, resume support, and placement assistance for adults
validationRules: Prefer bullet or newline-separated entries (one program per line)

enhancedVariables.name: ELIGIBILITY_OVERVIEW
enhancedVariables.description: A short statement describing who qualifies for services, including key eligibility criteria such as age, income limits, residency, or referral requirements.
examples: Open to residents of County X earning below 200% of the federal poverty level; proof of residency and income required
Services available to youth ages 13–24 who identify as LGBTQ+; self-referral accepted
Immigrant legal aid available to individuals within 180 days of arrival or with documented immigration status issues
validationRules: Should mention at least one eligibility criterion (age, location, income, referral)

enhancedVariables.name: SERVICE_DELIVERY_MODEL
enhancedVariables.description: Describes how services are provided (e.g., in-person, virtual, hybrid, outreach), including delivery format, frequency, and typical staff roles involved.
examples: Hybrid model — weekly in-person counseling sessions with telehealth options and monthly community outreach events
Mobile outreach van — weekly stops in three neighborhoods offering harm reduction supplies and case management
Virtual case management — phone and video appointments, digital resource portal, and quarterly in-person check-ins
validationRules: Allowed values: in-person, virtual, hybrid, mobile/outreach, other
If 'other' selected, require a 50–300 character description

enhancedVariables.name: SERVICE_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: Geographic area(s) the nonprofit serves, including cities, counties, neighborhoods, or regions and any service boundary notes (e.g., travel limits).
examples: City of Riverside and surrounding unincorporated areas (zip codes 92501–92509)
Tri-county area: Jefferson, Lincoln, and Monroe counties; remote services statewide by appointment
Neighborhood-focused: Northside district outreach only; transportation provided within 5 miles
validationRules: If multiple areas, separate with commas; include zip codes when relevant

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_PARTNERS
enhancedVariables.description: List of primary partner organizations, agencies, or community groups the nonprofit collaborates with to deliver services or amplify impact.
examples: County Health Department — co-located vaccination clinics and data sharing
Local School District — referral pipeline for after-school program enrollment
Shelter Network Coalition — coordinated intake and emergency housing placements
validationRules: Prefer one partner per line with a brief note on the partnership role

enhancedVariables.name: FUNDING_LIMITATIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Explanation of funding restrictions or constraints that affect service availability, such as restricted grants, funding cycles, or ineligible costs.
examples: General operating funds cannot be used for capital building projects; capital campaigns funded separately
Grant X restricts support to emergency rental assistance only, not ongoing case management
Funding limited to residents under 60 years old; younger adults are ineligible under current grant
validationRules: Required if program relies on restricted funding
If restrictions exist, specify impacted services and duration (if temporary)

enhancedVariables.name: CAPACITY_CHALLENGES
enhancedVariables.description: Current operational constraints limiting service scale or quality, such as staffing shortages, facility limits, waitlists, or technology gaps.
examples: Limited bilingual staff leading to a two-week wait for Spanish-language counseling
Facility capacity of 30 clients per day; overflow referred to partner agencies
Case manager shortage — typical caseloads exceed recommended ratio of 1:25
validationRules: If waitlists exist, include average wait time

enhancedVariables.name: CULTURAL_FRAMEWORK
enhancedVariables.description: The organization's approach to culturally responsive practice, indicating frameworks, community norms honored, language access, and inclusion strategies.
examples: Trauma-informed and culturally responsive model with on-site interpreters and materials in five languages
Indigenous-led program incorporating local traditions, elders' advisory board, and land acknowledgements
Practice guided by racial equity framework; staff receive quarterly anti-bias training
validationRules: If specific languages or cultural practices are referenced, list them

enhancedVariables.name: TRAUMA_APPROACH
enhancedVariables.description: Specific methods and safeguards used to provide trauma-informed care, including staff training, safety planning, and confidential spaces.
examples: All frontline staff complete a 16-hour trauma-informed care training; private intake rooms and voluntary participation emphasized
Integrates EMDR and strengths-based therapy; crisis response protocol available 24/7
Safety-first approach: anonymous intake option, mandatory reporting procedures explained upfront, and survivor-centered referrals
validationRules: Should state training frequency and any 24/7 supports if available

enhancedVariables.name: COMMON_BARRIERS
enhancedVariables.description: Typical obstacles clients face when accessing services (transportation, childcare, documentation, language), used to design mitigation strategies.
examples: Lack of reliable transportation and childcare prevents clients from attending weekday appointments
Undocumented clients fear accessing services due to immigration status concerns
Limited digital literacy and unreliable internet hinder participation in virtual programs
validationRules: If known, include prevalence or estimated percentage affected

enhancedVariables.name: CLIENT_NEEDS
enhancedVariables.description: Primary needs of the client population the nonprofit serves (e.g., housing, food security, mental health), prioritized if possible.
examples: Immediate needs: emergency shelter, rental assistance; mid-term: employment support and skills training
Top needs: culturally competent mental health services and trauma counseling for survivors
Clients commonly require help with benefits navigation, legal referrals, and language interpretation
validationRules: Prefer prioritized list (immediate vs. long-term needs)

enhancedVariables.name: SUPPORT_PROTOCOLS
enhancedVariables.description: Standard procedures and escalation steps staff follow to support clients, including intake, referrals, emergency response, and confidentiality rules.
examples: Intake protocol: phone triage, eligibility check, risk assessment, and assignment to case manager within 48 hours
Referral protocol: warm handoff to mental health partner with follow-up within one week and documentation in client file
Crisis response: on-call counselor available 24/7; mandatory reporting and safety planning documented
validationRules: Include response time expectations for each step where applicable

enhancedVariables.name: RESOURCE_DATABASE
enhancedVariables.description: A summarized inventory of community resources and referral partners (food banks, legal aid, medical clinics) including contact details and service notes.
examples: Northside Food Pantry — 555-0123, provides weekly groceries and emergency boxes; open Mon/Wed 9–3
Community Legal Aid — online intake form, eviction defense for low-income tenants; Spanish services available
Mobile Health Clinic — schedules posted monthly; offers vaccinations and basic primary care at outreach sites
validationRules: Prefer structured entries: Name — contact — services — hours; include verification date if available

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_HISTORY
enhancedVariables.description: Summary of a donor's past interactions with the nonprofit, including giving amounts, dates, campaigns supported, and engagement touchpoints.
examples: Jane Doe — cumulative giving $4,200 (annual gala 2019–2023), monthly donor since Jan 2022, volunteer at events
Acme Corp — $25,000 corporate sponsorship in 2024 for workforce program; matched employee gifts in 2023
John Smith — one-time $500 donation in 2020; attended donor appreciation event in 2021; no further contact
validationRules: Include dates and amounts when known; protect PII and follow privacy policies

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_INTERESTS
enhancedVariables.description: Areas or program types a donor prefers to support (e.g., youth education, housing, healthcare), used to personalize outreach and asks.
examples: Interested in early childhood education and scholarship funds; prefers program updates and site visits
Focus on homelessness prevention and rapid rehousing; open to funding pilot initiatives
Supports health equity and immigrant services; values impact metrics and testimonies
validationRules: Allowed values: education, housing, healthcare, workforce, arts, environment, general operating, other
If 'other' selected, require a 50–150 character description

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_PROFESSION
enhancedVariables.description: The donor's current profession or job title, used to personalize outreach and identify potential giving capacity or volunteer expertise.
examples: Pediatric Nurse
Senior Software Engineer
Small Business Owner (Bakery)
validationRules: allow letters, numbers, spaces and common punctuation (commas, hyphens, parentheses)

enhancedVariables.name: COMMUNICATION_PREFERENCES
enhancedVariables.description: The donor's preferred channels and frequencies for communications (e.g., email, phone, mail, SMS) and any opt-out flags to respect consent.
examples: Email monthly newsletters, postal mail for annual report
SMS only for event reminders; do not call
Email and phone for major campaign asks; opt-in for volunteer opportunities
validationRules: must choose at least one channel (email, phone, mail, sms)
if SMS or phone selected, phone number must be present and E.164-compatible
if mail selected, postal address must be present

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_CAPACITY
enhancedVariables.description: A brief summary of the nonprofit's operational capacity (staffing, volunteer hours, program scale) to set realistic grant asks or partnership expectations.
examples: 10 full-time staff, 150 active volunteers, serves 2,000 clients annually
Small grassroots team (3 staff), limited admin capacity, strong volunteer base for events
Medium-sized regional org: program managers in 3 cities, annual budget $1.2M
validationRules: encourage structured details (staff count, volunteer hours, annual budget)

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_CONTACT
enhancedVariables.description: Primary contact information for a donor including full name and at least one contact method used for stewardship and receipts.
examples: Maria Gomez — maria@example.org — +1-415-555-0123
John Lee, 123 Maple St, Seattle, WA 98101 — john.lee@donormail.org
Aisha Khan — prefer phone: +1-212-555-9876; alternative email a.khan@company.com
validationRules: at least one valid contact method (email or phone or postal address)
email must match standard email format if provided
phone must be E.164 or local format validated by region if provided

enhancedVariables.name: DONATION_AMOUNT
enhancedVariables.description: The monetary value of a specific donation or typical gift level used for acknowledgments, segmenting donors, and tailoring messaging.
validationRules: optional currency code specified in context (default USD)

enhancedVariables.name: TIME_PERIOD
enhancedVariables.description: A named range or single date describing the reporting, program, or donation timeframe (e.g., fiscal year, quarter, specific dates) relevant to templates and reports.
examples: Fiscal Year 2024 (July 1, 2023 – June 30, 2024)
March 15, 2025 – June 30, 2025 (Pilot program)
validationRules: prefer ISO date ranges or clear human-readable labels
if using start/end dates, validate start <= end

enhancedVariables.name: FUNDER_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The name of an institutional funder, foundation, or grant-maker to reference in applications, reports, or acknowledgement letters.
examples: The Evergreen Community Foundation
National Science & Education Trust
Acme Corporation Charitable Giving Fund
validationRules: standardize capitalization and remove special characters where possible

enhancedVariables.name: SIMILAR_ORGANIZATION
enhancedVariables.description: A comparable nonprofit organization used as a benchmark or example (by size, program model, or outcomes) when preparing proposals or strategic documents.
examples: Green Schools Network — comparable K–12 environmental education program in neighboring county
Urban Youth Mentors — similar scale after-school mentoring serving 500 youth/year
Coastal Cleanup Alliance — similar volunteer-driven model with regional chapters
validationRules: include one-line descriptor (location or reason for similarity) if possible
optional field but recommended for benchmarking

enhancedVariables.name: RESOURCE_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: A URL linking to an external resource, document, or web page (e.g., sample proposal, program evaluation, partner website) referenced in templates.
examples: https://example.org/sample-grant-application.pdf
https://localfoundation.org/funding-guidelines
https://github.com/orgs/nonprofit/strategic-plan-template
validationRules: must be a valid URL (http or https)
optional but should be accessible (check 200 OK) when used in automated workflows

enhancedVariables.name: LOCAL_NONPROFIT_CENTER
enhancedVariables.description: The local support hub or resource center (e.g., regional nonprofit center) that offers training, capacity-building, or networking relevant to the organization.
examples: Midtown Nonprofit Resource Center — Downtown City branch
County Volunteer & Nonprofit Support Hub (North County)
Tri-City Charitable Services Center — program development workshops

enhancedVariables.name: ENVIRONMENTAL_EDUCATION_NETWORK
enhancedVariables.description: The name or identifier of a network or consortium focused on environmental education that the organization is part of or can leverage for partnerships.
examples: National Environmental Education Alliance
State Outdoor Learning Network — Pacific Region
Coastal Environmental Educators Consortium
validationRules: optional; include membership role if relevant

enhancedVariables.name: LOCAL_COMMUNITY_FOUNDATION
enhancedVariables.description: The name of a community foundation serving the organization's geographic area that may provide grants, donor-advised fund support, or partnership opportunities.
examples: River Valley Community Foundation
Greater Metro Community Foundation
Countywide Giving Fund managed by City Foundation
validationRules: required location context recommended (city or county)

enhancedVariables.name: CORPORATE_PARTNER
enhancedVariables.description: A corporate sponsor or partner organization name used for sponsorship recognition, cause marketing, or in-kind support coordination.
examples: NorthStar Logistics (event sponsor)
BlueWave Technologies — pro bono software partner
Sunrise Bank — payroll giving partner
validationRules: include partnership role or type in parentheses if helpful
optional but recommended for acknowledgement templates

enhancedVariables.name: SIMILAR_FUNDED_PROGRAM
enhancedVariables.description: An example of a program that has received similar funding or demonstrates a comparable model and outcomes to strengthen grant applications.
examples: After-School STEM Lab — funded by Regional Education Trust, served 300 students annually
Healthy Meals for Seniors pilot — funded through community foundation grant (outcomes: 95% satisfaction)
Workforce Pathways Apprenticeship — corporate-funded model with 80% job placement
validationRules: include funding source and key outcomes where possible

enhancedVariables.name: FEDERAL_AGENCY
enhancedVariables.description: The name of a federal government agency (e.g., NSF, EPA, DOE) relevant to funding, compliance, or program partnerships referenced in proposals or reports.
examples: National Science Foundation (NSF)
Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
Department of Education — Office of Innovation
validationRules: use official agency name and include abbreviation where common
required when preparing federal grant templates

enhancedVariables.name: HEALTHCARE_ASSOCIATION
enhancedVariables.description: The name and brief description of a professional or trade association in the healthcare sector that the nonprofit partners with, seeks funding from, or references in materials.
examples: State Nurses Association — provides training grants and continuing education partnerships
Regional Hospital Alliance — collaborates on community health screenings
Public Health Practitioners Network — offers policy guidance and advocacy support

enhancedVariables.name: HEALTH_FOUNDATION
enhancedVariables.description: The name and short description of a philanthropic foundation focused on health that provides grants, technical assistance, or partnership opportunities to the nonprofit.
examples: Smith Family Health Foundation — funds community-based chronic disease programs
Metro Health Trust — supports maternal and child health initiatives
Greenwell Foundation for Public Health — grants for preventive care campaigns

enhancedVariables.name: HEALTHCARE_CORPORATION
enhancedVariables.description: A corporate partner or donor in the healthcare industry (e.g., hospital system, medical supplier, insurance company) that the nonprofit engages with for sponsorships, in-kind support, or program delivery.
examples: Riverview Health Systems — provides space and nurses for free clinics
MedEquip Supplies Inc. — donates medical kits for outreach events
CommunityCare Insurance — sponsors preventive health workshops

enhancedVariables.name: GRANT_PROGRAM
enhancedVariables.description: The specific grant program name or initiative being applied to or referenced (e.g., program stream, funding line, or internal grant product).
examples: Community Health Outreach Grant — small grants for neighborhood clinics
Prevention & Education Program Fund — supports school-based health education
Rapid Response COVID Relief Stream — emergency operational funding

enhancedVariables.name: FUNDING_OPPORTUNITY
enhancedVariables.description: A specific externally available grant or funding opportunity (including the funder and deadline) that the nonprofit intends to pursue or track.
examples: Healthy Communities Fund (County Health Dept) — LOI due 2025-10-15
National Prevention Grant — full proposal invited, up to $100,000
Corporate Matching Fund — rolling applications accepted monthly

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_FOCUS_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: The primary topic or issue area that a program addresses (e.g., mental health, maternal health, food security), used for targeting, communications, and evaluation.
examples: Maternal and Child Health — prenatal care and postpartum support
Behavioral Health Access — counseling and crisis referral services
Food Security & Nutrition — community pantry and meal programs

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_AUDIENCE
enhancedVariables.description: The specific population segment the program or communication is intended to reach (e.g., low-income families, seniors, veterans, Spanish-speaking parents).
examples: Low-income families with children under 5 in zip codes 02110–02120
Older adults (65+) enrolled in the community meal program
Recently arrived Spanish-speaking immigrant families

enhancedVariables.name: PRIMARY_SERVICES
enhancedVariables.description: A concise list or summary of the core services the nonprofit provides as part of a program or across the organization (e.g., case management, legal aid, counseling).
examples: Free sliding-scale counseling, group therapy, and referral coordination
Weekly mobile clinic services: immunizations, screenings, and health education
Employment readiness workshops, resume coaching, and job placement support

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_DURATION
enhancedVariables.description: The expected length or schedule of a program or service offering (e.g., number of weeks, single-session, ongoing/continuous).
examples: 12-week cohort with weekly 90-minute sessions
One-time 3-hour workshop held quarterly
Ongoing drop-in clinic operating Monday–Friday, 9am–3pm

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_RESOURCES
