enhancedVariables.description: Essential assets, tools, or supports required to run a program (e.g., staff roles, equipment, funding lines, training materials).
examples: Two licensed social workers, laptop with secure EHR, and $15,000 annual program budget
Mobile clinic van, refrigerated vaccine storage, and volunteer nurse pool
Curriculum manuals for facilitators, printed participant workbooks, and translation services

enhancedVariables.name: PARTNER_ORGANIZATIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Names and short descriptions of external partner organizations the nonprofit collaborates with for service delivery, referrals, or joint initiatives.
examples: Eastside Youth Center — provides after-school space and referrals
County Housing Authority — coordinates rental assistance vouchers
Volunteer Legal Aid Clinic — offers pro bono eviction defense

enhancedVariables.name: SUPERVISOR_ROLE
enhancedVariables.description: The title and brief responsibilities of the staff role responsible for oversight of a program, team, or volunteer cohort (e.g., Program Manager, Volunteer Coordinator).
examples: Program Manager — oversees program delivery, reporting, and staff supervision
Volunteer Coordinator — recruits, trains, and schedules volunteers
Clinical Supervisor — provides case review and clinical oversight for counselors

enhancedVariables.name: ESCALATION_PROCEDURE
enhancedVariables.description: A short description or stepwise plan describing how incidents, urgent client needs, or complaints are escalated within the organization (who to contact and timelines).
examples: If client safety risk identified: notify on-duty supervisor within 1 hour, document in incident log, and refer to emergency services if imminent danger
Unresolved service complaint: escalate to Program Director within 48 hours for review and response within 5 business days
Data breach suspicion: inform IT lead immediately, begin containment, and notify executive director within 4 hours

enhancedVariables.name: CHALLENGE_#
enhancedVariables.description: A numbered instance representing a specific challenge or barrier faced by the program, participants, or organization; multiple instances (e.g., CHALLENGE_1, CHALLENGE_2) are expected to capture several distinct issues.
examples: CHALLENGE_1: Low client retention due to transportation barriers
CHALLENGE_2: Limited bilingual staff for Spanish-speaking participants
CHALLENGE_3: Insufficient unrestricted funding for core operating costs

enhancedVariables.name: INTERNAL_RESOURCE_#
enhancedVariables.description: A numbered instance used to list internal resources the organization can use to address challenges (e.g., staff expertise, internal funds, training modules); multiple instances like INTERNAL_RESOURCE_1, _2 are expected.
examples: INTERNAL_RESOURCE_1: Transportation voucher fund (up to $50/client)
INTERNAL_RESOURCE_2: On-site Spanish-language peer support volunteers
INTERNAL_RESOURCE_3: Internal training module on trauma-informed care

enhancedVariables.name: ESCALATION_TRIGGER_#
enhancedVariables.description: A specific condition or event that should automatically escalate a participant, volunteer, donor, or staff issue to a higher-level staff member or an emergency workflow. Multiple numbered instances (1, 2, 3, ...) are expected to capture different triggers in priority order.
examples: Participant missed three consecutive mandatory sessions within 30 days
Volunteer reports suspected abuse or safety concern during program activity
Donation payment failed and donor has outstanding balance for more than 14 days
validationRules: If select='Other', require accompanying text description (textarea)
Max length 250 characters for custom trigger text

enhancedVariables.name: ISSUE_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: A concise description of the problem, complaint, or need reported by a program participant, volunteer, donor, or staff member used to triage and route support requests.
examples: Client unable to access teletherapy sessions due to login errors
Volunteer uncertain about safety procedures for home visits
Donor received incorrect acknowledgement letter with wrong gift amount
validationRules: Prohibit inclusion of sensitive personal data (SSNs) — validate and flag for secure handling

enhancedVariables.name: STAFF_SIZE
enhancedVariables.description: The total number of paid staff (or full-time equivalent staff) employed by the nonprofit, used for benchmarking, capacity planning, and tailoring recommendations.
examples: 12 (small regional nonprofit with a single program office)
85 (mid-sized nonprofit with multiple program teams and admin staff)
420 (large national nonprofit with field offices and support functions)
validationRules: Optional: allow additional field specifying 'FTE' vs 'headcount'

enhancedVariables.name: PD_BUDGET
enhancedVariables.description: The annual professional development (PD) budget allocated for staff learning, training, conferences, and capacity-building activities.
examples: $12,000 (annual PD budget for a small nonprofit)
$75,000 (mid-sized organization PD allocation across departments)
$250,000 (large organization with organization-wide learning initiatives)
validationRules: Numeric value (currency) — store as cents or integer
Optional: specify currency code if organization operates internationally

enhancedVariables.name: STRATEGIC_PRIORITIES
enhancedVariables.description: The nonprofit's current top strategic goals or priorities (e.g., program growth, equity initiatives, fundraising targets) that inform decision-making and alignment of recommendations.
examples: Expand youth mentoring program to three new counties over 24 months
Increase individual giving revenue by 25% and diversify donor base
Implement organization-wide equity and inclusion training for all staff
validationRules: Encourage listing 3–5 priorities separated by semicolons or bullets

enhancedVariables.name: TALENT_CHALLENGES
enhancedVariables.description: Key workforce or talent-related issues the organization is facing (e.g., recruitment, retention, skill gaps) used to tailor HR and training recommendations.
examples: High turnover among frontline caseworkers within first 12 months
Difficulty recruiting bilingual program managers for community sites
Limited in-house capacity for data analysis and impact measurement

enhancedVariables.name: SKILL_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: A specific competency or subject area (e.g., grant writing, trauma-informed care, monitoring & evaluation) that staff or volunteers need development in.
examples: Grant writing and donor stewardship
Trauma-informed client engagement for youth-serving staff
Data visualization and impact reporting using Tableau
validationRules: Required when requesting a training plan
Provide an 'Other' option with max 100 characters for custom entries
If select from taxonomy, ensure mapping to internal learning resources

enhancedVariables.name: STAFF_ROLE
enhancedVariables.description: The job title or functional role of the staff member (e.g., program coordinator, development director) for whom guidance, training, or assignment is intended.
examples: Program Coordinator — Youth Services
Development Director
Volunteer Manager
validationRules: Required when personalized guidance is requested
Avoid special characters beyond standard punctuation

enhancedVariables.name: CURRENT_SKILL_LEVEL
enhancedVariables.description: A short descriptor or level indicating the individual's present proficiency in the relevant skill area (e.g., beginner, intermediate, advanced) used to tailor recommended learning steps.
examples: Beginner — limited experience creating grant proposals
Intermediate — comfortable with basic M&E frameworks
Advanced — proficient in donor portfolio management
validationRules: If 'Not sure' selected, recommend a skills assessment

enhancedVariables.name: CAREER_GOALS
enhancedVariables.description: Short-term or long-term professional objectives of a staff member (e.g., move into leadership, become a grant specialist) to align development plans and mentorship.
examples: Move into program leadership within three years
Develop expertise to become the organization's grant writer
Gain skills to transition into monitoring & evaluation roles
validationRules: Optional but recommended for personalized plans
Encourage specific, time-bound goals where possible

enhancedVariables.name: TITLE
enhancedVariables.description: A short label or heading used in communications or role listings — could be a volunteer opportunity title, job title, or document heading depending on context.
examples: After-School Homework Support Volunteer
Community Outreach Coordinator
Mobile Pantry Volunteer — Weekend Shift
validationRules: Required for listings and placement matching

enhancedVariables.name: MONTH
enhancedVariables.description: A calendar month used for scheduling, reporting, or indicating when an event or placement is planned (represented as full month name or month number).
examples: September
03 (March)
November 2025 (when combined with year field)
validationRules: Acceptable values: January–December or month number 01–12
If used with a year, validate combined date not in past for future events

enhancedVariables.name: BRACKETED_VARIABLES
enhancedVariables.description: A placeholder token or set of placeholders (often shown in square brackets) that represent multiple interchangeable pieces of data — used to indicate where merge fields (e.g., [FirstName], [CaseID]) will be inserted in templates or documents.
examples: [VolunteerName], [ShiftDate], [SiteAddress]
[DonorFirstName] [DonorLastName], [GiftAmount], [ReceiptDate]
[CaseID], [ParticipantFirstName], [NextAppointment]
validationRules: Must follow pattern: square brackets enclosing alphanumeric and underscore characters, e.g. \[A-Za-z0-9_\]+
Warn if placeholders referenced in template are missing from provided data set
Max 2000 characters when listing multiple placeholders

enhancedVariables.name: VOLUNTEER_PROFILE
enhancedVariables.description: A brief summary of a volunteer's relevant attributes — skills, availability, restrictions, experience, and preferences — used for placement and matching.
examples: Bilingual (Spanish/English), available weekdays 9am–1pm, experience with youth mentorship
Experienced driver with background check cleared, available weekends only
Skilled in bookkeeping, remote volunteering preferred, willing to assist with donor acknowledgement
validationRules: Do not include sensitive personal information (e.g., SSN); flag if such data appears

enhancedVariables.name: AVAILABLE_POSITIONS
enhancedVariables.description: A list or count of current open volunteer or staff positions, including brief role descriptors and key requirements for each vacancy.
examples: 3 After-School Tutors — weekday afternoons, basic background check required
1 Volunteer Driver — valid license, weekend availability, insured vehicle
Communications Intern (remote) — social media support, 10–15 hrs/week
validationRules: Maximum 2000 characters when listing multiple positions
Each position entry should include title and at least one requirement or time commitment

enhancedVariables.name: CLIENT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of the client, service recipient, or external contact who is the subject of the communication or appointment.
examples: Maria Lopez
James R. Carter
Aisha Mohammed

enhancedVariables.name: APPOINTMENT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The specific kind of appointment or meeting being scheduled (used to drive tone, required prep, and booking options).
examples: Intake assessment
Case management check-in
Volunteer orientation

enhancedVariables.name: MEETING_PURPOSE
enhancedVariables.description: A short phrase describing the main objective or agenda item for the meeting to set expectations for participants.
examples: Discuss emergency housing referral
Review quarterly program outcomes
Plan community outreach event

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_ROLE
enhancedVariables.description: The title or role of the staff member representing the nonprofit in the communication or meeting (used for sign-off and context).
examples: Client Services Coordinator
Program Director
Volunteer Manager

enhancedVariables.name: CALENDLY_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: A direct scheduling URL (e.g., Calendly or other booking tool) for recipients to choose an available appointment slot.
examples: https://calendly.com/greenhope/intake
https://calendly.com/educonnect/volunteer-onboard
https://booking.charity.org/staff/jane-doe

enhancedVariables.name: RELEVANT_DOCUMENT
enhancedVariables.description: Name or link to a document the client should review or bring to the meeting (consent form, intake packet, agenda, etc.).
examples: Intake Packet (PDF) - /docs/intake_packet.pdf
Volunteer Handbook - https://org.org/handbook
Release of Information Form

enhancedVariables.name: DURATION
enhancedVariables.description: The expected length of the appointment or meeting, expressed in minutes or hours to help recipients plan.
examples: 30 minutes
1 hour
90 minutes

enhancedVariables.name: DISCUSSION_TOPIC
enhancedVariables.description: A concise topic or set of topics that will be covered during the meeting used for agendas and reminders.
examples: Benefits enrollment options
Case review and next steps
Volunteer role expectations

enhancedVariables.name: PROMISED_RESOURCES
enhancedVariables.description: Any resources, referrals, documents, or supports the organization has committed to provide during or after the meeting.
examples: Referral to housing partner and application link
List of emergency food pantry locations
Bus vouchers and intake checklist

enhancedVariables.name: ACTION_ITEMS
enhancedVariables.description: Specific tasks or follow-up steps assigned to the client or staff as a result of the meeting or appointment.
examples: Client to complete benefits application by next Monday
Staff to send referral packet within 48 hours
Volunteer to attend orientation and complete background check

enhancedVariables.name: DEADLINE
enhancedVariables.description: A calendar date by which an action item, form, or task must be completed to meet service timelines.
validationRules: ifProvided then dateNotPast:false (or configurable per workflow)

enhancedVariables.name: RECIPIENT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The name of the message recipient (could be a client, donor, volunteer, or partner) to personalize communications.
examples: Taylor Nguyen
Mr. Ahmed Khan
Sister Patricia O'Leary

enhancedVariables.name: LOCATION_DETAILS
enhancedVariables.description: Physical address, virtual meeting link, or room information specifying where the appointment or event will occur.
examples: Community Center Room B, 123 Main St., Suite 200
Zoom: https://zoom.us/j/123456789
Mobile outreach van — corner of 5th & Pine

enhancedVariables.name: PREPARATION_STEPS
enhancedVariables.description: Instructions for what the client or attendee should do or bring before the meeting (forms to complete, ID to bring, etc.).
examples: Complete online intake form and bring photo ID
Bring proof of income and recent utility bill
Review attached agenda and note questions beforehand

enhancedVariables.name: BOARD_CHAIR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of the board chair used in board meeting notices, reminders, and materials distribution where signature or reference is needed.
examples: Dr. Ellen Park
Marcus H. Rivera
Linda K. Thompson

enhancedVariables.name: MEETING_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: The calendar date of the meeting or event (used for reminders, agendas, and calendar invites).
validationRules: Must be a valid ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD)
Should not be a past date when creating future meeting notices

enhancedVariables.name: MEETING_TIME
enhancedVariables.description: The start time of the meeting (used in communications, calendar entries, and timezone handling).
validationRules: Should match regex for time format, e.g., ^([01]\d|2[0-3]):[0-5]\d$ or include AM/PM

enhancedVariables.name: MEETING_LOCATION
enhancedVariables.description: The physical address or room name where the meeting will be held (or 'Virtual' indicator).
examples: Community Center, 2nd Floor Conference Room, 123 Main St.
Headquarters - Room 201
In-person: 45 Elm St., Suite 300
validationRules: Optional for virtual-only meetings but recommended for in-person/hybrid
If physical, include street address, city, and room when available

enhancedVariables.name: VIRTUAL_MEETING_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: A URL for joining the meeting remotely (video conference link or dial-in instructions).
examples: https://meet.example.org/j/987654321
https://zoom.us/j/123456789?pwd=abc
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_link
validationRules: If provided, must be a valid URL starting with http:// or https://
Recommended to include access code or dial-in info if needed (max 1000 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: COMMITTEE_NAMES
enhancedVariables.description: A comma- or newline-separated list of committee names relevant to the meeting or communication (used to target or reference committees).
examples: Finance Committee, Governance Committee, Fundraising Committee

Programs Committee
Volunteer Committee
Executive Committee, Audit Committee
validationRules: Optional but helpful for targeted communications
Max 5–10 committee names recommended; max length 500 characters
Each committee name should be separated by comma or newline

enhancedVariables.name: BOARD_MEMBER_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of a board member recipient or referenced individual within board communications.
examples: Maria Alvarez
James P. O'Connor
Aisha Rahman
validationRules: Should contain only alphabetic characters, spaces, hyphens, and apostrophes

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_CULTURE
enhancedVariables.description: A short descriptor of the organization's tone, values, or culture to guide messaging style (e.g., formal, friendly, mission-driven).
examples: Formal and policy-focused (for governance communications)
Warm, community-first and conversational
Mission-driven, data-focused and professional
validationRules: Optional but recommended to ensure consistent tone
If selectable, provide options like: Formal, Professional, Friendly, Casual, Mission-driven
Max length 200 characters if custom value allowed

enhancedVariables.name: BOARD_PORTAL_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: URL to the organization's board portal or document repository where materials and minutes are stored.
examples: https://boardportal.nonprofit.org/meetings/sep-2025
https://files.organizationsite.org/board
https://portal.secureboard.com/org/abc123
validationRules: If provided, must be a valid URL (http/https)
Optional but recommended to include for distribution of materials
Ensure link has appropriate access permissions before sending

enhancedVariables.name: ZOOM_MEETING_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: A specific Zoom meeting URL used for board or committee virtual sessions (kept separate when org uses multiple platforms).
examples: https://zoom.us/j/123456789?pwd=securecode
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/987654321
https://zoom.us/w/meetingid1234
validationRules: If provided, must be a valid URL starting with http:// or https://
Optional if using another virtual platform; ensure link contains meeting ID or passcode when required
Max length 1000 characters to allow appended parameters

enhancedVariables.name: DOCUMENT_LIST
enhancedVariables.description: A list of documents attached or linked for the meeting (agenda, minutes, reports) to be distributed with the notice.
examples: Agenda.pdf, Minutes_Aug2025.pdf, Financial_Report_Q2.pdf
Agenda (link), Draft Minutes (link), Board Packet (link)
Budget_Proposal_2026.xlsx; Program_Update_July.pdf
validationRules: Optional but recommended when distributing materials
Accepts comma, semicolon, or newline-separated entries (max 1000 characters)
If URLs included, each must be valid; prefer filename + link pattern

enhancedVariables.name: PRIORITY_AGENDA_ITEMS
enhancedVariables.description: Key agenda topics or action items that require priority attention during the meeting (used to highlight focus areas in reminders).
examples: Approve FY2026 budget; Elect new Treasurer; Review strategic plan timeline
Finalize grant proposal priorities; Discuss CEO evaluation
Board training on governance; Vote on bylaws amendment
validationRules: Optional but useful for meeting focus
Limit to 5–8 items recommended; max length 700 characters
Items should be separated by semicolon or newline

enhancedVariables.name: RESPONSE_DEADLINE
enhancedVariables.description: The date by which RSVPs, materials requests, or responses are required from recipients.
validationRules: Optional but recommended for RSVP tracking
Must be a valid ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD)
Should be before the MEETING_DATE; if set, cannot be a past date

enhancedVariables.name: DAYS_IN_ADVANCE
enhancedVariables.description: Number of days before the meeting when initial communications or notifications should be sent.
validationRules: If used, MEETING_DATE minus DAYS_IN_ADVANCE should result in a valid future date

enhancedVariables.name: MATERIALS_DAYS_ADVANCE
enhancedVariables.description: How many days before the meeting meeting materials (board packet) should be distributed to recipients.
validationRules: Optional; recommended values 3–14 for board materials
Should be less than or equal to DAYS_IN_ADVANCE when both used (or documented workflow)

enhancedVariables.name: REMINDER_DAYS_ADVANCE
enhancedVariables.description: Number of days before the meeting when reminder messages should be sent to participants.
validationRules: Should be less than or equal to DAYS_IN_ADVANCE and less than MATERIALS_DAYS_ADVANCE when sequencing reminders

enhancedVariables.name: FOLLOW_UP_DAYS
enhancedVariables.description: Number of days after an event, meeting, or client interaction when an automated follow-up should be sent.

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_AGENDA_ITEMS
enhancedVariables.description: A short list or bullet points of the principal topics to be covered at a meeting (used in reminders and materials distribution).
examples: Approve last meeting minutes; Budget review; Program updates
Strategic plan milestones; Fundraising campaign discussion
Board recruitment; Policy review; Committee reports

enhancedVariables.name: MEETING_MATERIALS
enhancedVariables.description: Files, links, or a brief inventory of documents attached or provided for a meeting (e.g., agendas, minutes, reports).
examples: Agenda.pdf; Q2 Financials.xlsx; Volunteer Report.docx
Link: https://drive.google.com/meeting-packet
Board packet (Agenda, Minutes, Treasurer's Report)
validationRules: suggestedFormat:file names or URLs separated by semicolons

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIAL_STEPS
enhancedVariables.description: Any special instructions or accommodation steps required for the event or outreach (e.g., accessibility, check-in procedures, materials to bring).
examples: Please arrive 15 minutes early for sign-in and badge pickup
Wheelchair access at the side entrance; ASL interpreter provided
Bring photo ID and completed intake form

enhancedVariables.name: CLIENT_FIRST_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The primary first name of a client or service participant used for personalized communications.
examples: Maria
James
Aisha

enhancedVariables.name: DAY
enhancedVariables.description: A day reference used in messaging (could be weekday name or day number) to indicate scheduling or timing.
examples: Monday
Friday

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_PHONE
enhancedVariables.description: Primary phone number for the program or service line that clients can call for assistance or questions.

enhancedVariables.name: CRISIS_LINE
enhancedVariables.description: A dedicated crisis or emergency hotline number provided for urgent support (region-appropriate).
validationRules: optional but recommended for client-facing templates

enhancedVariables.name: FACILITATOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of the staff member or volunteer leading a session, workshop, or client check-in.
examples: Jordan Lee
Sofia Martínez
Marcus O'Connor

enhancedVariables.name: NEXT_SESSION_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: The calendar date of the client's next scheduled session, appointment, or group meeting.
examples: September 15, 2025

enhancedVariables.name: EMPLOYER_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Name of a client's current or prospective employer used for case notes, referrals, or job coaching templates.
examples: Community Health Center
GreenTech Solutions
Sunrise Bakery

enhancedVariables.name: JOB_TITLE
enhancedVariables.description: Role or position title associated with a client or applicant, used in referrals, resumes, or program tracking.
examples: Line Cook
Youth Program Coordinator
Data Entry Specialist

enhancedVariables.name: STARTING_SKILL_LEVEL
enhancedVariables.description: Descriptive indicator of a client's initial skill level for a program (used to tailor support and track progress).
examples: Beginner - needs basic digital skills
Intermediate - some experience with bookkeeping
Advanced - job-ready coding skills

enhancedVariables.name: START_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: The date when a client begins a program, service, or employment placement.
examples: June 1, 2025
validationRules: notFuture:false (start dates can be in past or future depending on context)

enhancedVariables.name: COACH_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the assigned coach, mentor, or caseworker responsible for the client's support.
examples: Alex Nguyen
Patricia Gomez
DeShawn Carter

enhancedVariables.name: LINKEDIN_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: URL to the nonprofit's or staff member's LinkedIn profile or organization page used for professional networking and outreach.
examples: https://www.linkedin.com/company/hope-community-centers
https://www.linkedin.com/in/jane-doe-12345678
https://www.linkedin.com/school/rivervalley-nonprofit/

enhancedVariables.name: DIRECTOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the program or organization director responsible for a project, campaign, or client relationship.
examples: Maria Gonzales
Thomas J. Reed
Aisha K. Mbaye
validationRules: pattern:^[A-Za-zÀ-ÖØ-öø-ÿ'\-\.\s]+$ (allow letters, spaces, hyphens, apostrophes, periods)

enhancedVariables.name: CLIENT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Categorization of the client or beneficiary the nonprofit serves (e.g., individual, family, organization, referral source) to tailor communications and services.
examples: Individual - Youth (ages 13-18)
Family - Low-income housing residents
Partner organization - School district

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_PARTICIPATION
enhancedVariables.description: Name or brief description of the program(s) or service(s) the client is enrolled in or has accessed.
examples: After-school Tutoring Program (Spring 2025)
Housing Stabilization Case Management
Career Readiness Workshops - Cohort B

enhancedVariables.name: LAST_INTERACTION_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: The most recent date when staff or the organization last contacted or engaged with the client (phone, meeting, email, home visit).

enhancedVariables.name: NUMBER_OF_MESSAGES
enhancedVariables.description: Count of messages (emails, texts, calls) sent to or expected to be sent to a recipient within a given campaign or follow-up sequence.

enhancedVariables.name: TONE
enhancedVariables.description: Desired tone or voice for automated communications (e.g., warm, formal, urgent) used to match organizational brand and audience sensitivity.
examples: Warm and supportive (client-facing)
Concise and professional (partner outreach)
Urgent and action-oriented (payment reminder)

enhancedVariables.name: COMMUNICATION_CHANNEL
enhancedVariables.description: Primary channel through which the message will be delivered (email, SMS, phone call, postal mail, social), influencing formatting and timing.
examples: Email
SMS/Text
Phone call

enhancedVariables.name: MESSAGE_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specific purpose of the outgoing message (e.g., check-in, reminder, receipt, welcome) to determine content structure and call-to-action.
examples: Check-in / Wellness Follow-up
Donation Acknowledgment Receipt
Membership Renewal Reminder

enhancedVariables.name: SERVICE_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Official name of the service, program, or benefit being referenced in communications or records.
examples: Mobile Food Pantry
Legal Aid Clinic - Family Law
Summer Youth Leadership Camp

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_DETAILS
enhancedVariables.description: Concise list of the most important facts or action items to include in the message (dates, locations, next steps, special requirements).
examples: Appointment: Aug 20, 10:30 AM at 123 Main St; bring ID and proof of income.
Volunteer orientation: Sept 2, 6:00 PM — RSVP required; wear closed-toe shoes.
Donation received: $250 on 2025-07-14; tax receipt attached.

enhancedVariables.name: RELATIONSHIP_CONTEXT
enhancedVariables.description: Background on how the recipient is connected to the organization (referral source, past donor, long-term client) to personalize messaging.
examples: Referred by Family Services Agency after housing intake.
Recurring donor since 2019, monthly contributor.
Participant completed intake and two counseling sessions in 2024.

enhancedVariables.name: ACTION_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The specific action requested or required from the recipient (RSVP, confirm appointment, complete form, make payment).
examples: Confirm appointment by replying 'YES' to this message.
Complete intake form at provided link within 5 days.
Make a donation via the enclosed link to renew membership.

enhancedVariables.name: THRESHOLD_AMOUNT
enhancedVariables.description: Monetary value used to trigger a special process or message (e.g., automatic acknowledgment for donations above a set amount).

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_FIRST_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Given name of the donor used to personalize acknowledgments, receipts, and stewardship communications.
examples: Michael
Fatima
Liam

enhancedVariables.name: LOCAL_RIVER_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The common or locally used name of a river or waterway relevant to the nonprofit's work (e.g., for conservation, cleanup events, watershed programs).
examples: Willamette River
Anacostia River
South Platte River
validationRules: Allow letters, spaces, hyphens, and apostrophes

enhancedVariables.name: NEXT_EVENT_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: The date of the organization's next scheduled public event, fundraiser, or activity used in outreach and reminders.
validationRules: Must be today or a future date
Optional time zone normalization if used across regions

enhancedVariables.name: NEXT_EVENT_LOCATION
enhancedVariables.description: The physical venue or online location (address or platform) where the next event will take place, used in invitations and confirmations.
examples: Riverside Park Shelter A, 120 River St, Springfield
Community Center Ballroom, 45 Main St
Zoom — https://zoom.us/j/123456789
validationRules: Required for in-person or virtual event messages
If URL provided, must be valid URL format
If physical address, include city and state fields where possible

enhancedVariables.name: ED_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of the Executive Director (ED) who may sign letters, appear in communications, or serve as the organization's public face.
examples: María Gonzales
Jordan T. Williams
Aisha Ahmed
validationRules: Allow letters, spaces, hyphens, periods, and apostrophes

enhancedVariables.name: SOCIAL_MEDIA_LINKS
enhancedVariables.description: A consolidated list or formatted string of the nonprofit's social media profiles used in email footers, receipts, and outreach materials.
examples: Facebook: https://facebook.com/GreenCityOrg | Twitter: https://twitter.com/GreenCityOrg | Instagram: https://instagram.com/greencityorg
Instagram: https://instagram.com/hopehouse_nfp; LinkedIn: https://linkedin.com/company/hopehouse
Facebook: https://facebook.com/cleanstreams; YouTube: https://youtube.com/cleanstreamschannel
validationRules: If URLs included, validate each is a well-formed URL

enhancedVariables.name: HONOREE_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The name of an individual honored by a donation, tribute, event, or memorial gift; used in personalized acknowledgments and notifications to family or donors.
examples: In memory of Robert Lee
Honoree: Dr. Ellen Park
Tribute to Samuel Ortiz
validationRules: Optional for regular receipts; required when gift is a tribute
Allow common name characters and honorifics

enhancedVariables.name: FAMILY_CONTACT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The primary contact person for a donor's family (e.g., for memorial gifts or family liaison) used for personalized communications and follow-ups.
examples: Angela Martinez
Thomas Nguyen (son)
Priya Shah — family representative
validationRules: Optional but required for memorial/tribute workflows
Allow name plus brief relationship note in parentheses

enhancedVariables.name: AMOUNT
enhancedVariables.description: A monetary value representing a donation, membership fee, payment, or suggested gift amount used in receipts, reminders, and accounting templates.
validationRules: Numeric value with two decimal places allowed
Optional max limit (e.g., <= 10,000,000) based on org policy

enhancedVariables.name: DEVELOPMENT_DIRECTOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the Development Director (or equivalent fundraising lead) used in donor appeals, stewardship messages, and contact references.
examples: Evan Carter
Simone Laurent
Ricardo Mendes
validationRules: Required for fundraising communications that reference a contact
Allow letters, spaces, hyphens, and periods

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_SUPPORTED
enhancedVariables.description: The specific program, project, or fund that a gift will support; used to clarify donor intent and in program-specific acknowledgments.
examples: Youth Mentoring Program
Emergency Food Relief Fund
River Cleanup & Habitat Restoration
validationRules: Value should match an existing program identifier or list
If custom entry allowed, max length 150 characters

enhancedVariables.name: SMALL_GIFT_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: The numeric amount defining the organization's threshold for categorizing a gift as 'small' (used to route acknowledgments or workflows).
validationRules: Must be less than LARGE_GIFT_THRESHOLD if both provided

enhancedVariables.name: LARGE_GIFT_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: The numeric amount at or above which a gift is considered 'large' and may trigger personalized stewardship or special handling.
validationRules: Should be greater than SMALL_GIFT_THRESHOLD if both provided

enhancedVariables.name: LOCAL_FOOD_BANK
enhancedVariables.description: The name (and optionally brief address) of a nearby food bank partner used when coordinating donations, volunteer drives, or referral information.
examples: Northside Food Bank — 210 Elm St, Rivertown
Eastside Community Food Pantry
Harvest Hope Food Bank
validationRules: Optional but recommended for food distribution communications
Allow name, dash, and address; if address included validate basic address format

enhancedVariables.name: FIRST_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The recipient's or contact's given name used for personalization in emails, letters, event badges, and volunteer assignments.
examples: Alex
Sofia
Marcus
validationRules: Allow letters, spaces, hyphens, and apostrophes

enhancedVariables.name: DIETARY_NOTES
enhancedVariables.description: Any dietary restrictions or meal preferences provided by an attendee or volunteer for event planning and accommodations.
examples: Vegetarian — no dairy
Gluten-free; allergic to shellfish
No pork, prefers vegan option
validationRules: Optional but recommended for catered events
Do not collect unnecessary health details beyond dietary needs
Sanitize input to prevent special-character injection

enhancedVariables.name: ACCESSIBILITY_NOTES
enhancedVariables.description: Notes about accessibility accommodations or resources available at an event (e.g., wheelchair access, sign language interpretation, sensory-friendly areas). Use to inform attendees of how the organization supports diverse needs.
examples: Wheelchair accessible entrance and restroom located on the north side; contact us for reserved seating.
ASL interpreter provided from 6:30–8:30 PM — please request in advance by emailing access@nonprofit.org.
Quiet room available for guests with sensory needs; please let us know if you would like to use it.
validationRules: should not contain PHI (protected health information)

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_COORDINATOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the staff member or volunteer responsible for coordinating the event and who can be contacted with logistics questions.
examples: Aisha Patel
Marcus J. Rivera
Samantha Lee, Volunteer Coordinator
validationRules: letters, spaces and basic punctuation only

enhancedVariables.name: EDUCATION_NONPROFIT
enhancedVariables.description: The name of the partner or beneficiary education nonprofit involved in the event or program; used when referencing collaborations or beneficiary organizations.
examples: Bright Futures Literacy Project
City Youth STEM Initiative
Neighborhood Learning Collective

enhancedVariables.name: BOOTH_NUMBER
enhancedVariables.description: Numeric or alphanumeric identifier for an exhibitor booth at a fair or conference used for directions and maps.
examples: Booth 12
Table 27 (Exhibitor Hall B)
validationRules: allow letters, numbers, hyphen and spaces

enhancedVariables.name: MISSION_STATEMENT_SHORT
enhancedVariables.description: A concise one-sentence mission statement or tagline describing the nonprofit's core purpose to include in event materials or confirmations.
examples: We empower youth through hands-on STEM education and mentorship.
Connecting families with nutritious food and community resources.
Advocating for affordable housing and neighborhood stability.

enhancedVariables.name: CONFERENCE_DIRECTOR
enhancedVariables.description: Name of the individual overseeing the conference at a program level; often used for formal communications or escalation contacts.
examples: Dr. Elena Gomez
Noah Thompson, Conference Director
Patricia Chen

enhancedVariables.name: REMINDER_TIMEFRAME
enhancedVariables.description: The relative time before an event when a reminder should be sent (e.g., '48 hours before' or a specific day/time); used for automated scheduling of reminders.
examples: 48 hours before the event
One week prior and one day before
Morning of the event at 8:00 AM local time
validationRules: accepts natural language timeframes (e.g., '2 days before', '1 week prior') or cron-like schedule

enhancedVariables.name: FINAL_DETAILS_TIMEFRAME
enhancedVariables.description: When the final logistical details should be sent to attendees (e.g., '24 hours before' or 'two days before the event').
examples: 24 hours before event start time
Two business days prior
Final details emailed the morning of the event
validationRules: clear relative timeframe (hours/days) or specific datetime

enhancedVariables.name: FOLLOW_UP_ACTION
enhancedVariables.description: The specific next action requested of the recipient after the event or interaction (e.g., 'complete survey', 'sign up for volunteer training', 'donate').
examples: Please complete a 5-minute post-event survey to help us improve.
Sign up for our volunteer orientation at nonprofit.org/volunteer.
Make a sustaining monthly gift to support our programs.
validationRules: should include a clear call-to-action and, if applicable, a link or next step

enhancedVariables.name: ATTENDEE_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of the event attendee; used to personalize confirmations, badges, and follow-up communications.
examples: Jordan Alvarez
Taylor Nguyen
Dr. Priya Sharma
validationRules: letters, spaces and common punctuation only

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_BRANDING
enhancedVariables.description: Short descriptor of the organization's branding elements to include (e.g., 'use logo and brand colors; formal tone'); guides design and messaging consistency.
examples: Use full-color logo in header, brand colors (Navy #002B5C, Gold #F5B041), and formal tone.
Include program logo only and add partner logos; friendly and inclusive language.
Minimalist style: black logo on white background, causal voice.
validationRules: avoid uploading actual graphical files here (link or description only)

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_LOCATION
enhancedVariables.description: The physical or virtual location of the event, including venue name, address, room or online meeting link and any entry instructions.
examples: Community Arts Center, 123 Main St, Springfield — Auditorium (enter through west doors)
Online via Zoom: https://zoom.us/j/123456789 (passcode: 987654)
Riverside Park Pavilion B — parking available in Lot C, check-in at the kiosk
validationRules: if virtual, must include full meeting URL and access instructions; if physical, include full address

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_TIME
enhancedVariables.description: The start and end time (and date if needed) for the event, including time zone when relevant, used for invitations and schedules.
examples: June 12, 2025 — 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM (ET)
September 15, 2025, 9:00 AM start (doors open 8:30 AM)
validationRules: include date and start/end times or explicit timezone if different from recipient
ISO 8601 preferred for machine use; human-readable allowed for templates

enhancedVariables.name: PARKING_INFO
enhancedVariables.description: Details about parking availability, cost, instructions, or alternatives (public transit, drop-off points) for event attendees.
examples: Free on-site parking available in Lot A; overflow parking at 200 Elm St (shuttle every 15 minutes).
$5 flat-rate parking in adjacent garage; street parking metered after 6 PM.
No guest parking — please use public transit; nearest subway: Central Station, 5-minute walk.

enhancedVariables.name: WHAT_TO_BRING
enhancedVariables.description: A list of recommended items attendees should bring to the event (e.g., ID, water bottle, laptop, proof of vaccination, materials for workshop).
examples: Please bring a photo ID and a printable ticket or e-ticket on your phone.
Bring a notebook and pen; laptops encouraged for the workshop.
Comfortable shoes for the volunteer clean-up; gloves and trash bags will be provided.
validationRules: use bullet-style or short sentence list for readability

enhancedVariables.name: DRESS_CODE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the recommended or required attire for an event or volunteer shift, helping attendees know what to wear (e.g., formal, casual, business casual, volunteer T-shirt).
examples: Business casual — slacks and collared shirts recommended
Black tie / formal attire required for gala
Volunteer T-shirt and closed-toe shoes (provided on arrival)
validationRules: if select=other then allow free-text entry in accompanying field (textarea, max 200 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: CONTACT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the person attendees or members should contact for questions, RSVPs, or follow-up; used for personalized communications and point-of-contact info.
examples: Aisha Martinez
David O'Connor
Jordan Lee, Volunteer Coordinator

enhancedVariables.name: MEMBER_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of a member receiving renewal notices, benefits, or personalized communications; used to personalize membership messages and records.
examples: Samantha Green
Michael T. Reynolds
Maria Alvarez-De la Cruz

enhancedVariables.name: MEMBERSHIP_DURATION
enhancedVariables.description: Length of the membership period (duration) being referenced, such as the term length or renewal interval (e.g., 1 year, 6 months).
examples: 1 year
6 months
Monthly (auto-renew)

enhancedVariables.name: MEMBERSHIP_TIER
enhancedVariables.description: Named level or tier of the member's subscription (e.g., Basic, Supporter, Patron) that determines benefits and pricing.
examples: Individual — Basic
Family — Supporter
Platinum Sponsor / Patron

enhancedVariables.name: RENEWAL_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: The calendar date when a membership, subscription, or recurring commitment is due to be renewed or expires; used to trigger reminders and invoices.

enhancedVariables.name: EXECUTIVE_DIRECTOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the organization's executive director or CEO used for signature blocks, appeals, and official communications.
examples: Olivia Chen
Marcus Bennett, Executive Director
Dr. Priya Singh

enhancedVariables.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: The date when a credential, pass, membership, or access right ends; useful for reminders, access control, and record-keeping.

enhancedVariables.name: X
enhancedVariables.description: A placeholder generic variable for short miscellaneous values (often used as a flag, count, or single-character code); recommend replacing with a descriptive name for clarity.
examples: Y (opt-in flag)
3 (number of guests)
A (session code)

enhancedVariables.name: LINK
enhancedVariables.description: A URL to a registration page, donation form, resources, parking map, or other relevant online resource to be included in communications.
examples: https://nonprofit.org/donate
https://events.nonprofit.org/register?event=fall-gala
https://nonprofit.org/volunteer/shift-details

enhancedVariables.name: MEMBERSHIP_DIRECTOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the staff member accountable for membership programs; used for contact info in renewal notices and membership inquiries.
examples: Karen Osei, Membership Director
Ethan Park
Rosa Gutierrez

enhancedVariables.name: MEMBERSHIP_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the kind of membership (e.g., individual, household, corporate) used for segmentation, benefits, and billing.
examples: Individual
Household
Corporate Sponsor

enhancedVariables.name: RECENT_ACCOMPLISHMENT
enhancedVariables.description: A short description of a recent program outcome, award, or milestone the organization achieved, used to personalize renewal or donor communications.
examples: Launched a mobile food pantry serving 2,000 households this year
Received statewide award for youth education program
Expanded mental health services to three new neighborhoods

enhancedVariables.name: PAYMENT_OPTIONS
enhancedVariables.description: List or description of accepted payment methods and payment instructions for renewals, donations, or event fees (e.g., credit card, bank transfer, check).
examples: Online via credit card (Visa, MC, Amex) or ACH bank transfer
Mail a check payable to 'Neighborhood Arts' to 123 Main St.
Phone payments accepted — call 555-1234 to pay by card

enhancedVariables.name: PARKING_MAP_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: A direct URL to a parking map or directions for an event site, provided to volunteers and attendees to ease arrival and logistics.
examples: https://maps.nonprofit.org/event-parking-fallfest
https://goo.gl/maps/abcd1234 (event parking entrance highlighted)
https://nonprofit.org/parking?lot=A

enhancedVariables.name: ELIGIBILITY_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: Defines the rules and conditions individuals or organizations must meet to qualify for a program, service, grant, or enrollment; used to validate applications and triage intake forms.
examples: Household income below 60% of Area Median Income and residency in city limits for at least 6 months
Nonprofit organizations with 501(c)(3) status, operating for at least 2 years, and annual budget under $500,000
Individuals aged 18–26 who are unemployed or underemployed and actively seeking job training
validationRules: Required when used in intake or application templates
Should include explicit inclusion and exclusion criteria (e.g., age ranges, income thresholds, documentation required)

enhancedVariables.name: DOCUMENT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the kind of document being reviewed, submitted, or generated (e.g., financial report, grant application, policy, intake form) to route processing and apply the correct checks.
examples: Annual financial audit (independent auditor report)
Grant application — capacity building program
Staff handbook — onboarding policies
validationRules: Options should be drawn from an organization-managed list (e.g., 'Financial Report','Grant Application','Policy Document','Intake Form','Contract')
If 'Other' selected, require a short description (max 200 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: REGULATORY_BODY
enhancedVariables.description: Identifies the government or oversight entity (federal, state, local, or sector regulator) that sets reporting or compliance requirements relevant to the document or activity.
examples: State Attorney General — Charitable Trusts Section (required annual filing)
Internal Revenue Service (IRS) — Form 990 filing
State Department of Health — program licensing and reporting
validationRules: Optional but recommended for compliance workflows
If provided, should match an approved list of regulatory bodies or include jurisdiction (e.g., 'IRS — Federal', 'CA Attorney General')

enhancedVariables.name: COMPLIANCE_STANDARDS
enhancedVariables.description: Lists laws, regulations, accounting rules, or internal policies that the organization must follow for the given document, contract, or program (e.g., GAAP, HIPAA, state fundraising regulations).
examples: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and donor restricted funds tracking
HIPAA privacy rule for participant health information in our mental health program
State charitable solicitation registration and annual reporting requirements
validationRules: Recommended for compliance reviews; required when running audits
Encourage use of standardized citations (statute code or policy name) when possible

enhancedVariables.name: MISSION_FOCUS
enhancedVariables.description: A succinct statement of the nonprofit's programmatic focus or primary population served, used to tailor communications, eligibility assessment, and content generation to mission-aligned goals.
examples: Provide after-school STEM enrichment to underserved middle-school students in urban neighborhoods
Support housing stability for low-income seniors through rental assistance and case management
Advance environmental justice by funding community-led urban greening projects
validationRules: Required for content and program templates
Should reference primary beneficiaries and core service or outcome

enhancedVariables.name: COMPLIANCE_STANDARD
enhancedVariables.description: Represents a single named compliance requirement or standard (e.g., 'SOC 2', 'PCI-DSS', 'Form 990') that applies to a process, document, or vendor relationship.
examples: IRS Form 990 filing requirements for nonprofits
PCI-DSS for payment processing vendors handling donor credit card data
SOC 2 Type II for third-party cloud providers storing client data
validationRules: Use a standardized list when possible
If custom standard entered, max length 200 characters

enhancedVariables.name: ANNUAL_BUDGET
enhancedVariables.description: The nonprofit's projected or actual total operating budget for the fiscal year, used for financial planning, grant eligibility checks, and scale-appropriate recommendations.
examples: $850,000 (FY25 total operating budget)
$3,200,000 — includes program-restricted grants and capital reserve
$125,000 — start-up budget for new community program (first year)
validationRules: Numeric only, no currency symbols stored (display as currency)
Optional field to indicate fiscal year (separate date variable recommended)

enhancedVariables.name: STAKEHOLDER_ROLES
enhancedVariables.description: Enumerates key people or groups involved in a process or decision (e.g., program manager, finance director, board approving authority) along with their responsibilities for routing and approvals.
examples: Program Director — approves participant eligibility and outcomes reporting; Finance Director — signs purchase orders
Board Finance Committee — approves annual budget; Executive Director — final signatory
Volunteer Coordinator — onboarding; HR Manager — background checks and compliance
validationRules: Recommended to include role and brief responsibility (max 250 chars per role)
If used in approval workflows, require at least one approver role

enhancedVariables.name: RISK_TOLERANCE_LEVEL
enhancedVariables.description: Indicates the organization's appetite for operational, financial, or reputational risk (e.g., low/medium/high) to guide contract negotiation, program pilots, or investments.
examples: Low — no acceptance of reputational risk; declines partnerships without full background checks
Medium — accepts pilot projects with limited financial exposure up to $25,000
High (restricted to board-approved initiatives) — may accept higher uncertainty for strategic opportunities
validationRules: If 'High' selected, require linked justification note (max 1000 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: LEGAL_RESOURCES_AVAILABLE
enhancedVariables.description: Describes the legal support accessible to the nonprofit (in-house counsel, pro bono partners, contract attorneys) used to decide escalation and review levels for agreements and compliance issues.
examples: Part-time in-house counsel (10 hours/week) + pro bono panel of two firms for contract review
No internal legal staff; access to state nonprofit legal hotline and one pro bono attorney
Retained outside counsel for employment matters; internal staff handles routine contracts
validationRules: Optional but recommended for contract/ compliance reviews
If 'None', require confirmation to escalate to board or external counsel

enhancedVariables.name: INSURANCE_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies required insurance coverages and limits (general liability, professional liability, directors & officers) for programs, contracts, or events to ensure adequate risk transfer.
examples: General liability: $1,000,000 per occurrence / $2,000,000 aggregate; D&O: $1,000,000
Volunteer accident insurance required for off-site events; proof of coverage minimum $500,000
Professional liability (errors & omissions) required for contracted counselors: $1,000,000
validationRules: Required for contracting and event planning
Should include coverage type and numeric limits
Max length 1000 characters; recommend structured fields for coverage type and amounts if used frequently

enhancedVariables.name: INDEMNIFICATION_LANGUAGE
enhancedVariables.description: Contains the indemnity clauses expected in contracts (who indemnifies whom, scope, and limitations) to standardize legal risk allocation across vendor and partnership agreements.
examples: Vendor indemnifies nonprofit against all claims arising from vendor negligence, capped at $500,000
Mutual indemnification for third-party claims arising from each party's gross negligence or willful misconduct
Nonprofit indemnifies host venue only for claims directly resulting from nonprofit activities, excluding pre-existing venue conditions
validationRules: Prefer selection from pre-approved clause library; if custom, require legal review flag

enhancedVariables.name: PAYMENT_TERMS_GUIDELINES
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies acceptable payment schedules, invoicing requirements, and late payment policies for vendors and grantees to ensure consistent financial controls.
examples: Net 30 from invoice date, invoices must reference PO number and be sent to accounts@nonprofit.org
50% upfront deposit, 50% on completion with final deliverables; reimbursements require receipts within 60 days
Monthly progress-based invoicing with detailed expense breakdowns; late payments subject to 1.5% monthly interest
validationRules: Required for procurement and contract templates
Should include payment timeline (days), invoicing contact, and any required documentation

enhancedVariables.name: CONFIDENTIALITY_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: Defines expectations for handling sensitive information (participant data, donor records, proprietary materials), including nondisclosure obligations and data handling practices.
examples: All staff and contractors must sign an NDA covering participant data; PII must be encrypted in transit and at rest
Donor records are confidential; access limited to fundraising and executive staff; sharing requires donor consent
Counseling session notes stored in secure EHR system and accessible only to licensed clinicians
validationRules: Required when personal data is involved
Should call out data categories (PII, health, financial) and retention/ access rules

enhancedVariables.name: IP_STANDARDS
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies how intellectual property (work products, curricula, logos) is owned, licensed, or shared between the nonprofit and partners, including attribution and reuse conditions.
examples: All program curriculum created by staff is owned by the nonprofit and licensed CC BY-NC for community partners
Co-created research outputs: joint ownership with non-exclusive licensing to both parties for internal use
Contractor-delivered marketing materials: rights transferred to nonprofit upon final payment with attribution optional
validationRules: Required for contracts involving creative deliverables or branded materials
If third-party materials included, require proof of right-to-use or license details

enhancedVariables.name: TERMINATION_PREFERENCES
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the organization's required procedures and preferences for terminating contracts, vendor relationships, or agreements (notice periods, return of property, data handling, and post-termination obligations).
examples: 30 days written notice required for termination by either party; vendor must return all client data within 10 business days.
Immediate termination for breach with obligation to refund unearned fees; nonprofit retains ownership of deliverables.
Termination requires board approval for contracts over $50,000; all confidential materials must be returned and a certificate of data destruction provided.
validationRules: Should mention notice period or conditions (e.g., contain 'days' or 'notice') when applicable
Required for contracts and vendor templates

enhancedVariables.name: APPROVAL_AUTHORITY
enhancedVariables.description: Identifies who or which role(s) in the nonprofit can approve contracts, expenditures, policies, or program changes (titles, committees, or dollar thresholds).
examples: Executive Director can approve contracts up to $25,000; Finance Committee approval required above that amount.
Program Director may approve client service agreements under $10,000; Board Chair must approve multi-year commitments.
Grants Manager approves grant applications and budgeted expenses; full board approval required for non-budgeted spending.
validationRules: Should reference roles or dollar thresholds if applicable

enhancedVariables.name: SIGNATURE_AUTHORITY
enhancedVariables.description: Defines which individuals are authorized to sign official documents on behalf of the nonprofit and any constraints (e.g., co-signature requirements, delegated signers, electronic signature policy).
examples: Executive Director and Board Chair authorized to sign contracts; both signatures required for agreements > $100,000.
Finance Director may sign vendor invoices up to $5,000; electronic signatures accepted if accompanied by email approval.
Program Manager can sign participant consent forms; any legal agreement requires Executive Director signature.
validationRules: Should list at least one authorized role or person
Flag if co-signature or monetary threshold is present

enhancedVariables.name: CONTRACT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the nature of the contract or agreement (e.g., vendor services, partnership, grant agreement, confidentiality/non-disclosure agreement) to determine review and approval workflows.
examples: Consulting Services Agreement (vendor) for short-term program evaluation.
Grant Award Agreement with funder outlining deliverables and reporting schedule.
Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) for program partnership with local school district.
validationRules: Acceptable values: vendor, grant, partnership, MOU, NDA, employment, lease, other
If 'other' selected, require a short description (max 250 chars)
Required field for contract intake forms

enhancedVariables.name: COMPLIANCE_CHECKLIST
enhancedVariables.description: A checklist of compliance items the organization must verify for a document or process (e.g., licensing, insurance, background checks, conflict-of-interest disclosures).
examples: Insurance certificate on file, W-9 received, background check completed for staff providing direct services.
Funder reporting schedule added to calendar, allowable expenses marked, audit trail of receipts verified.
Program intake includes consent forms, data-sharing agreement signed, HIPAA/confidentiality requirements noted.
validationRules: Max length 2000 characters or allow structured checklist items
Must include at least one compliance item for regulated activities

enhancedVariables.name: REVIEW_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: Defines the specific criteria reviewers should use when evaluating contracts, policies, or grant applications (risk factors, alignment with mission, budget adequacy, legal clauses to check).
examples: Assess alignment with mission, check indemnity and liability clauses, verify budget matches program outcomes.
Ensure nondiscrimination clause included, confirm data protection language, validate milestones and payment schedule.
Check for automatic renewals, termination for convenience, and payment holdback terms; escalate high-risk clauses to legal counsel.
validationRules: Should contain at least one risk or governance-related criterion
Recommend use when routing to reviewers

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_POLICIES
enhancedVariables.description: Lists particular organizational policies that apply to the document or process under review (e.g., procurement policy, conflict of interest policy, safeguarding/child protection).
examples: Procurement Policy (v2.1), Conflict of Interest Policy, Volunteer Background Check Policy.
Data Retention Policy and Privacy Policy apply to any document containing beneficiary data.
Whistleblower Policy and Anti-Fraud Policy required for financial agreements and grants.
validationRules: Prefer policy names and version/date if available
Suggest linking to policy documents where possible

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_REGULATIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Names external legal or regulatory requirements that the nonprofit must comply with for the document or activity (e.g., IRS rules, state charity registration, GDPR, payroll tax laws).
examples: IRS rules on unrelated business income (UBI) for program revenue-generating activities.
State charitable solicitation registration requirements in CA and NY for fundraising campaigns.
GDPR data processing requirements for EU-based participants and cross-border data transfers.
validationRules: Encourage listing statutes or regulation names and jurisdictions
Required when activity involves cross-border operations or regulated services

enhancedVariables.name: VERIFICATION_CHECKLIST
enhancedVariables.description: A structured list of items to verify when reviewing financial documents (e.g., receipts matched to ledger, signatures present, expense categories correct).
examples: Match receipts to ledger entries, confirm vendor payment date and method, check expense coding against budget category.
Verify authorized approver signature, ensure supporting documentation for reimbursements, validate correct fiscal year allocation.
Confirm grant expenditures are allowable per funder, verify overhead calculation, and ensure documentation for subgrantee payments.
validationRules: Max length 2000 characters or support multiple checklist items
Must include at least three verification steps for financial reviews
Recommended to map items to ledger/account codes when applicable

enhancedVariables.name: BUDGET_CATEGORY
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the budget line or category under which an expense or item should be recorded (e.g., program services, fundraising, admin, capital expenditures).
examples: Program Services — Youth Outreach (account 5100).
Fundraising — Event Costs (account 6200).
Administration — Office Supplies (account 4300).
validationRules: Acceptable values should match organization chart of accounts
If 'other' selected, require brief description and account code
Required for expense entry and financial approvals

enhancedVariables.name: FUNDER_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: Describes specific obligations or conditions set by a funder for a grant or award (reporting frequency, allowable costs, branding and acknowledgement language, audit requirements).
examples: Quarterly narrative and financial reports due within 30 days of quarter end; funder logo must appear on all promotional materials.
Allowable costs exclude capital expenditures; equipment purchases require prior written approval.
Final expenditure report and independent audit required for grants over $100,000; retention of records for 7 years.
validationRules: Should identify reporting cadence and any financial restrictions

enhancedVariables.name: CHECKLIST
enhancedVariables.description: A general-purpose checklist name or body used to verify completeness for processes like grant applications, onboarding, or project closeouts.
examples: Grant Application Completeness: budget attached, letters of support, EIN verification, board resolution (if required).
New Volunteer Onboarding: application, background check, orientation completed, confidentiality agreement signed.
Program Closeout Checklist: final report submitted, expenses reconciled, equipment inventory updated.

enhancedVariables.name: CHECKLIST_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The title or identifier for a specific checklist used by staff/teams (helps pick the correct checklist template for a task).
examples: Grant Application - Foundation X Checklist
Volunteer Background Check Checklist
Year-End Financial Close Checklist
validationRules: Must be unique within the organization's checklist library
Required when creating or selecting a checklist

enhancedVariables.name: FUNDING_PRIORITIES
enhancedVariables.description: Defines the organization's strategic or programmatic priorities that guide which projects or proposals should be funded (e.g., underserved youth, housing stability, advocacy).
examples: Prioritize programs that support housing stability for families experiencing homelessness.
Focus on youth education initiatives in Title I school districts with measurable learning outcomes.
Fund advocacy projects that advance state-level policy on climate resilience and environmental justice.
validationRules: Should reference target populations, geographies, or outcomes when possible
Recommended for grant review and donor stewardship alignment

enhancedVariables.name: DOCUMENT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official filename or title of a document being uploaded or reviewed (used for filing, tracking, and linking to templates or policies).
examples: Signed_Grant_Agreement_FunderX_2025-03-12.pdf
Volunteer_Release_Form_Jane_Doe_2024-11-01.docx
FY24_Quarter2_Financials_FINAL.xlsx
validationRules: Disallow special characters that break file systems (e.g., / \ : * ? " < > | )
Recommend including date (YYYY-MM-DD) and brief descriptor

enhancedVariables.name: POLICY_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Type or category of the organizational policy being reviewed (e.g., HR, finance, child protection). Helps route reviews and apply the correct compliance standards.
examples: Child Protection Policy
Data Privacy and Security Policy
Volunteer Code of Conduct
validationRules: must match a predefined list of policy categories (e.g., HR, Finance, Safeguarding, Privacy, IT, Volunteer)

enhancedVariables.name: STATUS
enhancedVariables.description: Current compliance or review status of the policy or item (e.g., draft, under review, approved). Used to track workflow stage.
examples: Draft
Under Review - Compliance Team
Approved - Effective 2025-01-01
validationRules: value must be one of ['Draft','Under Review','Needs Revision','Approved','Archived']

enhancedVariables.name: ISSUES
enhancedVariables.description: Concise list or summary of compliance problems, gaps, or nonconformities identified during the review.
examples: Missing required background-check clause for volunteers working with minors.
Policy lacks data retention timeframe for donor records.
Inconsistent approval signature block across versions.
validationRules: required when status indicates 'Under Review' or 'Needs Revision'

enhancedVariables.name: RECOMMENDATIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Actionable suggestions to address identified issues, improve compliance, or update procedures.
examples: Add a clause requiring background checks for volunteers in direct contact with beneficiaries and specify frequency.
Define donor data retention policy: retain contact and donation records for 7 years.
Standardize the approval signature block and include role/title fields.
validationRules: each recommendation should include a proposed owner and timeline where possible

enhancedVariables.name: DECISION
enhancedVariables.description: Final determination or ruling about the policy after review (e.g., accept as-is, accept with changes, reject). Often used to record governance-level outcomes.
examples: Approved with minor edits — implement within 30 days.
Deferred pending legal review of data sharing clauses.
Rejected — requires full rewrite to meet safeguarding standards.
validationRules: value must be one of ['Approve','Approve with Changes','Defer','Reject']
if 'Approve with Changes' selected, RECOMMENDATIONS and NEXT_STEPS must be populated

enhancedVariables.name: SUMMARY
enhancedVariables.description: Brief executive summary of the review findings and overall assessment for leadership or stakeholders.
examples: Review found minor formatting issues; policy meets legal and funder requirements.
Significant gaps in volunteer screening procedures require immediate revision.
Policy generally compliant but needs clarification on data-sharing practices.
validationRules: should be written in plain language suitable for board-level readers

enhancedVariables.name: ACTIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Specific tasks to be completed to implement recommendations, including owners and due dates where applicable.
examples: Assign HR Manager to update screening clause — due 2025-03-01.
Legal to review data sharing language — assigned to Counsel, due 2 weeks.
Communications to notify staff of policy change and training schedule.
validationRules: each action should include owner and target completion date

enhancedVariables.name: NEXT_STEPS
enhancedVariables.description: Short, prioritized list of immediate follow-up activities after the review to move the policy forward.
examples: Schedule meeting with HR and Legal to finalize edits within 7 days.
Publish revised policy and send all-staff notification next Monday.
Create training module for volunteers by end of quarter.
validationRules: recommended when DECISION is not 'Approved as-is'
prefer 3 or fewer discrete next steps for clarity

enhancedVariables.name: POLICY_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Official short name of the policy or procedure under review (used for indexing and cross-referencing).
examples: Volunteer Background Check Policy
Data Protection and Privacy Policy
Whistleblower and Reporting Policy
validationRules: avoid special characters except hyphens and ampersands

enhancedVariables.name: CRITERION_#
enhancedVariables.description: A named review criterion used to evaluate the policy (e.g., 'Legal Compliance', 'Funder Requirements'); multiple numbered instances (Criterion 1, Criterion 2, etc.) are expected.
examples: CRITERION_1: Background check requirements meet state law
CRITERION_2: Data retention aligns with funder requirements
CRITERION_3: Volunteer supervision levels are documented
validationRules: required at least once for structured reviews
each instance must be uniquely numbered (e.g., CRITERION_1, CRITERION_2)
maxNumber recommended to be configurable (current maxNumber: 2; allow expansion)

enhancedVariables.name: ADDITIONAL_DOCUMENT_TYPES
enhancedVariables.description: Other supporting documents that should be collected or reviewed alongside the policy (e.g., volunteer applications, previous versions, training materials).
examples: Volunteer application forms, signed consent forms, training attendance logs
Previous policy versions and change logs
Funder contract clauses referencing safeguarding requirements
validationRules: prefer comma-separated list or bulleted items

enhancedVariables.name: ADDITIONAL_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: Extra evaluation criteria specific to the organization's context (e.g., local regulations, funder-specific clauses) to supplement standard criteria.
examples: Include state-level volunteer screening thresholds for our county
Check alignment with funder X's required beneficiary consent language
Verify consistency with multi-site safeguarding procedures
validationRules: if provided, map each additional criterion to a CRITERION_# instance where possible

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_LOCATION
enhancedVariables.description: Primary physical location or region of the organization (city, state/province, country) that may affect legal or regulatory requirements.
examples: Seattle, WA, USA
Toronto, Ontario, Canada
Nairobi, Kenya

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: Brief explanation of the program or service impacted by the policy, including target population and core activities.
examples: After-school mentoring program for 12–17-year-olds focusing on academic support and life skills.
Food bank distribution program serving low-income households in three neighborhoods.
Community legal aid clinic offering pro bono consultations to immigrants.
validationRules: required when policy applies to a specific program
include target population and primary activities

enhancedVariables.name: LEVEL_OF_SUPERVISION
enhancedVariables.description: Describes the supervisory structure and intensity for staff or volunteers in the program (e.g., direct, indirect, periodic checks), relevant to risk and background check requirements.
examples: Direct supervision: staff present at all interactions with beneficiaries.
Indirect supervision: volunteer pairs checked weekly by program coordinator.
Periodic oversight: monthly site visits and quarterly performance reviews.
validationRules: required for volunteer- or beneficiary-facing programs
if 'Direct' selected, background-check requirements may be stricter

enhancedVariables.name: LEVEL_OF_CONTACT
enhancedVariables.description: Describes the intensity or frequency of contact required between the nonprofit and an individual or stakeholder (e.g., volunteer, client, donor), such as one-time, occasional, or ongoing case management.
examples: One-time — single event volunteer who only needs a pre-shift check-in
Ongoing weekly — mentorship volunteers meeting mentees every week
High-touch case management — clients receive weekly phone calls and monthly home visits
validationRules: Allowed values: One-time, Occasional, Regular, Ongoing weekly, Ongoing monthly, High-touch/case management
Max length 50 characters if free-text option provided

enhancedVariables.name: RELEVANT_REGULATIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies laws, regulatory requirements, funding compliance rules, or sector standards that apply to a program, process, or document the nonprofit manages.
examples: State child protection statute (CA Penal Code §11165.7) for youth volunteers
HIPAA privacy requirements for client health records when running a medical clinic
Donor-restriction reporting rules under FASB ASC 958 for restricted gifts
validationRules: Optional but recommended for regulated activities
Encourage listing citation/reference and short summary for each regulation

enhancedVariables.name: BACKGROUND_CHECK_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: Lists the specific checks and standards used to screen volunteers, staff, or program participants (e.g., criminal record check, sex offender registry, motor vehicle record) and the thresholds for disqualification.
examples: National criminal background check + sex offender registry; any felony within 7 years disqualifies for youth-facing roles
Local police clearance and 3-year driving history with no more than 1 at-fault accident for any driver position
Reference checks from two prior supervisors and a completed child-safety training certificate for mentors
validationRules: Required for roles that interact with vulnerable populations
Should mention type of check and disqualifying criteria where applicable

enhancedVariables.name: SOURCE_SYSTEM
enhancedVariables.description: The originating software or database where data currently resides (e.g., donor CRM, volunteer portal, event platform) that will be the source for a transfer or integration.
examples: Salesforce Nonprofit Success Pack (donor records and gift history)
VolunteerHub portal (volunteer sign-ups and availability)
Eventbrite event registration exports
validationRules: Allowed values should include known organizational systems; allow 'Other' with free-text specifying system name
Max length 100 characters for custom entries

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_SYSTEM
enhancedVariables.description: The destination software or database where data should be moved, synchronized, or mapped to (e.g., accounting package, finance system, another CRM).
examples: QuickBooks Online (for posting donation revenue and reconciliation)
Blackbaud Raiser’s Edge NXT (central donor database)
Xero accounting (general ledger and bank reconciliation)
validationRules: Required when specifying an integration task
Allowed values: list of supported target systems; allow 'Other' with a text field
Max length 100 characters for custom entries

enhancedVariables.name: UNIQUE_IDENTIFIER_FIELDS
enhancedVariables.description: Fields used to uniquely match or de-duplicate records between systems (e.g., donor ID, email, external reference number) to ensure accurate synchronization.
examples: Donor_ID (internal CRM unique ID) and email address as fallback
Volunteer portal external_id combined with date-of-birth for matching
Transaction reference number and bank reference for financial imports
validationRules: List 1–3 fields in order of preference
Max length 250 characters; avoid PII beyond necessary identifiers unless secured

enhancedVariables.name: DESTINATION_SYSTEM
enhancedVariables.description: Alternate term for the system receiving data (used in lower-risk templates) — identifies the place where data records should be stored or processed after transfer.
examples: Organization's accounting system (NetSuite) for monthly posting
Membership database for updated member statuses
Local shared drive (secure folder) for archived CSV imports
validationRules: Allow selection from known destinations or 'Other' with a descriptive name
Max length 100 characters for custom entries

enhancedVariables.name: DATA_FIELDS
