enhancedVariables.description: The specific fields or columns to be extracted, transformed, or imported between systems (e.g., first name, last donation amount, membership level).
examples: FirstName, LastName, Email, DonationAmount, DonationDate
VolunteerName, Role, ShiftDate, HoursServed
MemberID, MembershipLevel, RenewalDate, AutoRenew flag
validationRules: Provide as a comma-separated list or JSON array
Max length 2000 characters; include data type if possible (string, date, currency)

enhancedVariables.name: CRM_SYSTEM
enhancedVariables.description: The customer relationship management platform used by the nonprofit to manage supporters, volunteers, members, and program participants.
examples: Bloomerang for donor management and email segments
CiviCRM for case management and constituent records
Salesforce NPSP for consolidated donor, volunteer, and program data
validationRules: Allowed values: list of known CRMs; allow 'Other' with free-text
Max length 100 characters for custom entries

enhancedVariables.name: REGISTRATION_PLATFORM
enhancedVariables.description: The online service or tool used to collect event or program registrations (e.g., Eventbrite, custom form) that supplies registrant data.
examples: Eventbrite for public fundraising events and ticketing
Google Forms linked to a volunteer onboarding spreadsheet
Ticket Tailor used for small gala registrations
validationRules: Allow common platform choices plus 'Other' with platform URL
Max length 150 characters for custom entries

enhancedVariables.name: DATA_SOURCE
enhancedVariables.description: General descriptor for where specific datasets originate (could be a report, extract, API feed, bank statement, or external partner file) used in reporting, reconciliation, or analysis.
examples: Monthly bank statement PDF exported from Wells Fargo online banking
CSV export from membership portal containing renewals for the previous month
Partner referral spreadsheet received via secure SFTP from county social services
validationRules: If sensitive (bank statements), flag as confidential and require secure transfer method

enhancedVariables.name: REGISTRATION_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Classifies the registration being processed (e.g., volunteer sign-up, attendee ticket, program enrollment) to determine downstream processing steps or fields required.
examples: Volunteer shift sign-up
Paid attendee ticket (VIP)
Program participant intake (structured services)
validationRules: Allowed values: Volunteer, Attendee, Participant, Vendor, Sponsor, Other
If 'Other' selected, require brief description (max 100 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: REGISTRATION_CATEGORIES
enhancedVariables.description: Breakdown of categories or segments used to tag registrations for reporting or routing (e.g., youth, adult, staff, donor level). Multiple categories are expected.
examples: Youth participant; needs transportation
Adult volunteer; background-checked; evening shifts
Donor VIP guest; dietary restriction: vegetarian
validationRules: Provide as comma-separated list; max 500 characters
If category indicates a special need (accessibility, dietary), flag for special handling

enhancedVariables.name: BANK_STATEMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: Refers to bank statement files or statements used for reconciliation, indicating period and origin (e.g., checking account March 2025 PDF).
examples: Wells Fargo Checking Account statement March 2025 (PDF)
Bank of America savings account statements Q1 2025 (combined CSV export)
Community credit union monthly e-statement April 2025
validationRules: Include account name, period (month/year), and file format when possible
Max length 200 characters; mark as sensitive/confidential

enhancedVariables.name: ACCOUNTING_SOFTWARE_EXPORTS
enhancedVariables.description: Exports from accounting or finance software (e.g., trial balance, ledger, transaction exports) used for reconciliation, reporting, or import to other systems.
examples: QuickBooks Online general ledger export March 2025 (CSV)
NetSuite AR aging report for April 2025 (XLSX)
Xero bank transactions export 2025-04-01 to 2025-04-30 (CSV)
validationRules: Specify report name, date range, and file type
Max length 300 characters; confidential — ensure secure handling

enhancedVariables.name: DONATION_PLATFORM_REPORTS
enhancedVariables.description: Summarizes transaction exports, payout reports, and donor-level activity from third-party donation platforms (e.g., Stripe, PayPal, Classy) used for reconciliation and donor records.
examples: Stripe payout summary CSV for July 2025 with fees and net amounts
PayPal monthly donations report including donor email and transaction ID
Classy donation export showing campaign, tribute, and recurring gift flags
validationRules: Accepts CSV, XLSX, or plain text paste of tabular data
If a file is uploaded, ensure file extension is .csv, .xlsx, or .xls
Require at least one transaction row or a report date range

enhancedVariables.name: GRANT_EXPENDITURE_LOGS
enhancedVariables.description: Detailed ledger or spreadsheet listing expenditures charged to specific grants, including dates, amounts, expense categories, and grant line-item references for grant reporting and audits.
examples: Quarterly grant expense log for Education Grant #2024-01 with dates, vendor, GL code, and supporting invoice number
Sheet showing program salaries and fringe charged to Health Grant X, including % allocation and payroll period
Capital improvements ledger for Foundation Grant Y with purchase orders and vendor receipts references
validationRules: Accepts CSV/XLSX or pasted table; require columns for date, amount, payee, grant code
Amounts must be numeric and greater than 0
Dates must be valid and within the grant period when provided

enhancedVariables.name: VARIANCE_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: Numeric tolerance used to flag differences between source data (e.g., platform reports vs. general ledger) that warrant investigation during reconciliation.
examples: 50.00 (flag any variance greater than $50)
0.02 (flag if percent variance exceeds 2%)
5 (flag if count of unmatched transactions exceeds 5)
validationRules: Specify whether value is absolute (dollars) or percent in adjacent field or documentation
If percent entered, require value between 0 and 100

enhancedVariables.name: RESTRICTED_FUND_CODES
enhancedVariables.description: List of internal fund or restriction codes that indicate donor-designated, restricted, or purpose-limited funds used to route revenue and expenses properly.
examples: FND-EDU-2025 (Education scholarship restricted fund)
GRNT-HEALTH-RESTRICT (Restricted to community health programs)
CAPITAL-2024 (Capital campaign — building fund only)
validationRules: Accept comma-separated codes or one per line
Each code should be alphanumeric and less than 50 characters
Require at least one code when processing restricted fund reconciliations

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_RESTRICTIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Textual summary of donor-imposed restrictions or stewardship instructions (e.g., specific program use, duration, or reporting requirements) tied to gifts or pledges.
examples: Funds to be used only for after-school tutoring in Northwest region; annual program update required
Gift restricted to scholarship awards for first-generation college students; no admin costs allowed
General operating gift but donor requests recognition in printed materials only, no public acknowledgment online
validationRules: If legal restrictions exist, require upload of signed agreement (PDF)
Normalize to a structured tag if used repeatedly (e.g., 'program-only', 'scholarship')

enhancedVariables.name: GRANT_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: Key obligations, deliverables, reporting deadlines, and allowable/unallowable costs specified by a grantor that must be tracked for compliance.
examples: Monthly financial reports due by the 10th; quarterly narrative progress reports; equipment purchases require prior approval
Matching funds of 1:1 required; expenditures must use approved vendor list; final impact metrics: 500 households served
Indirect cost rate capped at 8% for grant period; no capital expenditures without written consent
validationRules: If deadlines present, require ISO date entries for each deadline referenced
Encourage structuring as checklist items (deliverable, frequency, due date)

enhancedVariables.name: CHART_OF_ACCOUNTS
enhancedVariables.description: The organization's accounting structure mapping account codes to account names used to classify revenue, expenses, assets, liabilities, and net assets.
examples: 4000 - Donations (Unrestricted); 5000 - Program Services - Education; 6100 - Salaries
100 - Cash - Checking; 200 - Accounts Payable; 300 - Deferred Revenue
8000 - Fundraising Expenses; 8300 - Marketing; 8400 - Volunteer Program Supplies
validationRules: Accept CSV/XLSX or pasted mapping of account code to name and type
Each account code must be unique
Require account type (Asset, Liability, Revenue, Expense, Net Assets) for each code

enhancedVariables.name: BOARD_REQUESTS
enhancedVariables.description: Action items, data requests, or documents requested by the board of directors (e.g., financial summaries, risk assessments, program outcomes) with due dates and responsible staff.
examples: Board asked for monthly cash flow forecast and contingency plan by Aug 15; assigned to CFO
Board requested a one-page impact summary for the upcoming donor briefing; due next meeting
Request for updated conflict-of-interest policy and signed acknowledgements from all board members
validationRules: Include fields for request title, description, requester (board member), assignee, and due date
Due date must be a valid future date

enhancedVariables.name: PRIOR_YEAR_ACTUALS
enhancedVariables.description: Historical financial results (actual revenue and expense figures) from the previous fiscal year used for budgeting, variance analysis, and trend reporting.
examples: FY2024 actuals: Total revenue $1,250,000; program expenses $900,000; fundraising $200,000
Detailed prior year general ledger extract for FY2023 with monthly totals by GL account
Program-level actuals for last fiscal year showing unit costs and participant counts
validationRules: Accepts summarized figures or full ledger CSV/XLSX
Amounts must be numeric and include fiscal year identifier
If uploading, require column headers for account, month, and amount

enhancedVariables.name: FINANCIAL_DOCUMENT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the kind of financial document being processed or requested (e.g., bank statement, invoice, grant report, donation summary) to apply correct handling and templates.
examples: Bank statement - checking account (monthly)
Vendor invoice - subcontractor invoice #4567
Grant financial report - Q2 grantor template
validationRules: Allowed values: bank_statement, invoice, donation_report, grant_report, payroll_summary, other
If 'other' selected, require descriptive text (max 200 chars)
Selection required when uploading financial files

enhancedVariables.name: SOURCE_#
enhancedVariables.description: Identifies an individual source of data or a file used in processing (e.g., 'Stripe export', 'Excel ledger', 'Bank CSV'); multiple numbered instances (SOURCE_1, SOURCE_2, ...) are expected when comparing or merging sources.
examples: SOURCE_1: Stripe_transactions_Jul2025.csv (platform export including fees)
SOURCE_2: QuickBooks_bank_import_Jul2025.xlsx (bank reconciliation file)
SOURCE_3: Donation_forms_online_pdf (scanned pledge forms) -- additional instances allowed
validationRules: Each instance must include a source name and either a file link or brief description
Support up to the configured maxNumber (here max 2, but system should allow expansion)
If multiple sources provided, require a unique identifier per source

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_CHART_OF_ACCOUNTS
enhancedVariables.description: The organization-specific canonical chart of accounts mapping used across systems and teams to ensure consistent categorization in reports and reconciliations.
examples: Canonical COA v3.2 mapping: 1000-Cash, 2000-AP, 4100-Unrestricted Donations, 7200-Program Supplies
Centralized COA spreadsheet with GL code, name, category, and whether restricted
Master COA used by finance and operations with departmental sub-codes: 6100-Payroll:HR, 6100-Payroll:Programs
validationRules: Require upload or paste of full COA when used for mapping
Each account entry must include code, name, and account type
COA versioning recommended; require effective date if provided

enhancedVariables.name: SPENDING_THRESHOLDS
enhancedVariables.description: Predefined dollar or percentage limits that trigger approval workflows, require additional documentation, or determine allowable spending tiers (e.g., procurement thresholds).
examples: $5,000 (manager approval), $25,000 (director approval), $100,000 (board approval required)
Capital purchases over $10,000 require three bids and executive sign-off
Program expense single-item cap: $2,500 without prior grantor approval
validationRules: Define threshold entries as amount + required approver role
Amounts must be positive numbers with currency specification
If percentages used, value must be between 0 and 100

enhancedVariables.name: REPORTING_PERIOD
enhancedVariables.description: Defines the time window for reports or reconciliations (e.g., fiscal quarter, month, or custom date range) used to filter financial and program data.
examples: Monthly report: July 2025 (2025-07-01 to 2025-07-31)
Custom range: 2024-09-01 to 2025-08-31 (fiscal year)
validationRules: Require start_date and end_date when using date range
End date must be on or after start date
Support shorthand selections: monthly, quarterly, fiscal year

enhancedVariables.name: STAKEHOLDER_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Classifies the audience for reports or communications (e.g., board, major donors, grantor, program participants, regulatory body) to tailor content and level of detail.
examples: Board of Directors (high-level financial summary and strategic risks)
Foundation Funder (detailed grant metrics, budget vs. actual, compliance items)
Community Partners (program outcomes, participant stories, and next steps)
validationRules: Allowed values example: board, funder, donor, regulator, partner, public
If 'funder' selected, require grant ID or funder name
Selection required for templated report generation

enhancedVariables.name: DATA_SOURCE_#
enhancedVariables.description: Identifies a specific external or internal data source used for reconciliation or reporting; multiple numbered instances (e.g., DATA_SOURCE_1, DATA_SOURCE_2) are expected to list each source separately.
examples: Accounting export from QuickBooks Online (monthly transaction CSV)
Bank statements downloaded from Bank of America (ACH and check activity)
Donor database export from Salesforce Nonprofit Success Pack (gift transactions)
validationRules: If 'select' includes an 'Other' option, allow free-text input for source name
Max length 200 characters for custom entries

enhancedVariables.name: SMALL_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: Numeric amount that defines the lower bound for what the organization considers a 'small' transaction or invoice for routing, approval, or batching purposes.
validationRules: Should be less than LARGE_THRESHOLD if LARGE_THRESHOLD is set
Integer or two-decimal currency format allowed

enhancedVariables.name: LARGE_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: Numeric amount that defines the threshold above which transactions require higher-level approvals, special handling, or different workflows.
validationRules: Should be greater than SMALL_THRESHOLD if SMALL_THRESHOLD is set
Integer or two-decimal currency format allowed

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_CODES
enhancedVariables.description: A comma-separated list or mapping of internal program codes used to tag expenses, donations, or activities to specific programs or grants.
examples: EDU-2025, YOUTH-OUTREACH, ADMIN
GRANT-A21, LOCAL-SERVICES, FUNDRAISING
HEALTHCARE,COMMUNITY-FOOD-BANK,OPERATIONS
validationRules: Require at least one program code
Each code max 50 characters; use comma or newline to separate
Disallow special characters beyond letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores

enhancedVariables.name: ACCOUNTING_SYSTEM
enhancedVariables.description: The name of the accounting or financial system the nonprofit uses for bookkeeping and reporting (used to map imports or API integrations).
examples: QuickBooks Online
Sage Intacct
Blackbaud Financial Edge NXT
validationRules: If 'Other' selected, require a text entry describing the system (max 100 chars)
Choose from a maintained list of supported systems where possible

enhancedVariables.name: APPROVAL_LEVEL_#
enhancedVariables.description: Defines an approval role or level in an approval workflow (multiple numbered instances expected, e.g., APPROVAL_LEVEL_1, APPROVAL_LEVEL_2) such as 'Manager – $0–$1,000'.
examples: Program Manager — up to $1,000
Finance Director — $1,001–$10,000
Executive Director — over $10,000
validationRules: At least one instance required for approval workflows
Each entry should include role/title and amount range if applicable

enhancedVariables.name: PAYMENT_TERMS
enhancedVariables.description: Standard payment terms the nonprofit agrees to with vendors (used to categorize invoices and trigger reminders), e.g., net 30, net 45, due on receipt.
examples: Net 30
Due on receipt
Net 45 with 2% 10-day early payment discount
validationRules: If 'Custom' selected, allow free-text details (max 200 chars)
Accept common term formats like 'Net X' or descriptive terms

enhancedVariables.name: DEPARTMENT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Name of the internal department associated with a transaction, member, or group (used for routing, reporting, and contact assignment).
examples: Programs — Youth Services
Development
Finance & Operations
validationRules: Disallow only numeric entries; prefer descriptive names

enhancedVariables.name: APPROXIMATE_MEMBER_COUNT
enhancedVariables.description: Estimated total number of members in a membership group or association, used for planning communications, events, and capacity forecasting.
validationRules: If zero, include explanation in related notes
Reasonable upper bound check (e.g., less than 1,000,000) to catch entry errors

enhancedVariables.name: MEMBERSHIP_LEVELS
enhancedVariables.description: Defines the tiers or categories of membership (e.g., Bronze, Silver, Gold) used for benefits, billing, and communications segmentation.
examples: Basic, Supporter, Sustainer, Patron
Student (free), Individual ($25/yr), Family ($40/yr)
Bronze — $50, Silver — $150, Gold — $500
validationRules: Each level max 100 characters; separate by commas or newlines
If pricing included, validate numeric currency formats

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_CHALLENGES
enhancedVariables.description: Free-text description of particular data maintenance or membership problems the nonprofit faces (e.g., high duplicate rate, inaccurate addresses).
examples: Many records lack secondary contact phone numbers and emergency contacts.
High duplicate rate after annual bulk import from event sign-ups.
Expired memberships not automatically deactivated, causing mailing errors.
validationRules: Optional but recommended for troubleshooting workflows
Encourage listing the top 3 challenges separated by line breaks

enhancedVariables.name: MEMBERSHIP_RULES
enhancedVariables.description: Formal or operational rules that govern membership status changes, renewals, grace periods, and eligibility used for automating membership workflows.
examples: Automatic renewal 30 days before expiry; 15-day grace period for payment.
Members with unpaid dues for 60 days are moved to 'Inactive' and lose event discounts.
Student rate requires valid student ID and expires at end of academic year (Aug 31).
validationRules: Required when automation depends on membership lifecycle
Prefer rule bullets or numbered lists for clarity

enhancedVariables.name: DUPLICATE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies how to treat potential duplicate records or a flag indicating whether a record is considered a duplicate during data cleaning processes.
examples: Mark as duplicate if same email and last name found within 12 months
Merge duplicates keeping newest domicile address and retaining both donation histories
Flag suspected duplicate for manual review if multiple matching fields but different DOB
validationRules: If 'Auto-merge' selected, require merge rules detailing which fields to prioritize
Max 500 characters for any custom merge instructions

enhancedVariables.name: MISSING
enhancedVariables.description: Defines handling rules or fields considered critical when data is missing (e.g., missing email, missing membership ID) to trigger follow-up or enrichment workflows.
examples: If email is missing, create task for member outreach within 7 days
Missing billing address should block renewal until updated
Log records missing donor consent and notify CRM admin weekly
validationRules: List critical fields and corresponding actions; max 1000 characters
If actions include timeframes, validate presence of numeric days (e.g., '7 days')
Optional but recommended for data quality automation

enhancedVariables.name: EXPIRATION_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: Number of days before an item (membership, license, certification) expires at which automated reminders or renewal actions should begin.
validationRules: Typical range 0–365; warn if value exceeds 365
Required when automated reminder schedules are enabled

enhancedVariables.name: SEGMENTATION_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: Defines the rules or attributes used to segment contacts, donors, members, or volunteers for targeted communications or reporting (e.g., giving level, engagement, geography).
examples: Donors who gave $500+ in the last 12 months (Major Donors)
Active volunteers with 20+ hours in the past year, located in Los Angeles
Program participants aged 18–25 enrolled in workforce development
validationRules: Required when creating a segmented list
Should reference known fields (e.g., donation_amount, volunteer_hours, zip_code) when used in automated systems

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_RULES
enhancedVariables.description: High-level operational rules or conventions the organization follows for processes such as timesheet approvals, data handling, or access controls.
examples: All volunteer timesheets must be approved by a supervisor within 7 calendar days
Donor data may not be shared outside organization without written consent
Expense reports over $250 require CFO and program director sign-off
validationRules: Should be written as clear, actionable statements (imperative or declarative rules)

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_CATEGORIES
enhancedVariables.description: The list of program areas or service categories the nonprofit runs, used to tag activities, expenses, reports, and participant records.
examples: Youth Education; After-School Tutoring; Summer STEM Camps
Housing Support; Rapid Rehousing; Tenant Counseling
Mental Health Services; Group Therapy; Crisis Hotline
validationRules: Provide as a semicolon- or comma-separated list
Each category max 100 characters; total combined length max 2000 characters

enhancedVariables.name: VOLUNTEER_ROLES
enhancedVariables.description: Names and brief definitions of volunteer positions used for scheduling, reporting, and skills matching (multiple roles expected).
examples: Community Outreach Ambassador — represents org at local events and distributes materials
Homework Tutor — provides one-on-one academic support to middle school students
Intake Coordinator — performs client intake interviews and eligibility screening
validationRules: Multiple instances expected; supply as newline-separated entries
Each role entry should be 3–200 characters

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_NAMES
enhancedVariables.description: Standardized names for events (fundraisers, trainings, volunteer shifts) used in calendars, reports, and communications.
examples: Annual Gala — Spring Benefit Dinner
Volunteer Orientation: Q3 Cohort
Community Food Drive — Downtown Hub
validationRules: Provide as newline-separated list or array
Include date or cohort context if recurring (recommended)

enhancedVariables.name: VALUE_OF_VOLUNTEER_HOUR
enhancedVariables.description: Monetary valuation assigned to one hour of volunteer time for reporting in grant applications, impact statements, or in-kind contribution records.
examples: Volunteer hour value: 28.54 (USD) — national average used for annual report
Volunteer hour value: 18.00 (USD) — local standard for this program
Volunteer hour value: 25.00 (USD) — used for CSR partner impact calculations
validationRules: Required numeric value in currency units (decimal allowed)

enhancedVariables.name: HOURLY_RATE
enhancedVariables.description: Hourly pay rate used for staff cost calculations, temporary workers, or stipends (may apply to paid program staff or contractors).
examples: Program coordinator hourly_rate: 22.50 (USD)
Temporary event staff hourly_rate: 15.00 (USD)
Licensed counselor hourly_rate: 60.00 (USD)
validationRules: Greater than or equal to minimum wage and less than 500.00 (unless justified)

enhancedVariables.name: MILESTONE_HOURS
enhancedVariables.description: Predefined hourly thresholds used to trigger milestones, recognition, or reporting (e.g., volunteer recognition levels or training benchmarks).
examples: Volunteer Milestones: 25, 100, 500 hours for Bronze/Silver/Gold recognition
Training completion milestone: 8 hours required to receive certificate
Internship requirement: 120 milestone hours to qualify for stipend
validationRules: Provide as comma- or newline-separated integers
Each value must be a positive integer

enhancedVariables.name: TRACKING_SYSTEM
enhancedVariables.description: Name or identifier of the database or software used to track volunteers, donors, programs, or financials (used to route data or map fields).
examples: Salesforce Nonprofit Cloud (Volunteer & Donor modules)
Almabase for alumni engagement and event RSVPs
Excel master tracker (Volunteer_Hours_2025.xlsx) on shared drive
validationRules: Must match one of the configured tracking systems or provide a custom label
When integrated, include connection details elsewhere (not in this field)

enhancedVariables.name: EXPENSE_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: Monetary cutoff above which different approvals, reviews, or audit procedures are required for expense reports or reimbursements.
examples: Expense threshold: 250.00 (USD) — manager approval required above this amount
Expense threshold: 1000.00 (USD) — executive approval and supporting receipts required
Expense threshold: 50.00 (USD) — receipts not required below this amount
validationRules: Two decimal places allowed; must be less than 1000000

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_POLICY
enhancedVariables.description: Formal policy text or reference that governs organizational behavior, compliance, or internal processes (e.g., expense, privacy, or conflict-of-interest policy).
examples: Data Privacy Policy — donor PII retained for 7 years and encrypted at rest
Conflicts of Interest Policy — board members must recuse from vendor decisions where a conflict exists
Travel & Expense Policy — per diem allowed up to $75/day domestic
validationRules: Required for process automation that enforces policy
Should reference effective date and version number where applicable

enhancedVariables.name: BRACKETS
enhancedVariables.description: Defined grouping ranges (brackets) used for categorization such as donation levels, age groups, performance scores, or expense bins.
examples: Donation brackets: $0–49 (Supporter), $50–499 (Advocate), $500+ (Champion)
Age brackets for program eligibility: 0–5, 6–12, 13–17, 18–24, 25+
Survey score brackets: 0–2 (Low), 3–4 (Medium), 5 (High)
validationRules: Provide as structured ranges with labels (e.g., min–max:Label) line-by-line
Ranges must not overlap and should cover intended domain
Numeric bounds required for numeric brackets; clear labels required

enhancedVariables.name: EXPENSE_POLICY
enhancedVariables.description: Specific policy text or summary that explains allowable expenses, documentation required, and reimbursement procedures for staff and volunteers.
examples: Expenses allowable: travel, supplies, client meals; receipts required for purchases over $25
Mileage reimbursed at IRS rate per mile; personal car insurance must be maintained
No alcohol reimbursements; last resort exceptions require written CFO approval
validationRules: Should include effective date and approver
Use clear bullets or numbered items for automated parsing

enhancedVariables.name: GRANT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Official name of a grant or funding source used to tag expenses, outcomes, and reports for compliance and donor/grantor recognition.
examples: City Youth Services Grant 2025 (CYS-2025)
Smith Family Foundation Capacity Building Grant
Department of Education - Workforce Innovation Grant
validationRules: If acronym used, provide full grant title or code in parentheses

enhancedVariables.name: APPROVAL_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: Monetary or conditional threshold that determines which level of staff must approve an action (e.g., expense amount, contract value).
examples: Approval threshold: Manager approves up to $1,000; Director required above $1,000
Approval threshold for volunteer background checks: required for roles with access to minors
Approval threshold: purchase orders above $5,000 require competitive bids
validationRules: Describe numeric thresholds and associated approver roles
When numeric values present, they must be positive numbers with two-decimal precision
Avoid ambiguous language; each rule should map to an approver role

enhancedVariables.name: CAUSE_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: The primary social or programmatic area the nonprofit focuses on (e.g., education, homelessness, conservation). Used to tailor messaging, target audiences, and content tone to that cause.
examples: Youth education and after-school tutoring
Emergency shelter and homelessness prevention
Urban tree planting and community greening
validationRules: Required for content that references mission or programs
Maximum length 100 characters if free-text option allowed
If 'Other' selected, require a brief text description (textarea, max 200 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: PLATFORM_#
enhancedVariables.description: A numbered instance of a distribution channel or social platform (e.g., PLATFORM_1, PLATFORM_2) when multiple platforms are supplied; each represents one specific channel to adapt content for.
examples: PLATFORM_1: Facebook page (organization main)
PLATFORM_2: Instagram stories (fundraising campaign)
PLATFORM_3: LinkedIn organization updates
validationRules: Accepts one platform per numbered instance
If using numbering, indexes must be sequential starting at 1

enhancedVariables.name: PLATFORM
enhancedVariables.description: A single, non-numbered distribution channel or content platform where adapted content will be posted (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, newsletter).
examples: Facebook (organization page)
Email newsletter (monthly donors)
Instagram feed (campaign visuals)
validationRules: Required if adapting content for a specific channel
Limit to known platform names or 'Other' with description

enhancedVariables.name: LENGTH
enhancedVariables.description: Desired target length for the output content (e.g., word count, character count, or duration) used to control brevity and format.
examples: Approx. 150 words for a social post
30–45 second video script
800–1,000 word blog post
validationRules: Accepts free-text ranges or numeric plus unit (e.g., '150 words', '30s', '800-1000 words')

enhancedVariables.name: PLATFORM_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The human-friendly name of a platform contact or channel (e.g., 'Facebook — Community Page', 'NYC Volunteer Slack'), useful when multiple accounts or segments exist on the same platform.
examples: Facebook — Main Organization Page
Instagram — Youth Program Account
Email — Monthly Donors Segment
validationRules: Required when specifying platform account distinctions
Disallow special control characters; basic punctuation allowed

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_KEYWORDS
enhancedVariables.description: Keywords or key phrases to prioritize for SEO, search, or thematic emphasis in website copy or content creation to improve discoverability.
examples: after-school tutoring, literacy support, volunteer mentors
emergency shelter, rapid rehousing, winter shelter program
urban forestry, community planting, canopy cover
validationRules: Provide as comma-separated list or one-per-line

enhancedVariables.name: MAILING_ADDRESS
enhancedVariables.description: The nonprofit's physical mailing address used for contact details, donor receipts, or regulatory disclosures on websites and printed materials.
examples: 123 Hope Street, Suite 400, Boston, MA 02110, USA
PO Box 547, Sacramento, CA 95812
Unit 2, Community Center, 45 Oak Lane, London, SE1 2AB, UK
validationRules: Required format: street, city, state/province, postal code, country where applicable
If country is US, validate 5- or 9-digit ZIP; if UK, validate UK postcode format (where possible)

enhancedVariables.name: WEBSITE_SECTION
enhancedVariables.description: Specific section or page of the organization's website where converted copy will appear (e.g., About Us, Programs, Donate page), used to adapt tone and structure.
examples: About Us — Mission & History
Programs — Youth Mentoring
Donate — Monthly Giving Landing Page
validationRules: If 'Other' selected, require short description (max 100 chars)
Max length 80 characters for section label

enhancedVariables.name: VIDEO_LENGTH
enhancedVariables.description: Target duration for a video or video script (in seconds or minutes) to guide pacing and level of detail for multimedia content.
examples: 60 seconds (short social post)
3 minutes (program overview video)
10 minutes (testimonial and impact story)
validationRules: Accept formats like '60s', '1m', '3 minutes' or numeric plus unit

enhancedVariables.name: DISTRIBUTION_PLATFORM
enhancedVariables.description: The specific channel(s) planned for distributing a piece of content (broader than PLATFORM_NAME), including paid channels or partner networks (e.g., email list, partner newsletter, radio).
examples: Organization email list (45,000 subscribers)
Local community radio partner — weekday morning slot
Paid Facebook ad campaign targeting donors
validationRules: Allow multiple entries separated by commas or new lines

enhancedVariables.name: TOPIC
enhancedVariables.description: The central subject or theme for the piece of content, training, or presentation (e.g., volunteer onboarding, fundraising best practices, climate resilience).
examples: Volunteer retention strategies for first-year volunteers
Write-up: Impact of mobile food pantry in Eastside neighborhood
Workshop: Fundraising basics for grassroots organizers
validationRules: Avoid ambiguous one-word topics; prefer short descriptive phrase

enhancedVariables.name: AUDIENCE_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The intended audience for the content or report (e.g., major donors, program participants, board members), used to set tone, level of detail, and call-to-action.
examples: Major donors (giving $5,000+ annually)
Program participants and their families
Board members and key stakeholders
validationRules: If 'Custom' selected, provide short description (max 100 chars)
Max length 80 characters for selection label

enhancedVariables.name: SECTOR_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The broader sector context in which the nonprofit operates (e.g., human services, arts & culture, environment), used to align language, benchmarks, and compliance considerations.
examples: Human services (shelter and housing programs)
Environment & conservation (urban forestry and watershed protection)
Arts & culture (community theatre and youth arts education)
validationRules: Prefer selection from standardized sector list
If 'Other' chosen, require brief explanation (max 120 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: REPORT_TITLE
enhancedVariables.description: The formal title of a report, summary, or document to be generated or adapted (used in headings, metadata, and file naming).
examples: 2024 Annual Impact Report — Education Programs
Quarterly Grant Performance Summary — Q2 2025
Evaluation: Youth Mentoring Pilot Outcomes

enhancedVariables.name: REPORT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The format or purpose of the report (e.g., impact report, grant compliance, audit response), which informs structure, required sections, and tone.
examples: Impact report for donors
Grant compliance and financial reconciliation
Program evaluation and recommendations
validationRules: Select from standardized types where available
If 'Other', require a short descriptor (max 100 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: WORD_COUNT
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the desired target length (in words) for generated content such as articles, social posts, speeches, or newsletters.
validationRules: Required when generating full-length content; optional for short snippets

enhancedVariables.name: CONTENT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Identifies the kind of content to produce or adapt (e.g., blog post, newsletter, social post, speech), which guides tone, structure, and formatting.
examples: Fundraising newsletter
Thought leadership blog post
Instagram carousel
validationRules: Must match one of the predefined content types used by the organization

enhancedVariables.name: SECTOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of the sector or field the nonprofit serves or is writing about (used to tailor examples, language, and sector-specific data).
examples: Community mental health
Youth education and after-school programs
Marine conservation
validationRules: No special characters beyond basic punctuation
Recommended to use standardized sector taxonomy if available

enhancedVariables.name: SECTOR
enhancedVariables.description: A concise label or code for the sector (short form) used for segmentation, tagging, or template logic (e.g., 'education', 'health').
examples: education
public-health
environment
validationRules: Must match one of the organization's accepted sector tags

enhancedVariables.name: VALUES
enhancedVariables.description: Key organizational values or principles to reflect in messaging (used to ensure voice alignment and consistent mission-driven language).
examples: Equity, dignity, community-driven solutions
Transparency, accountability, impact-driven
Collaboration, inclusion, innovation

enhancedVariables.name: DESIRED_ACTION
enhancedVariables.description: The primary action you want the audience to take after reading the content (used to shape calls to action and conversion-focused language).
examples: Donate to our emergency relief fund
Register for the community workshop
Share this post with three friends
validationRules: Must be a clear, actionable phrase
If custom action chosen, require description (max 200 characters)

enhancedVariables.name: ARTICLE_TITLE
enhancedVariables.description: The working or final title for an article or blog post which guides focus, SEO, and headline conventions.
examples: How After-School Programs Reduce Youth Crime in Our City
Five Ways Donors Can Support Climate Resilience
Volunteer Spotlight: Building Hope Through Home Repairs
validationRules: Recommended: include main keyword when applicable

enhancedVariables.name: MAIN_TOPIC
enhancedVariables.description: The central subject, theme, or issue the content should cover, used to keep generated content focused and relevant.
examples: Volunteer recruitment strategies for local shelters
Impact of subsidized childcare on working parents
Best practices for corporate-nonprofit partnerships

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_COMPANY
enhancedVariables.description: The specific corporate partner or prospect the outreach or partnership pitch is aimed at, used to customize benefits and alignment points.
examples: GreenTech Solutions Inc.
Bayside Bank
Sunrise Retail Group
validationRules: Should be a registered company name where possible

enhancedVariables.name: COMPANY_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The company name for contact records or partnership materials; similar to TARGET_COMPANY but used in contact/person contexts or partner lists.
examples: Bright Horizons Foundation
Harbor Logistics Ltd.
Maple Street Brewing Co.
validationRules: Optional company identification number if available

enhancedVariables.name: PARTNERSHIP_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the model or scope of partnership being proposed or evaluated (e.g., sponsorship, strategic partnership, in-kind support).
examples: Employee volunteer program partnership
Cause marketing sponsorship
Long-term program funding (3-year)
validationRules: Must match one of the organization's partnership categories
If 'other' selected, require a short description (max 200 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_DATE_TIME
enhancedVariables.description: The scheduled date and start time for an event or activity, used in promotional materials, calendars, and reminders.
validationRules: ISO 8601 recommended (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS) when time is required
Must be a future date for event promotion
Timezone should be specified when relevant

enhancedVariables.name: REGISTRATION_DETAILS
enhancedVariables.description: Information about how participants sign up for an event, including links, deadlines, fees, and contact instructions.
examples: Register at https://example.org/register by May 25; $10 suggested donation
RSVP to events@nonprofit.org with name and phone by June 1
Sign-up form: https://forms.gle/abc123 — registration closes 48 hours before start
validationRules: If URL included, validate for proper format

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_MISSION
enhancedVariables.description: A concise statement of the nonprofit's mission used to anchor messaging and demonstrate alignment in communications and proposals.
examples: To expand access to quality early childhood education for low-income families.
We empower survivors of domestic violence through shelter, counseling, and job training.
Protecting coastal ecosystems by restoring wetlands and engaging local communities.

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_ASK
enhancedVariables.description: A clear, concrete request made of the audience (donation amount, volunteer hours, program support, etc.) intended to produce a measurable response.
examples: Please donate $50 to provide school supplies for one child.
Volunteer for a 3-hour shift on Saturday to help with meal deliveries.
Pledge corporate match of employee donations up to $25,000.
validationRules: Should include quantity, timeframe, or monetary value when applicable

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_OR_INITIATIVE
enhancedVariables.description: The name of the nonprofit program, service, campaign or initiative being referenced; used to tie messaging to a specific organizational effort.
examples: Summer Meals for Kids 2025
Career Pathways Workforce Training
Emergency Shelter Expansion Project
validationRules: noSpecialChars: allow basic punctuation (commas, ampersands, hyphens, apostrophes)

enhancedVariables.name: CITY_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The city or municipality where an event, program, office, or announcement is focused or occurring.
examples: Oakland
Des Moines
Pine Ridge

enhancedVariables.name: ANNOUNCEMENT_TOPIC
enhancedVariables.description: A concise statement of the subject matter for a press release or public announcement (what the announcement is about).
examples: Launch of a new mobile food pantry
Annual fundraising gala winners announced
Free legal clinics for tenants facing eviction

enhancedVariables.name: ANNOUNCEMENT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The classification of the announcement to guide tone and distribution (e.g., press release, public service announcement, event invite).
examples: Press release
Media advisory
Community bulletin
validationRules: allowedValues: ["Press release","Media advisory","Event invite","PSA","Newsletter blurb","Internal memo"]

enhancedVariables.name: SPOKESPERSON_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The person designated to speak to media or the public about the announcement; typically an executive, program director, or subject-matter expert.
examples: Maria Gonzalez, Executive Director
Dr. Jamal Reed, Program Director
Alicia Chen, Volunteer Coordinator

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_AUDIENCE_LIST
enhancedVariables.description: A comma-separated or list field specifying primary audiences for the content (segments like donors, volunteers, clients, media outlets, partners).
examples: Major donors, foundation partners, board members
Local parents, school counselors, community centers
Local press, neighborhood blogs, radio stations

enhancedVariables.name: PLATFORM_LIST
enhancedVariables.description: List of channels where the content will be published or promoted (social networks, email, website, local media).
examples: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Email newsletter
Organization website news page, LinkedIn
Local radio PSA, Community newspaper

enhancedVariables.name: PRIMARY_GOAL
enhancedVariables.description: The main objective for a piece of communications or program (what you want the audience to think, feel, or do after exposure).
examples: Increase online donations by 20% this quarter
Recruit 30 summer volunteers for the mentoring program
Raise awareness about eviction prevention services

enhancedVariables.name: SIGNATURE
enhancedVariables.description: The formal sign-off used in outgoing letters or emails, typically includes name, organization and optionally contact details and social links.
examples:
Sincerely, Ana Patel
Executive Director, HopeBridge
(555) 123-4567

Best regards,
Marcus Lee
Volunteer Services Coordinator
HopeBridge.org/volunteer

With gratitude,
Board of Directors
Neighborhood Food Network

enhancedVariables.name: BRIEF_IMPACT_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: A short (1–2 sentence) summary of the impact the organization or program has achieved, for use in thank-you messages or donor reports.
examples: Your support enabled 1,200 nutritious meals for children in our summer program.
Thanks to donors, our job-readiness workshops placed 45 participants in stable employment.
Donations funded emergency grants that prevented 30 families from becoming unhoused.

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_PROGRAM_OUTCOME
enhancedVariables.description: A measurable or observable result from a program (an outcome tied to goals, e.g., people served, percent improvement, services delivered).
examples: Reached 500 youth with after-school tutoring this year
Reduced client wait times for counseling from 21 to 7 days
Achieved a 73% job placement rate among program graduates

enhancedVariables.name: BRIEF_SUCCESS_STORY_OR_STATISTIC
enhancedVariables.description: Either a one-sentence anecdote highlighting a specific beneficiary or a short compelling statistic that illustrates program success.
examples: "After joining our shelter program, Jamal graduated and secured stable housing within three months."
"95% of respondents reported improved mental health after our counseling sessions."
"One volunteer logged 200 hours helping distribute food to isolated seniors."

enhancedVariables.name: SIMPLE_ENGAGEMENT_OPTION
enhancedVariables.description: A low-friction call-to-action offered to supporters (easy ways to engage immediately, such as donate, sign up, share, or volunteer for short tasks).
examples: Share this post with three neighbors
Sign up for a 2-hour weekend volunteer shift
Make a $25 monthly sustaining gift
validationRules: allowedValues: ["Share on social","Volunteer short shift","Donate one-time","Join mailing list","Attend info session"]

enhancedVariables.name: SENDER_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The person sending the communication (often used in greetings or email from fields) — can be an individual or department name.
examples: Karen Mitchell
Donor Relations Team
Samuel Okoro, Communications Manager

enhancedVariables.name: SENDER_TITLE
enhancedVariables.description: The professional title or role of the sender to add credibility and context to the message (e.g., Executive Director, Program Manager).
examples: Executive Director
Director of Development
Volunteer Coordinator

enhancedVariables.name: TIMELY_INVITATION_OR_UPDATE
enhancedVariables.description: A concise statement of when a donor or stakeholder should expect an upcoming event invitation or program update; used to set expectations about timing and next communications.
examples: You will receive an invitation to our spring fundraiser by March 10.
Expect a detailed program update two weeks after the workshop concludes.
We will email your volunteer schedule 72 hours before your shift.
validationRules: Prefer inclusion of a date or relative timeframe (e.g., 'by MMM D' or 'within X days')

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_HISTORY_DESCRIPTOR
enhancedVariables.description: A brief summary of a donor's past relationship with the organization, including giving patterns, past involvement, or notable milestones; used to personalize outreach.
examples: Three-year recurring monthly donor since 2021 who funds our education programs.
First-time major gift of $5,000 to the emergency relief fund in 2024.
Volunteer and donor for over a decade, regularly attends annual galas.
validationRules: Optional but recommended for personalized communications
Avoid sensitive personal data (SSN, medical) — only relationship and giving history

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_OUTCOME_DETAILS
enhancedVariables.description: Concrete, measurable results achieved through a program or donation (outputs or outcomes) that can be cited in reports or thank-you messages.
examples: Provided 1,200 nutritious meals to families in the neighborhood last quarter.
Graduated 45 students from our job-readiness program with an 80% employment rate within 3 months.
Installed solar panels on 20 community centers, reducing energy costs by 35% annually.
validationRules: Should include a numeric metric when possible (e.g., count, percentage)

enhancedVariables.name: RELEVANT_TESTIMONIAL_OR_STORY
enhancedVariables.description: A short, donor-appropriate quote or anecdote from a beneficiary, volunteer, or staff member that illustrates program impact and humanizes communications.
examples: "Because of this scholarship, I could finish school and now work as a nurse," — Maria, scholarship recipient.
"Volunteering here gave me a sense of community and purpose," — James, volunteer coordinator.
"The shelter's support helped me find stable housing within two months," — Aisha, client.
validationRules: Include attribution (first name and role) where possible
Limit to 2 sentences or 300 characters for brevity
Ensure consent obtained before using personal testimonials

enhancedVariables.name: PERSONAL_CONNECTION_OR_HISTORY
enhancedVariables.description: Notes on a donor's personal ties to the cause or organization (e.g., family connection, previous involvement, or reasons for giving) used to personalize messaging.
examples: Donor’s daughter participated in our youth mentorship program in 2018.
Became involved after volunteering at last year’s flood relief efforts.
Supports literacy initiatives because they are a retired teacher.
validationRules: Optional, but include only non-sensitive personal details
Verify accuracy before use in outreach

enhancedVariables.name: PERSONALIZED_ENGAGEMENT_OFFER
enhancedVariables.description: A tailored opportunity offered to a donor or supporter (e.g., VIP event invite, volunteer role, site visit) that matches their interests and history with the organization.
examples: Invitation to a private donor briefing with the program director on April 5.
Offer to co-host a volunteer day at our community garden next month.
Personal tour of the facility for you and a guest during National Volunteer Week.
validationRules: Include date/time or indicate 'to be scheduled' if unknown
Mark as 'requires follow-up' if RSVP or coordination needed

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_FOLLOW_UP_PLAN
enhancedVariables.description: A clear action plan stating who will follow up, how, and when (e.g., phone call, email, meeting) after initial communication or event.
examples: Development associate will call within 7 days to discuss naming opportunities.
Send a program impact email with photos two weeks after donor visit.
Schedule a gratitude meeting with the executive director within 30 days.
validationRules: Should include responsible person/role, method, and timeframe
Required when promising a next action in donor-facing copy

enhancedVariables.name: LEADERSHIP_OR_EXCLUSIVE_OPPORTUNITY
enhancedVariables.description: A description of a premium engagement or giving-level opportunity (e.g., committee leadership, naming rights, exclusive briefings) reserved for top supporters.
examples: Opportunity to join the advisory council for our new youth center.
Naming rights for the community reading room at $50,000 gift level.
Exclusive quarterly strategy calls with the executive director for leadership donors.
validationRules: Include eligibility or gift threshold if applicable
Ensure legal/board approval required for naming or contractual offers

enhancedVariables.name: IMPACT_POINT_#
enhancedVariables.description: A concise, numbered impact statement highlighting a specific result or benefit of the program; multiple instances (e.g., IMPACT_POINT_1, IMPACT_POINT_2) are expected for listing several points.
examples: IMPACT_POINT_1: Trained 200 local leaders in disaster preparedness.
IMPACT_POINT_2: Distributed 3,500 hygiene kits to families in need.
IMPACT_POINT_3: Reduced school absenteeism by 22% in partner districts.
validationRules: Numbered pattern required when multiple instances are used (1..maxNumber)
Each point should be a single sentence, max 200 characters
Prefer inclusion of a measurable metric and timeframe

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: A classification of the donor relationship (e.g., individual, major donor, foundation, corporate, recurring) to tailor stewardship and messaging.
examples: Major individual donor (annual gifts > $10,000).
Corporate sponsor—events and program partner.
Monthly recurring donor via online giving platform.
validationRules: Values should come from organization’s donor taxonomy (e.g., 'individual', 'major', 'foundation', 'corporate', 'monthly')
If 'major' selected, require entering threshold in donor record

enhancedVariables.name: DONATION_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the form or designation of a gift (e.g., restricted/unrestricted, one-time/recurring, in-kind, stock) to ensure correct acknowledgement and tracking.
examples: One-time unrestricted cash donation.
Recurring monthly gift designated for the scholarship fund.
In-kind donation: 50 laptops for the computer lab.
validationRules: If 'in-kind', require description and estimated value

enhancedVariables.name: SECTION_OR_PROGRAM_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official name of the program, department, or website section referenced in communications or content templates.
examples: Youth Mentorship Program
Community Health Outreach — Mobile Clinic
Volunteer Opportunities: Food Distribution Section
validationRules: Required when content references program-specific details

enhancedVariables.name: FINANCIAL_REPORT_DATA
enhancedVariables.description: Key financial figures or summarized data used to explain budgets, spending, and impact in donor-facing financial reports (e.g., revenue, program expense ratios).
examples: FY2024 revenue: $1,250,000; Program expense ratio: 78%.
Quarterly operating budget: $320,000 with $210,000 allocated to direct services.
Emergency relief fund disbursements: $85,000 to 120 households.
validationRules: Prefer numeric values with currency and percentages where applicable
Max length 500 characters; ensure figures are approved by finance team before publication

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_STATISTICS
enhancedVariables.description: High-level metrics that support fundraising or case statements (e.g., numbers served, success rates, cost per outcome) used to build credibility and justify requests.
examples: Over 8,000 meals served in the last year across five neighborhoods.
Job placement success rate of 72% within six months of program completion.
Volunteer retention at 65% year-over-year.
validationRules: Each statistic should cite timeframe and, if possible, data source
Confirm accuracy with program monitoring or evaluation data

enhancedVariables.name: ISSUE_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: The primary thematic focus or sector the organization works in (e.g., education, homelessness, environmental conservation) used for targeting messaging and categorization.
examples: Early childhood education and literacy
Housing stability and homelessness prevention
Climate resilience and urban tree planting
validationRules: Select from standardized issue taxonomy used by the organization
Required for program-related communications and reporting
Allow multi-select if work spans multiple issue areas

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_DATA
enhancedVariables.description: Structured or aggregated data describing a specific program's activities, outputs, outcomes, participants, timelines, and key metrics used for impact reporting and storytelling.
examples: After-school tutoring program: 120 students served, average attendance 78%, math proficiency improved by 18% over 6 months
Job-readiness cohort: 3 cohorts of 20 participants, 45% job placement within 3 months, 150 training hours delivered
Community health outreach: 10 mobile clinics, 2,400 patient contacts, 85% referred for follow-up care
validationRules: Required when creating program impact summaries
Should include at least one numeric metric (regex to detect digits)
Prefer JSON or CSV upload accepted if available (not enforced here)

enhancedVariables.name: SURVEY_DATA
enhancedVariables.description: Raw or summarized responses from surveys used for program evaluation, stakeholder feedback, or needs assessment, including response counts and key findings.
examples: Post-training evaluation: 42 responses; 90% rated training useful; common suggestion: more hands-on exercises
Community needs survey: 300 respondents; top needs: affordable childcare (42%), job training (31%), mental health services (27%)
Volunteer satisfaction survey: NPS +32, 15% reported scheduling conflicts as main concern
validationRules: Optional but recommended when generating insights
Should indicate sample size if known (e.g., "n=300")
If including CSV/JSON, validate basic structure (rows and columns present)

enhancedVariables.name: SURVEY_TOPIC
enhancedVariables.description: The primary subject or theme the survey is investigating (e.g., participant satisfaction, community needs, program accessibility).
examples: Participant satisfaction with summer literacy program
Barriers to accessing mental health services in rural areas
Volunteer recruitment and retention motivations
validationRules: Avoid generic single words; prefer short descriptive phrases

enhancedVariables.name: PURPOSE
enhancedVariables.description: The specific aim or intended use of the content or activity (e.g., inform stakeholders, evaluate program effectiveness, design outreach).
examples: Create a one-page impact summary for donors
Design a pre- and post-training evaluation to measure learning gains
Develop outreach messaging to recruit volunteers for a weekend event
validationRules: If select includes 'Other', allow short free-text explanation (max 200 chars)
Must match one of the predefined purposes when using templated workflows

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_TOPIC
enhancedVariables.description: A more narrowly focused subject within the overall purpose or survey (e.g., digital literacy among seniors, emergency preparedness kit knowledge).
examples: Digital literacy basics for older adults
Understanding of earthquake evacuation procedures
Effectiveness of financial literacy modules for young adults
validationRules: Optional but recommended for targeted content
Should not duplicate the broader PURPOSE field

enhancedVariables.name: SURVEY_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The format or methodology of the survey (e.g., baseline, follow-up, satisfaction, needs assessment, anonymous feedback).
examples: Baseline needs assessment (pre-program)
Post-program satisfaction survey
Anonymous community feedback form
validationRules: If 'Other' selected, require short description (max 150 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: LEARNING_OBJECTIVES
enhancedVariables.description: Specific, measurable outcomes learners should achieve by the end of a training or workshop (knowledge, skills, or attitudes).
examples: Participants will be able to create a 6-month family budgeting plan
Trainees will demonstrate three de-escalation techniques during role-plays
Volunteers will correctly explain the organization’s safeguarding policy
validationRules: Provide 1–5 objectives separated by line breaks
Each objective max 250 characters and ideally begins with an active verb (e.g., 'identify', 'demonstrate')

enhancedVariables.name: GROUP_SIZE
enhancedVariables.description: The anticipated or ideal number of participants for an activity, workshop, or program session.
examples: Small group: 8–12 participants for hands-on workshops
Large info session: up to 80 attendees with breakout rooms
Volunteer shift: 4–6 people per site
validationRules: Required for scheduling and resource planning
If group is variable, allow input like '8-12' in a separate notes field (notes field optional)

enhancedVariables.name: LEARNING_TOPIC
enhancedVariables.description: The subject area or content focus of a training, workshop, or educational module.
examples: Trauma-informed care fundamentals
Grant writing basics for community organizations
Basic digital skills: email, online safety, and video calls

enhancedVariables.name: SKILL_LEVEL
enhancedVariables.description: The expected proficiency or experience level of participants relative to the learning topic (e.g., beginner, intermediate, advanced).
examples: Beginner — no prior experience required
Intermediate — participants have basic familiarity and want deeper practice
Advanced — experienced practitioners ready for advanced techniques
validationRules: If 'Mixed', recommend specifying range of competencies in notes

enhancedVariables.name: TIME_CONSTRAINT
enhancedVariables.description: Limits on available time for an activity or session (total duration, session length, or scheduling restrictions) that affect content design and delivery.
examples: One 90-minute workshop session during an evening
Three 45-minute modules delivered over consecutive weeks
Maximum volunteer onboarding time: 30 minutes
validationRules: Prefer standardized format (e.g., '90 minutes', '3 x 45 minutes')

enhancedVariables.name: AVAILABLE_RESOURCES
enhancedVariables.description: Physical, financial, staffing, and material resources available to support a program, training, or activity (e.g., budget, venue, equipment, staff hours).
examples: Budget: $5,000; Venue: community center with AV; Staff: 2 full-time coordinators + 4 volunteers
Online delivery: Zoom Pro account, facilitator laptop, captioning budget $200
Volunteer support only: no paid staff allocation; materials budget $300
validationRules: Encourage structured lists (budget, personnel, equipment) and numeric values for budgets

enhancedVariables.name: ENGAGEMENT_STYLE
enhancedVariables.description: The intended mode of interaction for an activity (e.g., lecture, participatory workshop, peer-to-peer, blended learning) which influences facilitation approach.
examples: Interactive workshop with breakout role-plays and group reflection
Lecture-style informational session with Q&A at the end
Peer-to-peer support circles facilitated by trained volunteers

enhancedVariables.name: EMERGENCY_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The category of emergency or incident the policy or procedure addresses (e.g., fire, medical, severe weather, active threat).
examples: Severe weather (flooding and storms) evacuation procedures
Medical emergency response and first aid protocol
Fire evacuation and assembly point procedures

enhancedVariables.name: LOCATION_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The physical or virtual setting where activities or services occur (e.g., office, community center, outdoor site, virtual/online).
examples: On-site at the downtown community center (ground-floor multi-purpose room)
Outdoor pop-up table at the farmers market
Virtual via Zoom with live captioning and breakout rooms

enhancedVariables.name: VULNERABLE_POPULATIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Identifies the specific populations or client groups served by the nonprofit that require special protection or accommodation (e.g., children, seniors, survivors of domestic violence). Multiple population types may be listed if the organization serves several groups.
examples: Unaccompanied minors (ages 6–17) receiving after-school support
Older adults (65+) enrolled in home-delivered meal program
Survivors of domestic violence accessing emergency shelter
validationRules: Required when policies reference client protection
Prefer comma-separated list of populations or bulletized descriptions

enhancedVariables.name: SAFETY_CONCERN_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the type of safety risk or concern the policy or procedure addresses (e.g., fire, medical emergency, behavioral incident). Used to map responses and responsibilities to each risk category.
examples: Medical emergency — suspected cardiac event or severe allergic reaction
Behavioral incident — aggressive or self-harming behavior by a client
Environmental hazard — building fire or chemical spill
validationRules: Accept only predefined values where possible (e.g., medical, behavioral, environmental, security, shelter)
If 'other' selected, require accompanying description (max 250 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: FACILITY_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Describes the physical setting where services are delivered or where the policy applies (e.g., drop-in center, residential shelter, mobile outreach van).
examples: Residential emergency shelter (capacity 40 beds)
Community drop-in center with case management offices
Mobile outreach van providing street-level harm reduction services
validationRules: Required when procedures reference location-specific steps
Allow selection from standardized facility list (shelter, office, clinic, mobile unit, warehouse) with 'other' option
If 'other' chosen, require text description (max 200 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Categorizes the nonprofit by legal or operational type (e.g., community-based organization, fiscal sponsor, grassroots collective), which may influence compliance and policy language.
examples: 501(c)(3) community-based social services organization
Coalition / membership network (nonprofit alliance)
Faith-based organization operating a food pantry
validationRules: Required for tailoring legal or governance language
Restrict to known organization types (501c3, social enterprise, grassroots collective, faith-based, government-contracted provider, coalition) with 'other' option
If 'other' selected, require brief explanation (max 200 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: POLICY_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the subject area of the policy or handbook section (e.g., child protection, volunteer conduct, data privacy) to route content and compliance checks appropriately.
examples: Child safeguarding and mandatory reporting
Volunteer code of conduct and confidentiality
Client data retention and privacy policy (HIPAA/FERPA considerations)
validationRules: Select from standardized policy taxonomy (safeguarding, HR, finance, data privacy, volunteer management, facilities)
If 'data privacy' selected, flag for legal review

enhancedVariables.name: WEBSITE_URL
enhancedVariables.description: The public web address for the nonprofit or a specific program page referenced in materials or communications.
examples: https://www.communityhope.org/programs/youth-services
https://shelter-network.org/contact
https://examplenonprofit.org/volunteer-signup
validationRules: Must be a valid URL starting with http:// or https://

enhancedVariables.name: PHONE
enhancedVariables.description: Primary contact telephone number for the individual, department, or program referenced in the template (may be a main line or direct dial).
examples: +1 (415) 555-0123 — Main program line
+1-212-555-9876 ext. 204 — Shelter intake coordinator
validationRules: If provided, must match international phone number format (E.164 recommended)

enhancedVariables.name: TECH_SUPPORT_EMAIL
enhancedVariables.description: Email address for IT or technical support staff responsible for assisting staff with systems, training materials, or file access.
examples: it-support@communityorg.org
techhelp@nonprofitnetwork.org
systems_admin@example.org
validationRules: If provided, must be valid email format (user@domain)
Prefer group/shared mailbox to ensure coverage

enhancedVariables.name: FILE_LOCATION
enhancedVariables.description: Indicates where key documents, templates, or onboarding materials are stored (could be a shared drive path, cloud folder URL, or document ID).
examples: Google Drive: /Organization/Policies/Staff Handbook 2025
SharePoint: https://org.sharepoint.com/sites/policies/handbook.pdf
Network drive: G:\Programs\Intake\Forms\intake-form.docx
validationRules: Required when referencing attachments or linked resources
Accept valid URL or network path; if local path, include access instructions

enhancedVariables.name: FUNDER_CONTACT
enhancedVariables.description: Primary contact information for the funder or grant officer associated with a program or funding source; used for reporting and contract communications.
examples: Maria Lopez, Grants Officer — maria.lopez@foundation.org, +1 (212) 555-6789
James Carter (Program Officer), State Department of Health — james.carter@state.gov
City Housing Dept. liaison: housinggrants@city.gov, +1-415-555-3333
validationRules: Recommended when drafting funder-specific reporting templates
Include name, role, email, and phone if available

enhancedVariables.name: DATABASE_ADMIN
enhancedVariables.description: Contact details for the person or team responsible for maintaining client/donor databases (for access requests, data corrections, or exports).
examples: CRM Admin — crm-admin@nonprofit.org, +1 (415) 555-2222
Database Team (Salesforce): salesforce-admins@org.org
Donor Database Administrator: susan.kim@nonprofit.org
validationRules: If email provided, must be valid format
If phone provided in same field, enforce combined format or use separate phone field
Required when templates reference data access or exports

enhancedVariables.name: CONTACT_INFO
enhancedVariables.description: General contact information block for a staff member, department, or program including name, role, email, and phone; used in templates for signature blocks and resource pages.
examples: Aisha Khan, Program Manager — aisha.khan@helpnow.org | +1 (678) 555-0101
Volunteer Coordinator: volunteers@example.org | +1-303-555-1212
Client Intake — intake@communitycare.org | 24/7 Hotline: +1 (800) 555-0000
validationRules: Recommended fields: name, role, email, phone
If email included, ensure valid format; if phone included, ensure valid phone format

enhancedVariables.name: PROCEDURE_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Indicates the nature of the procedure being documented (e.g., emergency response, intake workflow, incident reporting) to guide the level of detail and routing.
examples: Incident reporting and escalation procedure
Client intake and eligibility verification process
Evacuation and shelter-in-place emergency response
validationRules: Select from common procedure types (intake, incident, emergency, financial, HR) with 'other' option
If 'emergency' chosen, require associated safety_concern_type and facility_type

enhancedVariables.name: PROCESS_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The formal name of the internal process or workflow (e.g., 'Volunteer Onboarding', 'Monthly Grant Reporting') used in manuals and flowcharts.
examples: Volunteer Onboarding and Background Check
Monthly Grant Reporting and Reconciliation
Client Referral and Warm Handoff Process
validationRules: Required when creating a process document or SOP
Avoid special characters that might break filenames

enhancedVariables.name: STATE
enhancedVariables.description: Jurisdictional state (US) or equivalent region where the policy, volunteer agreement, or program applies — used for compliance and legal references.
examples: California
New York
Colorado
validationRules: Required for documents with legal requirements
Select from a standardized list of US states or region equivalents
If outside US, allow entry of country/region

enhancedVariables.name: VOLUNTEER_ROLE
enhancedVariables.description: The title or name of a volunteer position within the organization (e.g., what the volunteer will be called and recruited for).
examples: After-School Program Mentor
Food Pantry Intake Coordinator
Event Logistics Volunteer
validationRules: noSpecialCharacters: allow basic punctuation (hyphen, comma, ampersand)

enhancedVariables.name: VOLUNTEER_ROLE_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: A brief paragraph describing responsibilities, time commitment, skills required, and supervision for the volunteer role.
examples: Support tutors by leading weekly 1-hour reading sessions for elementary students, track progress, and report attendance to the volunteer coordinator.
Manage intake desk at the food pantry two afternoons per week: greet clients, complete registration forms, and coordinate volunteer shifts.
Assist with event set-up and breakdown, move tables and signage, and support registration desk during fundraising events (4–6 hours).

enhancedVariables.name: PODCAST_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official name of the nonprofit's podcast or audio series used for promotion and show notes.
examples: Voices for Change: The Community Impact Podcast
Healthy Futures: Stories from Our Clinics
Youth Leaders Today

enhancedVariables.name: EPISODE_LENGTH
enhancedVariables.description: Target or typical runtime for a podcast episode, usually expressed in minutes or a minute range.
examples: 30 minutes
15–20 minutes
45 minutes

enhancedVariables.name: EPISODE_TOPIC
enhancedVariables.description: A concise description of the subject matter or focus of the specific podcast episode.
examples: Youth employment programs and success stories
How our mobile clinic improves access to care in rural areas
Volunteer training tips and onboarding best practices

enhancedVariables.name: GUEST_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the guest appearing on the podcast or participating in an event or interview.
examples: Dr. Maria Alvarez
James Osei
Leah Kim

enhancedVariables.name: GUEST_ORGANIZATION
enhancedVariables.description: The institution, company, or group the guest represents or is affiliated with.
examples: City Youth Services Coalition
Hope Health Mobile Clinic
University of Riverbend — Dept. of Social Work

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_PROGRAMS
enhancedVariables.description: A list or short summary of the nonprofit's primary programs or services that should be highlighted in communications.
examples: After-school tutoring, Summer STEM camps, College readiness mentoring
Mobile medical clinics, Chronic disease management workshops, Telehealth referrals
Emergency food distribution, Client case management, Housing placement assistance

enhancedVariables.name: IMPACT_METRICS
enhancedVariables.description: Quantitative or qualitative measures demonstrating program outcomes, such as number served, percentage improvements, or success stories.
examples: Served 3,200 meals last quarter; 85% of clients reported improved food security
Reduced no-show rate by 30% after appointment reminder initiative; 1,200 clinic visits facilitated
Raised graduation rate among participants from 62% to 78% over three years

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_VALUES
enhancedVariables.description: Core principles or guiding beliefs that express the nonprofit's mission, culture, and approach to service.
examples: Equity, Compassion, Community-Led Solutions
Integrity, Accountability, Client-Centered Care
Innovation, Collaboration, Sustainability
validationRules: prefer comma-separated keywords or short phrases

enhancedVariables.name: TIME_LIMIT
enhancedVariables.description: A time boundary for an activity, deadline, or duration (e.g., application deadline, maximum video length, response time).
examples: Applications due by 11:59 PM on August 15, 2025
Video testimonials should be no longer than 2 minutes
Volunteers must respond to shift requests within 48 hours
validationRules: accepts ISO date, relative duration (e.g., '48 hours'), or plain-English deadline

enhancedVariables.name: EVENT_THEME
enhancedVariables.description: An overarching concept or creative direction for an event used to guide messaging, décor, and programming.
examples: Celebrating Resilience: Community Stories Gala
Spring into Service: Volunteer Recruitment Fair
Healthy Neighborhoods: Outreach & Resource Expo

enhancedVariables.name: TECHNICAL_SETUP
enhancedVariables.description: Details of technical requirements or AV setup needed for a program, event, or recording (equipment, connectivity, software).
examples: Podcasts: USB mic, quiet room, Zoom backup recording, 5 Mbps upload
Virtual town hall: Zoom Webinar license, projector, lapel mic, HDMI adapter
In-person workshop: PA system with two wireless mics, laptop with HDMI, reliable power strip

enhancedVariables.name: AUDIENCE_KNOWLEDGE
enhancedVariables.description: The assumed baseline knowledge or familiarity the target audience has about the topic, used to set tone and complexity.
examples: General public with little background in public health
Experienced case managers familiar with shelter intake procedures
High school students learning about civic engagement for the first time

enhancedVariables.name: AUDIENCE_SIZE
enhancedVariables.description: Estimated or expected number of attendees, listeners, or participants for planning scale and tone of communications.
examples: Small (under 30 attendees)
Medium (30–150 attendees)
Large (150+ attendees)

enhancedVariables.name: AUDIENCE_EXPECTATIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Describes what the audience expects to hear, learn, or feel from the presentation or communication (e.g., level of detail, emotional tone, calls to action). Useful for tailoring messaging and tone for donors, volunteers, partners, or service users.
examples: Donors expect a clear impact update, specific use of funds, and a short donation ask at the end.
Volunteer recruits expect logistics (time, location), role clarity, and stories showing volunteer impact.
Community members expect accessible language, program eligibility details, and next steps for participation.

enhancedVariables.name: SPEAKER_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The full name of the person delivering the speech or presentation; used for bylines, introductions, signage, and program sheets.
examples: María Gonzalez
James P. Carter
Dr. Aisha Rahman

enhancedVariables.name: SPEAKER_ROLE
