enhancedVariables.description: The speaker's organizational role or title (e.g., Executive Director, Program Manager, Board Chair) to contextualize authority and perspective for the audience.
examples: Executive Director
Youth Programs Manager
Board Chair

enhancedVariables.name: SPEAKER_BACKGROUND
enhancedVariables.description: A brief summary of the speaker's relevant background, expertise, or lived experience to establish credibility and connection with the audience.
examples: 10 years leading community health initiatives with experience in fundraising and program evaluation.
Former beneficiary of our job-readiness program who now mentors participants.
Academic researcher specializing in child development and nonprofit program assessment.

enhancedVariables.name: SPEAKING_STYLE
enhancedVariables.description: Preferred tone and delivery approach for the speaker (e.g., conversational, formal, motivational), which guides language, pacing, and rhetorical devices used in the script.
examples: Warm, conversational, and story-driven — suitable for an intimate donor dinner.
Concise and formal with program metrics emphasized for a board briefing.
Energetic and motivational with short anecdotes for a volunteer kickoff.

enhancedVariables.name: PRIMARY_OBJECTIVE
enhancedVariables.description: The main goal of the speech or content piece (e.g., fundraising, volunteer recruitment, awareness-raising, policy advocacy) that determines structure and calls to action.
examples: Secure $50,000 in new donations by the end of the fiscal year.
Recruit 30 community volunteers for the summer mentoring program.
Raise awareness among local policymakers about the need for housing vouchers.

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_MESSAGES
enhancedVariables.description: Concise, prioritized messages the organization wants the audience to remember (often 2–4 points covering impact, need, credibility, and ask).
examples: Our after-school program improves reading scores by an average of 18% in one year.
Donations go directly to student scholarships with 90% program delivery efficiency.
We partner with local schools and businesses to provide job training and placement.

enhancedVariables.name: SUCCESS_METRICS
enhancedVariables.description: Quantitative or qualitative indicators used to measure whether the communication or campaign achieved its goals (e.g., funds raised, number of sign-ups, media mentions).
examples: Number of new recurring donors acquired and total dollars raised within 30 days.
Volunteer sign-ups and retention rate after the first 3 months.
Press coverage count and social media engagement (shares, comments) after the event.

enhancedVariables.name: AUDIENCE
enhancedVariables.description: Primary target group for the message (e.g., long-time donors, prospective volunteers, service users, corporate partners), including relevant demographics or relationship to the organization.
examples: Existing monthly donors who have given for more than two years.
High-school students interested in STEM tutoring volunteer roles.
Local small-business owners for potential sponsorship partnerships.

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_MESSAGE
enhancedVariables.description: A single, short statement encapsulating the central idea you want the audience to remember — used in headlines, social posts, or opening lines.
examples: Every $50 gives a student one month of tutoring and a path to success.
Join us to give local youth safe spaces to learn and thrive.
With your support, we can end food insecurity for 200 families this year.

enhancedVariables.name: DESIRED_OUTCOME
enhancedVariables.description: The specific action or result you want the audience to take after the presentation (e.g., donate, sign up, share, advocate).
examples: Donate via the event QR code before the program ends.
Sign up for our volunteer orientation scheduled next month.
Submit a supportive comment to the city council's public hearing record.

enhancedVariables.name: LENGTH_IN_MINUTES
enhancedVariables.description: Target duration of the speech or video in minutes to guide pacing, content depth, and time allocations for sections.

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_MESSAGE_#
enhancedVariables.description: A numbered instance of a key message; multiple instances are expected (e.g., KEY_MESSAGE_1, KEY_MESSAGE_2, KEY_MESSAGE_3) representing the top 2–3 messages to repeat across communications.
examples: KEY_MESSAGE_1: Our mentorship program increases high-school graduation rates by 25%.
KEY_MESSAGE_2: 85% of donations go directly to program services.
KEY_MESSAGE_3: Volunteer mentors commit 2 hours/week and make measurable impact.

enhancedVariables.name: VIDEO_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the style or purpose of a video (e.g., testimonial, program explainer, fundraising appeal, impact montage) to guide script structure and visual approach.
examples: Testimonial interview with a program participant.
60-second fundraising appeal featuring program highlights and call to action.
Explainer animation outlining volunteer roles and application steps.

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_POINTS_LIST
enhancedVariables.description: A bullet-style list of the main points or talking points to cover in the script or presentation; used to structure segments and ensure consistency across speakers.
examples: 1) Problem overview and data; 2) Our solution and impact; 3) How attendees can help.
1) Volunteer role description; 2) Time commitment and benefits; 3) Sign-up instructions.
1) Success story highlight; 2) Program outcomes with metrics; 3) Donation ask and next steps.

enhancedVariables.name: YEAR
enhancedVariables.description: The calendar or fiscal year the document or report covers (e.g., 2024 fiscal year). Used to contextualize metrics, outcomes, and time-bound narratives.
examples: Fiscal Year 2023–2024
FY22
validationRules: accepts 4-digit year or 'FY' prefixed formats (e.g., 2024, FY2024, 2023-2024)

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_RESULTS
enhancedVariables.description: Summarized outcomes and measurable results from a specific program or service, including outputs (e.g., number served) and outcomes (e.g., % improvement).
examples: Provided job-readiness training to 320 participants; 68% secured employment within 6 months.
Distributed 12,000 meals across 24 community pop-ups; food insecurity reports decreased by 15% among participants.
Mentorship program served 45 youth; 90% reported improved school attendance and grades over one year.

enhancedVariables.name: FINANCIAL_INFORMATION
enhancedVariables.description: Key financial details for the period such as total revenue, expenses, net surplus/deficit, major grants, and financial highlights for stakeholders.
examples: Total revenue: $1,250,000; Total expenses: $1,100,000; Operating surplus: $150,000. Major grant: $300,000 from ABC Foundation.
Program spending: 78% program services, 12% fundraising, 10% admin. Reserve fund: $200,000.
Year-end assets: $2.1M; Liabilities: $600k; Unrestricted net assets increased by 8%.
validationRules: include currency format for monetary values

enhancedVariables.name: BENEFICIARY_STORIES
enhancedVariables.description: Short, anonymized or approved narratives from program beneficiaries that illustrate impact, challenges overcome, or human-centered outcomes.
examples: Maria completed our parenting workshop and secured stable childcare; she reports improved family stability and returned to school.
After emergency housing support, James found employment and transitioned to permanent housing in four months.
A refugee family accessed our legal and language services and successfully obtained work permits, enabling economic independence.
validationRules: must confirm consent/permission for use if identifying details included
avoid protected personal data unless consent documented

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_RECOGNITION
enhancedVariables.description: Names, tiers, or descriptions of donors and supporters to acknowledge in reports or materials, including recognition levels (e.g., Gold Sponsor) and specific gift types if relevant.
examples: Platinum Partners: Smith Family Foundation ($250,000); Gold Sponsors: City Bank ($50,000).
In-kind donors: Local Grocers Co. — weekly produce donations valued at $40,000/year.
Honor roll: Individual major donors — Jane Doe, John Lee; Corporate giving circle members: 2023.
validationRules: ensure donor consent for listing where required
individual names should match organization records

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_TOPICS
enhancedVariables.description: A list or description of particular agenda items, report sections, or topical focus areas that should be included in a board report or meeting materials.
examples: Board meeting topics: strategic plan progress, fundraising forecast, program evaluation results, risk register update.
Required sections: KPI dashboard, upcoming grant deadlines, staffing updates, compliance matters.
Focus areas for quarter: volunteer recruitment, partnership opportunities with local schools, capital campaign planning.
validationRules: encourage bullet-style input or comma-separated topics

enhancedVariables.name: SWOT_ANALYSIS
enhancedVariables.description: A succinct strengths-weaknesses-opportunities-threats assessment for the organization, program, or strategic initiative used in planning documents.
examples: Strengths: strong community partnerships; Weaknesses: limited IT capacity; Opportunities: new grant for workforce training; Threats: funding uncertainty post-2025.
S: Experienced volunteer base; W: aging donor roster; O: expanding digital fundraising; T: increased competition for grants.
S: High program impact per dollar; W: insufficient monitoring tools; O: corporate sponsorship pipeline; T: regulatory changes affecting service delivery.

enhancedVariables.name: RECIPIENT_NAMES
enhancedVariables.description: Full names of individuals receiving certificates, awards, or recognition, provided exactly as they should appear on the document.
examples: Alexandra Ruiz
Mr. David K. Thompson
Community Volunteer - Riverdale Club (Group Award)
validationRules: allow letters, spaces, periods, hyphens, and ampersands

enhancedVariables.name: ACHIEVEMENT_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The category or name of the achievement being recognized on a certificate or award (e.g., Volunteer of the Year, Completion of Training).
examples: Volunteer of the Year
Program Completion: Financial Literacy Course
Outstanding Community Leadership Award
validationRules: if 'Other' selected provide text input for custom type

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIAL_FORMATTING
enhancedVariables.description: Any formatting instructions or stylistic choices for certificates or reports (e.g., uppercase names, honorifics, placement of seal).
examples: Print recipient name in ALL CAPS and bold; center-align under title.
Include organizational seal in bottom-right corner; use serif font for names.
Add QR code linking to recipient story; include date in 'Month Day, Year' format.
validationRules: should reference available templates or design constraints

enhancedVariables.name: DATE_FORMAT
enhancedVariables.description: Preferred presentation of dates for certificates, reports, or communications (e.g., 'June 30, 2024' or '30/06/2024').
validationRules: options should include common formats (MM/DD/YYYY, DD/MM/YYYY, Month D, YYYY, ISO YYYY-MM-DD)
if custom chosen, validate against date tokens

enhancedVariables.name: CERTIFICATE_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The specific template or category of certificate to issue (e.g., Participation, Achievement, Completion, Service Award).
examples: Certificate of Completion
Certificate of Appreciation
Excellence in Service Award
validationRules: if 'Custom' selected require additional details in ACHIEVEMENT_DETAILS

enhancedVariables.name: NUMBER_OF_CERTIFICATES
enhancedVariables.description: How many copies of the certificate or award are needed for distribution or printing.

enhancedVariables.name: ACHIEVEMENT_DETAILS
enhancedVariables.description: A brief description of the accomplishment, criteria met, or reason for recognition to appear on the certificate or in accompanying text.
examples: Completed 40 hours of mentorship training and demonstrated excellence in student engagement.
Recognized for outstanding fundraising efforts and securing $75,000 in donations in 2024.
For exceptional volunteer service supporting the emergency shelter during the winter outreach campaign.
validationRules: prohibit sensitive personal data unless consent obtained

enhancedVariables.name: CREDENTIAL_EVALUATION_SERVICE
enhancedVariables.description: The name of an external or internal credential evaluation service used to assess educational or professional credentials for clients (often used in immigration or employment support programs).
examples: World Education Services (WES)
International Credential Evaluators, Inc.
In-house credential review team (Development Dept.)
validationRules: if selected, validate against approved vendor list where applicable

enhancedVariables.name: TEMPLATE_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The kind of communication or template being generated (e.g., event invite, donor appeal, client follow-up), used to select tone, sections, and fields appropriate to that format.
examples: Event Invitation - Fundraiser Gala
Client Service Follow-Up - Intake Completion
Personalized Donor Appeal - Year-End Campaign
validationRules: must match one of the organization's predefined template types

enhancedVariables.name: CLIENT_DETAILS
enhancedVariables.description: Structured summary of a client or service recipient including name, preferred pronouns, primary contact method, and relevant client ID or household notes for personalized communications.
examples: Maria Gomez (she/her), Family ID #F-1023, prefers phone contact at (555) 123-4567
John Lee (they/them), Client ID 78945, email: john.lee@example.org, speaks Mandarin
Harrison Household, Primary: Emily Harrison, DOB: 2005-11-02, referral: school counselor
validationRules: should not contain unmasked sensitive data (SSNs, full medical details)

enhancedVariables.name: SERVICE_PROVIDED
enhancedVariables.description: A concise name or description of the program, service, or assistance the nonprofit delivered or will deliver to the client (used to confirm services, next steps, or outcomes).
examples: Weekly food pantry delivery (emergency food box)
One-on-one career counseling and resume workshop
After-school tutoring program - math support for Grades 6-8
validationRules: prefer standardized program codes/names where available

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIAL_NOTES
enhancedVariables.description: Any additional, context-specific remarks or accommodations relevant to the recipient or event (e.g., accessibility needs, dietary restrictions, confidentiality flags).
examples: Requires wheelchair access and front-row seating
Allergic to nuts — request nut-free catering
Is a media-sensitive client; do not include photos without signed consent
validationRules: must not include prohibited personal data (e.g., unredacted medical diagnoses) unless stored securely

enhancedVariables.name: TICKET_PRICE
enhancedVariables.description: Price per ticket for an event or suggested donation amount associated with event registration, used in invites, receipts, and registration pages.
examples: 0 (community scholarships available)
validationRules: currency should be implied by org settings or provided alongside

enhancedVariables.name: RSVP_DEADLINE
enhancedVariables.description: The cut-off date and optionally time by which attendees must respond to the invitation to confirm attendance or registration.
validationRules: must be a valid ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD) or ISO datetime
cannot be earlier than the current date when creating future events

enhancedVariables.name: CONTACT_PERSON
enhancedVariables.description: Primary staff or volunteer contact for questions about the event, program, or client service, including name and optionally role or department.
examples: Aisha Brown, Events Coordinator
Miguel Torres, Program Director, Phone: (555) 987-6543
Volunteer Liaison - volunteer@nonprofit.org
validationRules: if including email or phone, validate as email or phone format respectively

enhancedVariables.name: RSVP_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: A URL where invitees can register, RSVP, or get more event information; may point to an external ticketing page, survey, or internal registration form.
examples: https://nonprofit.org/events/gala-2025/register
https://secure.givingplatform.com/rsvp?event=12345
https://forms.nonprofit.org/rsvp-community-meeting
validationRules: must be a valid URL (http or https)

enhancedVariables.name: TICKET_COUNT
enhancedVariables.description: Number of tickets allocated, purchased, or available for an attendee or group; used for confirmations, inventory tracking, and reporting.
examples: 10 (table of 10 sponsorship package)
validationRules: required if referencing a specific registration
should not exceed event capacity (if capacity known)

enhancedVariables.name: COST
enhancedVariables.description: Total cost associated with an item, service, or registration line (could be total registration cost, program fee, or material expense).
examples: 0 (waived fee)
validationRules: required where invoicing or receipts are generated

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_DIRECTOR_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Full name of the program director or lead staff for the program referenced in the communication; used to sign off messages or provide a contact point for program-specific queries.
examples: Dr. Leila Ahmed
Carlos Mendez
Samantha Nguyen
validationRules: should match staff directory entry when available

enhancedVariables.name: SURVEY_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: URL directing recipients to a feedback or intake survey related to the event, service, or program for evaluation and continuous improvement.
examples: https://survey.nonprofit.org/post-event-feedback
https://forms.gle/abcd1234
https://nonprofit.org/surveys/client-experience-2025

enhancedVariables.name: INVITATION_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the nature or audience of the invitation (e.g., VIP, General Admission, Board Member, Community Outreach) to tailor messaging and benefits.
examples: VIP - Major Donors
General Admission - Community Members
Board Members & Sponsors
validationRules: must match one of the organization's defined invitation categories

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_NEIGHBORHOOD
enhancedVariables.description: Geographic neighborhood or community area targeted by outreach or appeals, used for localized messaging, events, and reporting.
examples: Northside - Eastwood Neighborhood
Downtown Corridor (Ward 3)
South Riverbend Community
validationRules: prefer standardized location names or codes used by the organization

enhancedVariables.name: BUILDING_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: Name of a building or facility relevant to the communication (e.g., shelter name, partner building, apartment complex) for drop-offs, site visits, or client references.
examples: Riverside Community Center
Hope Housing - Elm Street Apartments
St. Mary's Parish Hall
validationRules: avoid including full street addresses in this field unless needed (use separate address field)

enhancedVariables.name: DISASTER_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The specific kind of disaster or emergency event that the nonprofit is responding to or preparing communications about (used to tailor appeals, needs assessments, and response plans).
examples: Coastal flooding from Tropical Storm Idalia
Winter storm and prolonged power outages
Wildfire affecting three rural communities
validationRules: Required when used in emergency or appeal templates
Value must match one of the organization-defined disaster types (e.g., flooding, wildfire, earthquake, storm, pandemic, heatwave)
Max length 100 characters if custom entry allowed

enhancedVariables.name: GIVING_HISTORY
enhancedVariables.description: A brief summary of a donor's past financial contributions and engagement level to personalize appeals and segmentation (amounts, frequency, and recency).
examples: Monthly donor since 2019, average gift $35, last gift in March 2025
One-time $1,000 major gift in 2022; no subsequent gifts
Recurring quarterly donor, increased gift amount each year from $50 to $150
validationRules: Optional but recommended for personalized appeals
Should include at minimum donation frequency or most recent gift date if available

enhancedVariables.name: PERSONAL_CONNECTION
enhancedVariables.description: A short note describing a personal link between the recipient and the nonprofit (volunteer activity, event attended, beneficiary relationship, or mutual contact) used to strengthen messaging.
examples: Volunteered at last year's holiday meal service with our Southside team
Attended the 2023 annual gala and sat at table hosted by Board Chair Maria Lopez
Parent of a student who benefited from our after-school tutoring program
validationRules: Avoid sensitive personal data (e.g., medical details) unless appropriate consent obtained

enhancedVariables.name: PAST_INTERACTIONS
enhancedVariables.description: A concise record of prior communications and touchpoints with the contact (emails, meetings, events, phone calls) to inform tone and follow-up actions.
examples: Emailed appeal in Jan 2025; donor opened but did not click
Phone call with Development Officer on 2024-11-12; expressed interest in volunteer opportunities
Attended community workshop on housing in 2023; signed up for newsletter
validationRules: Optional but recommended for outreach sequencing
Prefer structured notes with dates where possible (YYYY-MM-DD)

enhancedVariables.name: TONE_AND_VOICE
enhancedVariables.description: The desired emotional tone and organizational voice for the communication (e.g., urgent, warm, formal, conversational) to ensure consistent messaging.
examples: Warm and grateful — emphasize donor impact and appreciation
Urgent and direct — immediate needs after disaster, call to action for donations
Professional and informational — program update for corporate partners
validationRules: Value should match predefined tones (e.g., urgent, warm, formal, casual, inspirational)
If 'custom' selected, provide brief description up to 200 characters

enhancedVariables.name: SCHEDULING_LINK
enhancedVariables.description: A URL to an external scheduling tool or calendar (e.g., Calendly, SignUpGenius) used to let volunteers or stakeholders book orientation or meetings.
examples: https://calendly.com/greencommunity/volunteer-orientation
https://signupgenius.com/go/10C084AA9A92EA7F94-volunteers
https://example.org/volunteer-schedule?session=may2025
validationRules: Must be a valid HTTPS URL
Optional but required for scheduling communications
If internal link, ensure starts with https:// and domain is whitelisted

enhancedVariables.name: ORIENTATION_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: The calendar date for a volunteer orientation, training session, or onboarding event, used to populate calendar invites and reminders.
validationRules: Required for onboarding communications referencing an event
Date must not be in the past relative to current system date unless explicitly allowed

enhancedVariables.name: ORIENTATION_TIME
enhancedVariables.description: The start time (and optionally end time) for an orientation or volunteer shift, used in messages and calendar entries to avoid confusion.
validationRules: Required with ORIENTATION_DATE for event scheduling
If providing range, use delimiter '–' or hyphen and validate both times

enhancedVariables.name: LOCATION_ADDRESS
enhancedVariables.description: The physical address or location description where an event, volunteer activity, or program takes place, including room or access instructions if needed.
examples: Riverdale Community Center, 123 Elm St, Meeting Room B, Riverdale, NY 10471
Northside Food Bank Warehouse, 450 Industrial Way, Dock 3 (enter via Gate C)
Outdoor garden at Sunnyside Park (meet at main pavilion near playground)
validationRules: Should include any access or parking instructions if applicable

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_VOLUNTEER_DEMOGRAPHIC
enhancedVariables.description: The specific volunteer audience segment the organization is recruiting (age group, skills, availability, or affinity group) to tailor outreach and role descriptions.
examples: College students available weekdays for 4–6 hour shifts
Skilled carpenters and builders for weekend habitat repair projects
Bilingual (Spanish/English) mentors for after-school tutoring program
validationRules: Optional but recommended for targeted recruitment
Avoid discriminatory language; focus on role-relevant qualifications and legal criteria

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_BENEFITS
enhancedVariables.description: Primary benefits or incentives offered to volunteers or participants (skill development, stipends, networking) used to motivate sign-ups and retention.
examples: Hands-on training in food-safety certification and leadership experience
Volunteer hours count toward community service requirements; free lunch provided
Stipend available for weekend crew leads plus professional references
validationRules: Recommended for recruitment and onboarding materials
Statements about compensation or stipends must match internal policy and approvals

enhancedVariables.name: CORE_MESSAGE
enhancedVariables.description: The central idea, mission statement, or primary call-to-action that should be preserved across translations, captions, or adapted content to maintain message fidelity.
examples: Every child deserves a safe after-school space to learn and grow — help us expand programs to a second neighborhood.
Immediate support is needed to provide emergency shelter to displaced families after the flood.
Join our community mentorship program to help local youth build workplace skills and confidence.
validationRules: Required for translation and cultural adaptation tasks
Must state a single clear objective or call-to-action for best results

enhancedVariables.name: SOURCE_CONTENT
enhancedVariables.description: The original text, document, or media that will be adapted, translated, or repurposed; includes context such as audience and intended use to guide conversion.
examples: English program brochure: 'After-School Tutoring — Fall 2025' (PDF content pasted)
Social post copy from 2024 about volunteer opportunities (original)
Press release announcing grant award and program expansion (full text)
validationRules: Required for any translation or adaptation job
Max length 5000 characters or allow file attachment reference
Ensure copyright or source permissions are documented if content is third-party

enhancedVariables.name: ACCESSIBILITY_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: Specific accessibility accommodations or formatting needs for materials (e.g., plain language, alt text, captioning, screen-reader compatibility) to ensure inclusive communications.
examples: Produce plain-language version at a 6th-grade reading level and include alt text for all images
Provide translated materials with audio narration and closed captions for videos
Large-print (18pt) PDF and accessible Word document compatible with screen readers
validationRules: If legal or contractual accessibility standards apply (e.g., WCAG 2.1), reference specific level (A/AA/AAA)

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_LANGUAGE
enhancedVariables.description: The language (and optionally locale) into which content should be translated or adapted for a specific audience or community.
examples: Spanish (Mexico) — es-MX
Arabic — ar (Modern Standard Arabic)
Haitian Creole — ht
validationRules: Value should be a standard language code or language name with optional locale (e.g., 'es', 'es-MX', 'fr-CA')
If multiple languages needed, allow comma-separated list but limit to 10 entries

enhancedVariables.name: SOURCE_LANGUAGE
enhancedVariables.description: The original language of source materials that need translation, localization, or accessibility conversion (e.g., the language your program materials or social posts are currently written in).
examples: English
Spanish (Español)
Arabic (العربية)
validationRules: Value must be a valid language name or ISO 639-1 code (e.g., en, es, ar)

enhancedVariables.name: ACCESSIBILITY_NEEDS
enhancedVariables.description: A high-level list of accessibility accommodations or requirements the audience needs across materials (covers multiple needs such as captioning, large print, or screen-reader compatibility).
examples: Captions for video, alt text for images, and screen-reader–friendly PDFs
Large-print handouts and high-contrast color scheme for printed flyers
Translated Braille materials and ASL interpretation for events
validationRules: Optional but recommended for public-facing materials
If mentions disability services, ensure contact method for follow-up is provided elsewhere

enhancedVariables.name: ACCESSIBILITY_NEED
enhancedVariables.description: A single, specific accessibility accommodation requested for a particular piece of content (used when specifying one precise format such as 'closed captions' or 'Braille copy').
examples: Closed captions for a 3-minute outreach video
Screen-reader–compatible Word document
Plain-language summary at 6th-grade reading level
validationRules: If provided, must match one of the organization's recognized accessibility options (e.g., captions, transcript, Braille, large print, ASL interpretation)

enhancedVariables.name: ACCESSIBILITY_FORMAT
enhancedVariables.description: The required output format or file type for accessible materials (e.g., accessible PDF, plain-text transcript, Braille-ready file).
examples: Tagged PDF (accessible PDF)
Plain-text transcript (.txt) and SRT caption file for video
BRF (Braille Ready Format) and large-print PDF
validationRules: Value must be one of accepted file/format types (e.g., accessible_pdf, srt, txt, brf)
If file upload is required elsewhere, ensure format matches this selection

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_DATE
enhancedVariables.description: A calendar date relevant to the content or deliverable (e.g., event date, publication date, translation deadline).
examples: 2025-10-15 (event date for community fair)
2025-09-01 (deadline to publish translated brochure)
2026-01-10 (start date for multilingual outreach campaign)
validationRules: Must be a valid date in ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DD)
If date is in the past, require confirmation (e.g., allow only for archival notes)

enhancedVariables.name: TIMEZONE
enhancedVariables.description: Time zone that applies to the SPECIFIC_DATE or event scheduling to ensure correct timing across regions.
examples: America/Los_Angeles (PDT/PST)
Europe/London (GMT/BST)
UTC (Coordinated Universal Time)
validationRules: Must be a valid IANA timezone name or common abbreviation mapped to an IANA zone

enhancedVariables.name: ORIGINAL_CONTENT
enhancedVariables.description: The source text, post, or material that needs translation, simplification, or conversion (use the full original copy so translators or accessibility tools have context).
examples: Draft social media post: 'Join us this Saturday for family literacy workshops — free childcare provided!'
Program brochure paragraph describing eligibility and application process
Transcript of a 5-minute community leader speech to be captioned
validationRules: Required when requesting translation or conversion
Max length 5000 characters (or provide file upload option for longer documents)
If sensitive personal data included, flag for privacy review

enhancedVariables.name: READING_LEVEL
enhancedVariables.description: The target reading comprehension level for rewritten or simplified materials (often used to make documents accessible to broader audiences).
examples: Plain language at 6th-grade reading level for community handouts
8th–9th grade level for volunteer orientation materials
Professional/technical for funder reports (college level)
validationRules: Optional; default to 'Plain language' when unspecified
Allowed values: '4th grade', '6th grade', '8th grade', 'High school', 'College/Professional', 'Plain language'
If 'Plain language' chosen, ensure jargon removal and short sentences

enhancedVariables.name: LOGO_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: A brief textual description of the organization's logo used for image briefs, alt-text creation, or design guidance (includes colors, symbols, and meaning).
examples: Circular logo: stylized tree with three leaves in teal and gold; symbolizes community growth
Wordmark: 'Neighborhood Health' in dark blue sans-serif with an orange heart above the 'i'
Abstract shield in navy with a white dove silhouette, used for event banners
validationRules: Optional but recommended for visual asset creation
Avoid including proprietary file attachments in this field; use asset upload instead

enhancedVariables.name: BRAND_COLORS
enhancedVariables.description: Primary and secondary brand colors used for visual content to ensure consistency across flyers, social graphics, and fundraising materials.
examples: Primary: #005B96 (deep blue); Secondary: #F4A261 (warm orange); Accent: #E9ECEF (light gray)
Colors: Navy blue, forest green, and gold — use navy for headers and gold for CTAs
Primary teal and soft coral for youth program materials
validationRules: When hex codes provided, validate format #RRGGBB
If color names used, cross-reference with hex or provide sample usage notes

enhancedVariables.name: COLOR1
enhancedVariables.description: A specific color value (usually primary or major accent) used in an infographic or visual asset; expect multiple numbered color variables for palettes.
examples: #004E89 (deep blue for headings)
Brand teal used for charts and icons
#FF7043 (coral accent for highlights)
validationRules: Accept hex color code (#RRGGBB) or short name; prefer hex

enhancedVariables.name: COLOR2
enhancedVariables.description: A second color value for visual assets, commonly used as a complementary or background color (paired with COLOR1 for contrast).
examples: #F2C94C (gold for highlighting statistics)
Light gray background for infographic panels
#2ECC71 (green for positive impact indicators)
validationRules: Accept hex color code (#RRGGBB) or descriptive name; prefer hex

enhancedVariables.name: STATISTIC1
enhancedVariables.description: A key numeric or short textual statistic about programs or impact to display prominently in an infographic or promotional material (first of multiple stats).
examples: 1,200 youth served in 2024
85% of participants reported improved reading skills
50 volunteers contributing 1,800 hours annually
validationRules: Prefer numeric-first format when possible (e.g., '1,200' or '85%')
If percentage or currency used, validate appropriate symbols

enhancedVariables.name: STATISTIC2
enhancedVariables.description: A second key statistic or impact figure used alongside STATISTIC1 to illustrate program outcomes or needs.
examples: 94% client satisfaction rate
$75,000 raised for emergency relief this year
3 community centers open across the county
validationRules: Optional but useful for balanced visuals
Validate numeric formatting for currencies and percentages where applicable

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_TONE
enhancedVariables.description: The desired voice and tone for communications reflecting the nonprofit's brand personality (e.g., formal, warm, hopeful, urgent) to guide captions, alt text, and copy.
examples: Warm and approachable — focus on empathy and community impact
Professional and data-driven for grant reports
Urgent and action-oriented for fundraising appeals
validationRules: Optional; default to 'Warm and approachable' for public-facing content
If custom tone entered, max length 128 characters

enhancedVariables.name: PRESENTATION_PURPOSE
enhancedVariables.description: The primary goal or intent of the presentation (what the nonprofit wants the audience to know, feel, or do after viewing).
examples: Present program outcomes to major donors and request a new three-year pledge
Introduce a community food security initiative to city council for funding approval
Train new volunteers on safety protocols and client interaction expectations
validationRules: if select='other' then show textarea for custom input

enhancedVariables.name: SLIDE_COUNT
enhancedVariables.description: The desired number of slides for the presentation, used to scope content and design.

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_COLORS
enhancedVariables.description: The official brand colors (hex codes or color names) that should be used to ensure visual consistency with the nonprofit's identity.
examples: #006B3C, #FFD200, #FFFFFF
Primary: #2A9D8F; Secondary: #264653; Accent: #E76F51
Navy, Sky Blue, Light Grey
validationRules: validate hex codes pattern: ^#([A-Fa-f0-9]{6}|[A-Fa-f0-9]{3})$ for each token when hex provided

enhancedVariables.name: VIEWING_CONTEXT
enhancedVariables.description: Where and how the presentation will be viewed (audience setting and medium), which affects design and pacing decisions.
examples: In-person board meeting with projector and Q&A
Recorded webinar for prospective volunteers (30-minute video)
Small community table at a public forum; printed handouts provided
validationRules: if select='other' then show textarea for custom input

enhancedVariables.name: FOOD_SECURITY_NONPROFIT
enhancedVariables.description: The specific nonprofit or program name focused on food security (used to tailor messaging, data, and examples to that organization).
examples: Harvest For All Community Food Bank
Urban Pantry Network – Meal Distribution Program
GreenGrow Mobile Produce Project

enhancedVariables.name: YOUTH_MENTORSHIP_PROGRAM
enhancedVariables.description: The specific youth mentorship program name or short descriptor, used to customize content for program promotion or volunteer recruitment.
examples: Bright Futures Mentorship (after-school program, ages 12–18)
STEM Mentors: Weekend Tutoring Initiative
Career Connect Mentorship for High School Seniors

enhancedVariables.name: STRATEGIC_PRIORITY
enhancedVariables.description: A high-level organizational priority or strategic objective that work should align to (e.g., growth, equity, sustainability).
examples: Increase program reach to underserved neighborhoods by 30% over two years
Diversify revenue by growing individual giving by 25% this fiscal year
Strengthen partner networks to improve referral pathways
validationRules: if select='other' then show textarea for custom input

enhancedVariables.name: RESOURCE_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The kind of resource being requested, produced, or analyzed (e.g., funding, volunteers, training materials).
examples: Grant funding for program expansion
Volunteer recruitment for weekend meal distribution
Staff training modules on data collection

enhancedVariables.name: FOCUS_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: The programmatic or thematic area the template should concentrate on (e.g., education, food security, mental health). Multiple focus areas may be used across different templates.
examples: Food Security and Emergency Food Assistance
Youth Development and Mentoring
Economic Empowerment and Job Training

enhancedVariables.name: DATA_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The kind of data to analyze or reference (qualitative, quantitative, survey, administrative, financial), informing methods and visuals.
examples: Administrative service usage records (client intake logs)
Survey responses from program participants (Likert-scale and open text)
Financial statements and monthly cash flow data

enhancedVariables.name: COMMUNITY_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The specific community, neighborhood, or population segment being studied or served (used to contextualize data and recommendations).
examples: Southside Heights neighborhood, City of Riverton
Somali refugee community in County X
High school students in the Central District

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_OBJECTIVE
enhancedVariables.description: A concrete, measurable objective tied to mission activities (what the nonprofit aims to achieve with a campaign, analysis, or program).
examples: Increase recurring monthly donors by 15% within 12 months
Reduce client waitlist time from 4 weeks to 2 weeks by Q3
Achieve a 90% program completion rate among participants
validationRules: encourage SMART format (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound)

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_METRICS
enhancedVariables.description: The exact metrics or KPIs to track (e.g., number served, retention rate, donation conversion), used for analysis and reporting.
examples: Monthly donor retention rate, average donation amount, LTV (lifetime value)
Number of unique clients served per month; percentage receiving follow-up services
Program completion percentage, pre/post assessment score improvement
validationRules: list each metric on a new line or separated by commas

enhancedVariables.name: BENCHMARK_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The comparison baseline or standard for performance (internal past performance, peer nonprofits, national standards).
examples: Compare to last fiscal year's quarterly performance
Benchmark against similar-sized nonprofits in the region
Use national sector standard for client-to-staff ratio

enhancedVariables.name: METRICS
enhancedVariables.description: General metrics or data fields to include in impact measurement and outcome tracking—may be repeated or expanded for different reports.
examples: Number of beneficiaries served, cost per beneficiary, satisfaction score
Volunteer hours logged, retention rate, program attendance
Funds raised, percentage restricted vs unrestricted, cost-to-raise-a-dollar

enhancedVariables.name: IMPACT_GOALS
enhancedVariables.description: High-level intended outcomes the nonprofit aims to achieve through programs and initiatives; describes measurable changes for beneficiaries over a defined timeframe.
examples: Increase high school graduation rates among program participants from 72% to 85% within 3 years.
Reduce chronic food insecurity for 500 households in the target neighborhood by 40% over 24 months.
Improve digital literacy for 1,200 seniors, with 75% reporting confidence using email and video calls within 12 months.
validationRules: Prefer measurable language (include target population, metric, baseline/target, timeframe)

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_METRICS
enhancedVariables.description: Specific quantitative indicators used to track progress toward impact goals (e.g., outputs and outcomes such as counts, percentages, rates).
examples: Number of unique program participants served each quarter; target = 400 participants/quarter.
Percentage increase in employment among participants within 6 months of program completion; baseline 30%, target 55%.
Average reading level improvement measured in months gained on standardized test; target = 6 months after 9 weeks.
validationRules: List each metric on a separate line
Each metric should include unit (count, %, rate), baseline (if known), and target/timeframe

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_GOALS
enhancedVariables.description: The objectives for a specific program or service, describing what that program intends to accomplish and how it contributes to broader impact goals.
examples: Provide weekly after-school tutoring to 150 students to raise average math scores by one grade level within the school year.
Deliver trauma-informed counseling to 200 survivors, with 70% reporting reduced PTSD symptoms at 6-month follow-up.
Create workforce readiness workshops for 300 young adults, aiming for 60% job placement within 3 months of completion.
validationRules: Should reference target population, intended change, and timeframe

enhancedVariables.name: SURVEY_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official title of a survey instrument used for data collection (e.g., participant feedback, needs assessment, post-service evaluation).
examples: 2025 Participant Satisfaction Survey - Youth Mentoring
Community Needs Assessment: Northside Neighborhood 2024
Volunteer Exit Survey - Summer Food Program
validationRules: No special characters other than - , : and ' recommended

enhancedVariables.name: VOLUNTEER_DATA
enhancedVariables.description: Aggregated or example data fields about volunteers used for analysis and engagement (e.g., demographics, hours, retention status, skills).
examples: Spreadsheet columns: VolunteerID, Name, Email, Phone, PrimarySkill, TotalHoursYTD, LastVolunteerDate, RetentionStatus
Sample dataset: 350 volunteers; avg hours/volunteer = 26; retention rate year-over-year = 65%
List of volunteers trained in food handling certification and available for weekend shifts
validationRules: If uploading data, accept CSV or JSON formats (schema should include unique ID and contact info)
Anonymize personally identifiable information unless necessary for the task

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The broad model or delivery approach for a program (e.g., direct services, advocacy, capacity building, peer-led), describing how services are provided.
examples: Direct service: weekly food pantry distribution with case management referrals
Capacity building: nonprofit leadership training for small community organizations
Hybrid after-school program combining tutoring (in-person) and digital mentorship (virtual)
validationRules: If 'Other' selected, require short description (text, max 200 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: GEOGRAPHIC_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: The specific geographic location(s) where a program, survey, or activity is focused (neighborhood, city, county, or region).
examples: Eastside Neighborhood, City of Springfield
King County (urban and rural service zones)
Northwest Region — counties: A, B, C
validationRules: Prefer standard place names; include level (neighborhood/city/county/region)

enhancedVariables.name: BUDGET_RANGE
enhancedVariables.description: The estimated or allowed financial range for a program, project, or funding opportunity, often used for planning or matching grants.
examples: $25,000 - $50,000 for pilot youth employment initiative
Low-budget community outreach: under $10,000
$150,000 - $300,000 for 18-month program expansion including staffing and operations
validationRules: Use currency format with numbers and commas; optional min and max separated by '-'
If exact number provided, allow single value (e.g., "$50,000")

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATIONAL_CONSTRAINTS
enhancedVariables.description: Key internal limitations or boundaries that affect program design or execution (e.g., staffing capacity, regulatory restrictions, technology limits).
examples: Limited bilingual staff: only 2 Spanish-speaking case managers available; max caseload per manager = 40.
Regulatory: confidentiality rules prevent sharing participant-level data across partner agencies without signed release.
Technology: no paid CRM license; rely on spreadsheets and shared drives for donor tracking.
validationRules: List constraints separated by bullets or new lines; flag critical risks

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_AREAS
enhancedVariables.description: The thematic or service domains the organization operates in (e.g., education, food security, mental health), often used for funding and reporting alignment.
examples: Early childhood education, family support, and parent coaching
Food security and nutrition assistance (pantry, meal delivery, SNAP enrollment support)
Workforce development, job training, and placement services for 18–30 year olds
validationRules: List up to 10 program areas, each on its own line
Avoid extremely long entries (max 500 characters total)

enhancedVariables.name: MISSION_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: The primary focus or sector of the organization's mission (e.g., education equity, disaster relief, environmental conservation) that frames strategy and programs.
examples: Education equity: closing achievement gaps for students in under-resourced schools
Disaster relief: emergency shelter and rapid response logistics in hurricane-prone regions
Environmental conservation: urban tree-planting and community stewardship
validationRules: Suggested controlled vocabulary (e.g., Education, Health, Environment, Human Services, Arts & Culture, Advocacy)
If 'Other' chosen, require short explanation (max 150 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: GEOGRAPHIC_LEVEL
enhancedVariables.description: The scale at which activities or policies apply (e.g., neighborhood, city, county, state, national, international).
examples: Neighborhood-level (specific census tracts in City of Portland)
Statewide program across California
International: operations in three countries in East Africa
validationRules: If 'Neighborhood' or 'City' selected, prompt for specific place name

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_AREA
enhancedVariables.description: A single programmatic category or service line within the organization (used for tagging specific projects or compliance research). Note: multiple PROGRAM_AREA variables may appear when describing several distinct projects.
examples: After-school academic tutoring (K–8)
Legal aid clinic for low-income tenants
Mobile health clinic providing vaccination and screenings
validationRules: Required when referencing a specific project
If multiple areas apply, provide separate PROGRAM_AREA entries (PROGRAM_AREA_1, _2, etc.)

enhancedVariables.name: YOUTH_LEARNING_ALLIANCE
enhancedVariables.description: Reference to a partner network or coalition focused on youth learning; represents organizational partnerships, membership, or collaborative initiatives in education for young people.
examples: Member organization of the Youth Learning Alliance network supporting after-school STEM clubs
Partnership with Youth Learning Alliance for curriculum sharing and joint training events
Applying for Youth Learning Alliance grant to pilot summer learning pods in three schools
validationRules: If used, specify role (Member/Partner/Applicant) and scope (e.g., geographic or programmatic)

enhancedVariables.name: GLOBAL_RELIEF_NETWORK
enhancedVariables.description: Reference to an international humanitarian partner network used for coordination in emergency response and relief operations.
examples: Coordination hub within the Global Relief Network for flood response in Southeast Asia
Registered partner of Global Relief Network contributing logistics support and local warehouses
Requesting situational reports from Global Relief Network members operating in the affected country
validationRules: If referenced, include partner role (e.g., lead, local partner) and affected country/region

enhancedVariables.name: REGULATION_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The broad class or kind of regulation relevant to the nonprofit (e.g., fundraising, data protection, employment, tax-exempt status). Helps categorize compliance research and shape required actions.
examples: Fundraising and charitable solicitation regulation
Data protection and privacy law (e.g., GDPR/CCPA)
Employment and volunteer labor law
validationRules: must be one of predefined options when available (e.g., Fundraising, Data Privacy, Tax, Employment, Anti‑fraud)

enhancedVariables.name: REGULATION_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official title or commonly used name of the specific regulation, statute, or rule that affects the organization.
examples: Charitable Solicitation Registration Act (State XYZ)
General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3)

enhancedVariables.name: JURISDICTION
enhancedVariables.description: The geographic or governmental scope where the regulation applies (e.g., country, state, municipality), used to determine relevant compliance obligations.
examples: California, USA
European Union (all member states)
City of Chicago, Illinois
validationRules: must match a supported jurisdiction list when available
if 'Other' selected, require free-text jurisdiction detail

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_CONCERN
enhancedVariables.description: A concise statement of the nonprofit's particular concern or risk related to the regulation (e.g., donor data sharing, registration deadlines, prohibited activities).
examples: Whether donor email lists can be shared with partner organizations
Upcoming deadline to file annual charitable registration renewal
Restrictions on political advocacy communications
validationRules: avoid personal identifying information unless necessary

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_FUNCTION
enhancedVariables.description: A named organizational function, process, or department (e.g., fundraising, volunteer management, case services) that the technology or regulation affects.
examples: Donor database and gift processing
Volunteer recruitment and scheduling
Client intake and case management
validationRules: must match one of the organization's defined functions or departments

enhancedVariables.name: APPENDIX
enhancedVariables.description: Supplementary material or attachments that support the main document (e.g., vendor specs, relevant statutes, sample policy, spreadsheets). May be referenced for deeper review.
examples: Vendor feature comparison spreadsheet (CSV)
Copy of state notification letter requirements (PDF)
Sample privacy policy and data flow diagram
validationRules: if file references are included, provide filename and type
max length 1000 characters for descriptive text

enhancedVariables.name: TECHNOLOGY_SOLUTION_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The high-level category of technology being considered (e.g., CRM, donor management, case management, volunteer scheduling, payroll), used for vendor shortlist and requirements mapping.
examples: Constituent Relationship Management (CRM) / Donor Management
Volunteer scheduling and shift management platform
Cloud-based case management system for client services
validationRules: must be one of predefined solution types (CRM, Case Management, HR, Finance, Volunteer Management, BI)

enhancedVariables.name: BUDGET_AMOUNT
enhancedVariables.description: The total budgeted amount (one-time and/or recurring) allocated for the project, purchase, or implementation, used to filter feasible solutions.
examples: Annual budget: 15000
One-time implementation budget: 25000
Monthly subscription budget: 500
validationRules: currency assumed (use whole numbers or two decimal places)
optional separate field to indicate whether amount is monthly, annual, or one‑time

enhancedVariables.name: PRIMARY_NEED
enhancedVariables.description: The main objective or problem the nonprofit wants to solve with the solution (e.g., improve donor retention, streamline reporting, automate intake), prioritized for evaluation criteria.
examples: Improve monthly donor retention by automating renewal reminders
Consolidate multiple spreadsheets into a single case management dashboard
Reduce manual receipt issuance for donations

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_SOLUTION_#
enhancedVariables.description: The name or brief identifier of a specific vendor solution being considered. Multiple numbered instances (e.g., SPECIFIC_SOLUTION_1, _2, _3) are expected to allow comparison across options.
examples: SPECIFIC_SOLUTION_1: DonorPerfect CRM
SPECIFIC_SOLUTION_2: Salesforce Nonprofit Cloud
SPECIFIC_SOLUTION_3: Bloomerang
validationRules: required for each solution slot being compared
allow numbering pattern; up to maxNumber (3) entries unless configuration changed

enhancedVariables.name: NUMBER_OF_SOLUTIONS
enhancedVariables.description: How many distinct solutions the organization intends to evaluate or compare (used to generate comparisons and allocate scoring).
validationRules: max should not exceed system limit (suggested max 10 unless otherwise configured)

enhancedVariables.name: TECHNOLOGY_NEED
enhancedVariables.description: A focused description of technical or functional requirements the organization requires from a technology solution (e.g., API integration, offline data entry, multi-site support).
examples: Must integrate with QuickBooks Online and import donation transactions automatically
Offline data capture for field volunteers with automatic sync when online
Role-based access controls and audit logs for donor data
validationRules: encourage bullet points for multiple needs

enhancedVariables.name: FORECAST_PERIOD
enhancedVariables.description: The time range (start and end or named period) for financial forecasting or budget analysis (e.g., next fiscal year, 12 months, Q3 2026).
examples: Next 12 months from June 2025
validationRules: prefer ISO date ranges or clearly named fiscal periods
if dates provided, validate start <= end and date format (YYYY-MM-DD) when applicable

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_FINANCIAL_GOALS
enhancedVariables.description: Concrete financial targets or objectives for the forecasting exercise (e.g., fundraising target, reserve levels, cost reductions).
examples: Increase unrestricted donations by $100,000 in FY2026
Maintain 6 months of operating reserves ($300,000)
Reduce overhead expenses by 8% next fiscal year
validationRules: when numeric goals included, validate numbers are positive and properly formatted

enhancedVariables.name: FINANCIAL_DATA_TIMEFRAME
enhancedVariables.description: The historical time window used to pull financial data for analysis (e.g., past 12 months, last three fiscal years), which affects trend and projection accuracy.
examples: Last 24 months (June 2023 - May 2025)
Previous three fiscal years (FY2023-FY2025)
Rolling 12 months ending May 31, 2025
validationRules: must specify clear start and end dates or named periods
if dates used, validate format and that end date is not in the future unless intentionally indicated

enhancedVariables.name: NUMBER_OF_SCENARIOS
enhancedVariables.description: The count of alternative planning or forecast scenarios the organization wants analyzed (e.g., best case, baseline, worst case). Use multiple scenarios to compare outcomes under different assumptions.

enhancedVariables.name: PLANNING_TIMEFRAME
enhancedVariables.description: The time horizon for the planning or forecasting exercise (e.g., 6 months, 1 year, 3 years). This frames assumptions about program roll-out, budgets, and staffing.
examples: 12 months
3 years
6–18 months

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_ASSUMPTIONS
enhancedVariables.description: A short list of the primary assumptions underpinning forecasts or strategic options (e.g., funding growth rate, client demand, policy changes). Multiple assumptions help explain scenario differences.
examples: Annual donor retention holds at 60%; no major policy changes.
Grant funding increases by 10% year-over-year for two years.
Volunteer hours remain at current levels; program demand grows 15%.

enhancedVariables.name: MISSION
enhancedVariables.description: The nonprofit’s mission statement summarizing its purpose, target population, and intended impact; used to ensure plans align with core goals.
examples: To empower low-income youth through mentorship and STEM education to close the opportunity gap.
To protect and restore urban green spaces to improve community health and biodiversity.
To provide emergency relief and long-term rebuilding support to families affected by natural disasters.

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAMS
enhancedVariables.description: A concise list or summary of active programs and services the nonprofit runs, including target groups and primary activities, to inform capacity and budget planning.
examples: After-school tutoring for grades 3–8; weekend STEM clubs; summer coding camp.
Mobile food pantry, weekly community meals, nutrition education workshops.
Rapid response legal clinic for refugees; case management and language classes.

enhancedVariables.name: CURRENT_CHALLENGES
enhancedVariables.description: Key operational, financial, programmatic, or external challenges the organization is facing that could affect planning (e.g., staff shortages, funding gaps, regulatory risk).
examples: Critical fundraising shortfall after losing a major grant; 20% revenue gap.
High staff turnover in front-line program roles; difficulty recruiting skilled caseworkers.
Rising demand for services with constrained warehouse space for supplies.

enhancedVariables.name: PLANNING_OBJECTIVES
enhancedVariables.description: Specific objectives the planning process should achieve (e.g., stabilize finances, scale a program, reduce operational risk). Objectives should be actionable and time-bound where possible.
examples: Reduce operating deficit to under 5% within 12 months and build a 3-month reserve.
Expand mentorship program to serve 200 additional youth by next school year.
Standardize volunteer onboarding to cut turnover by 30% in 9 months.

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_PRIORITIES
enhancedVariables.description: Top priorities to guide resource allocation and decision-making during the planning period (e.g., program continuity, staff training, fundraising diversification).
examples: Prioritize maintaining core client services while reducing discretionary expenses.
Invest in staff training and leadership development to improve retention.
Focus fundraising on monthly donors and corporate sponsorships to diversify revenue.

enhancedVariables.name: RESOURCE_CONSTRAINTS
enhancedVariables.description: Known limitations on budget, staffing, facilities, technology, or partnerships that will constrain implementation of plans and scenarios.
examples: Annual operating budget of $450,000 with no unrestricted emergency reserve.
Only two full-time program staff; volunteer pool limited to evenings/weekends.
Facility space limited to 1,200 sq ft; cannot support additional on-site clients.

enhancedVariables.name: GROWTH_INDICATORS
enhancedVariables.description: Measurable signs the organization uses to track growth or scale (e.g., client counts, revenue, number of sites, volunteer hours). These indicators help evaluate scenario outcomes.
examples: Increase program participants from 500 to 650 annually; revenue up 15%.
Add 2 new service sites within 24 months; volunteer hours increase by 40%.
Monthly active donors grow from 120 to 220 over 18 months.

enhancedVariables.name: CURRENT_PROGRAMS
enhancedVariables.description: Detailed listing of existing programs (names, brief description, target beneficiaries, and scale) to evaluate how planning changes may affect service delivery.
examples: Neighborhood Health Outreach: mobile clinics serving 150 patients/month; chronic disease management.
Youth Employment Initiative: job-readiness workshops for 18–24-year-olds; places 60 interns/year.
Housing Stabilization Program: rental assistance and case management for 200 households annually.

enhancedVariables.name: STAFF_CAPACITY
enhancedVariables.description: Current staffing levels, key roles, and capacity constraints (full-time/part-time counts, critical skill gaps) relevant to executing plans.
examples: 12 staff: 6 FT program, 2 FT fundraising, 4 PT admin; need an additional program manager.
Lean team of 5; no dedicated HR or finance staff — outsourced bookkeeping.
Strong volunteer coordination but limited certified clinicians (only 1 FT).

enhancedVariables.name: FUNDING_SOURCES
enhancedVariables.description: A breakdown of current revenue streams (grants, individual donations, earned income, contracts) and their relative importance or restrictions.
examples: 40% government contracts, 30% foundation grants, 20% individual donations, 10% program fees.
Major unrestricted grant covers 25% of budget; several restricted program grants expire in 9 months.
Earned income from social enterprise generates 15% of annual revenue.

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_CHALLENGES
enhancedVariables.description: Primary risks or barriers that could derail strategy (overlaps with CURRENT_CHALLENGES but focused on strategic risks like funding dependency, regulatory exposure, reputation).
examples: Overreliance on a single large donor that may reduce support next fiscal year.
Upcoming regulatory change could increase compliance costs by 8% annually.
Public perception risk after a recent program incident requiring reputation management.

enhancedVariables.name: EXISTING_STRENGTHS
enhancedVariables.description: Core organizational strengths and assets (e.g., strong board, community partnerships, proven program outcomes) to leverage in planning and fundraising.
examples: Well-respected program evaluation demonstrating a 40% improvement in client outcomes.
Strong partnerships with three local schools and an active 12-member volunteer board.
Robust data collection systems and experienced grants manager on staff.

enhancedVariables.name: STRATEGIC_OBJECTIVES
enhancedVariables.description: High-level strategic objectives the nonprofit aims to achieve over a defined planning horizon (e.g., 3–5 years), expressed as measurable goals that guide programs, fundraising, and operations.
examples: Increase annual program participants by 40% within three years through targeted outreach and partnership development.
Diversify revenue so that unrestricted contributions account for 35% of operating budget by FY2027.
Establish three new community partnerships to expand mental health services in underserved neighborhoods by 2026.
validationRules: Prefer each objective on a new line or numbered list
Encourage inclusion of timeframe and measurable target (e.g., % or number)

enhancedVariables.name: CURRENT_DATA
enhancedVariables.description: Relevant current organizational or community data used to inform planning and decisions, such as service usage statistics, recent needs assessments, budget snapshots, or demographic trends.
examples: Q1 client intake: 1,250 unique clients served; average wait time 12 days; 60% from low-income ZIP codes.
Most recent community survey (2024): 42% of respondents cite access to childcare as top barrier to employment.
FY2024 operating reserve: $120,000 (equivalent to 1.8 months of operating expenses).
validationRules: If uploading numeric datasets, ensure CSV or spreadsheet format (not handled here)
Encourage citation of data source and date

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_METRICS
enhancedVariables.description: Key performance indicators used to measure the effectiveness and reach of a specific program, including outputs (e.g., number served) and short- to medium-term outcomes (e.g., job placements).
examples: Monthly food distribution: number of households served, average pounds distributed per household, % repeat recipients.
Youth mentorship program: participant retention rate (past year), percentage completing school-year goals, post-program employment/education placement rate.
Counseling services: number of sessions provided, average symptom reduction score on standardized scale, client satisfaction rating.
validationRules: Encourage numeric values with timeframes (e.g., 'per month', 'annual')
If listing multiple metrics, use bullets or comma-separated values

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_OUTCOMES
enhancedVariables.description: Desired short-, medium-, and long-term outcomes the organization expects from its programs; these should be outcome-focused (changes in participant status or community conditions).
examples: Short-term: 80% of participants increase financial literacy scores by 20% within 6 months; Long-term: 50% achieve sustained employment after 12 months.
Reduce neighborhood-level chronic absenteeism by 15% within two school years through afterschool tutoring and family engagement.
Increase community vaccine uptake among seniors by 25% in targeted ZIP codes within one year.
validationRules: Encourage specifying timeframe and measurement method

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_REGION
enhancedVariables.description: Geographic area(s) where the nonprofit plans to deliver services, launch programs, or expand operations; may be specified by city, county, ZIP codes, or service area radius.
examples: Southwest quadrant of City X: ZIP codes 12345, 12346, 12347.
Rural counties A, B, and C within a 50-mile radius of the main office.
Metro region — cities: Springfield, Riverdale; priority neighborhoods: Eastside and Harborview.
validationRules: Accept comma-separated list of cities/counties/ZIPs or radius description
If multiple regions, encourage labeling priority vs. secondary

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATIONAL_GOALS
enhancedVariables.description: Operational and capacity-building goals that support the mission (e.g., staffing, governance, financial stability, technology upgrades) and translate strategic objectives into actionable targets.
examples: Hire a full-time development director and two part-time program coordinators by Q2 next fiscal year.
Implement an organization-wide CRM and train staff within six months to improve donor retention.
Increase unrestricted operating reserve to cover four months of expenses within 24 months.
validationRules: Encourage timeline and measurable target inclusion
If listing multiple goals, separate by line breaks

enhancedVariables.name: STAKEHOLDERS
enhancedVariables.description: Individuals, groups, or entities with a stake in the nonprofit’s work (e.g., beneficiaries, funders, board, staff, partners, government agencies) who should be engaged for planning or implementation.
examples: Local school district administrators, parent advocacy groups, and afterschool program coordinators.
Major individual donors, community foundations, and the city’s department of social services.
Board of Directors (chair, finance committee), frontline staff, and volunteer coordinators.
validationRules: Prefer listing stakeholder type and role (e.g., 'Funders: Community Foundation of X')
If contacting stakeholders, include preferred contact method where available

enhancedVariables.name: REGULATORY_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: Relevant laws, licensure, reporting, compliance obligations, and funding conditions the nonprofit must follow in program delivery and operations.
examples: State shelter licensing standards require background checks for all staff and volunteers working with minors.
Grant agreement with Foundation Y requires quarterly financial reports and evidence of matching funds.
HIPAA-compliant client data handling and annual staff training on privacy policies for health-related services.
validationRules: Encourage citation of statute/regulation and renewal dates where applicable
Flag items that require immediate action or nearing renewal

enhancedVariables.name: TARGET_BENEFICIARIES
enhancedVariables.description: Specific populations or groups the nonprofit intends to serve, described by demographics, eligibility criteria, or needs (e.g., low-income families, veterans, youth aged 12–18).
examples: Unhoused adults aged 18–64 in County Z who are exiting shelters or hospitals.
Low-income immigrant families with children under 5, prioritizing non-English speakers.
High-school students (grades 9–12) at risk of dropping out in District A, with GPA below 2.5.
validationRules: Encourage clear eligibility criteria (age, location, income threshold)
If cohorts are multiple, list and label each cohort

enhancedVariables.name: CRITERIA_LIST
enhancedVariables.description: Set of screening, evaluation, or selection criteria used to assess candidates, proposals, vendors, or event submissions (e.g., board candidates, scholarship applicants, proposal scoring factors). Multiple criteria entries are expected.
examples: Board candidate criteria: governance experience, fundraising capacity, commitment to mission, diversity of perspective.
Scholarship scoring: academic achievement (30%), financial need (40%), community service (20%), essay quality (10%).
Event proposal scoring: program relevance (40), budget feasibility (30), audience reach (20), sustainability (10).
validationRules: Required when used for selection processes
Encourage numeric weights where applicable and separate criteria by line
If used for automated scoring, ensure consistent formatting (e.g., 'Criterion: weight%')

enhancedVariables.name: BOARD_NEEDS
enhancedVariables.description: Specific skills, experiences, diversity characteristics, or capacity gaps the board seeks to fill when recruiting new members (e.g., finance expertise, legal counsel, community representation).
examples: Seeking a board member with nonprofit finance or audit experience and willingness to serve on the finance committee.
Looking for representation from Eastside immigrant communities and bilingual Spanish-English fluency.
Need a volunteer with PR/marketing background to support campaign messaging and media outreach.
validationRules: Encourage specifying priority vs. nice-to-have qualifications
Avoid protected-class language that could violate nondiscrimination rules

enhancedVariables.name: FOCUS_ISSUE
enhancedVariables.description: Primary issue or topic that a grant application, proposal, or screening process is intended to address (e.g., homelessness prevention, STEM education, food insecurity).
examples: Homelessness prevention and rapid rehousing for single adults.
After-school STEM enrichment for girls in middle school.
Food security initiatives targeting seniors on fixed incomes.
validationRules: Select from predefined list when possible; allow 'Other' with a short text field
If 'Other' selected, require description up to 200 characters

enhancedVariables.name: GRANT_POOL_SIZE
enhancedVariables.description: Total amount of funding available in the grant pool or discretionary fund to be awarded through a grantmaking or scholarship process.
examples: $150,000 total available for community grants in FY2025.
$25,000 scholarship pool to be divided among recipients.
$500,000 emergency relief fund for disaster response.
validationRules: Specify currency (default USD) or include separate currency field
Optional: maximum value check consistent with organization budget

enhancedVariables.name: EQUITY_FOCUS_GROUPS
enhancedVariables.description: Priority population groups or communities identified for equity-centered outreach and program design to address disparities (e.g., BIPOC communities, people with disabilities, linguistically isolated households).
examples: Low-income Latinx families who are monolingual Spanish speakers in neighborhoods A and B.
People with disabilities aged 18–65 who require accessible transportation services.
Formerly incarcerated individuals seeking job training and reentry support.
validationRules: Avoid stigmatizing language; describe strengths and needs

enhancedVariables.name: NEXT_REVIEW_STAGE
enhancedVariables.description: The subsequent step or stage in an application, grant, proposal, or candidate review process (e.g., desk review, panel review, site visit, finalist interview).
examples: Advancement to panel review: shortlisted applications will be evaluated by the review committee.
Schedule site visit and program demonstration in Q3 for top five applicants.
Finalist interviews with board selection committee — week of July 14.
validationRules: Select from predefined stages (e.g., 'Rejected', 'Desk Review', 'Panel Review', 'Site Visit', 'Interview', 'Approved')
If 'Other' chosen, require short description (max 200 characters)

enhancedVariables.name: DECISION_MAKERS
enhancedVariables.description: A short list or description of the people or roles within the organization (or funder) who make final decisions about applications, hires, grants, or program admissions.
examples: Executive Director; Board Grants Committee; Finance Director
Program Director (youth services), Board Chair, Community Advisory Panel
Grants Manager, Chief Operating Officer, External Review Panel Lead
validationRules: Required when decision workflow is used
If multiple names, separate by semicolon or newline

enhancedVariables.name: LEGAL_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: Any legal, regulatory, or compliance obligations that applicants or the program must meet (e.g., insurance, registration, non-discrimination policies).
examples: Proof of 501(c)(3) status; current liability insurance; child-safeguarding policy
State vendor registration, background checks for staff interacting with minors
GDPR-compliant data handling for EU participants; filed annual audit report
validationRules: Optional but recommended for grant/program templates
If listing multiple items, separate by semicolon or newline

enhancedVariables.name: REPORTING_EXPECTATIONS
enhancedVariables.description: The required cadence, format, and content of reports recipients must submit (e.g., interim/final narrative, financial statements, metrics).
examples: Quarterly narrative report and expense summary (within 30 days of quarter end)
Final program evaluation and audited financial report within 90 days of project end
Monthly participant enrollment and outcome dashboard in CSV format
validationRules: If there are deadlines, include date formats (e.g., MM/YYYY)

enhancedVariables.name: PRIORITY_AREA_#
enhancedVariables.description: A primary focus area for funding or program prioritization; multiple numbered instances (e.g., PRIORITY_AREA_1, _2, _3) are expected to capture distinct priorities.
examples: Priority 1: Early childhood literacy programs targeting low-income families
Priority 2: Mental health services for adolescents in rural communities
Priority 3: Workforce development and job placement for formerly incarcerated individuals
validationRules: At least one priority required when used

enhancedVariables.name: MINIMUM_SCORE_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: A numeric threshold used to automatically include/exclude applications or candidates based on scoring criteria (e.g., minimum score to pass initial screen).
validationRules: Min 0, Max 100 (if percent-based); otherwise specify scale
Required when automated screening is enabled

enhancedVariables.name: POSITION_TITLE
enhancedVariables.description: The formal job title for a role being recruited (used in resume/application screening and role-matching).
examples: Development Manager
Program Coordinator — Youth Services
Grants and Compliance Officer
validationRules: Avoid special characters; letters, numbers, hyphens allowed

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_REQUIREMENT_#
enhancedVariables.description: A critical qualification, skill, or requirement for a position; multiple numbered instances (e.g., KEY_REQUIREMENT_1, KEY_REQUIREMENT_2) capture distinct must-haves.
examples: Minimum 3 years of nonprofit fundraising experience
Bachelor's degree in social work or related field
Experience managing federal grant compliance (OMB A-110/A-133)
validationRules: At least one key requirement recommended for screening

enhancedVariables.name: MINIMUM_SCORE
enhancedVariables.description: Minimum acceptable score or points required for program participant selection or other scored assessments (similar to MINIMUM_SCORE_THRESHOLD but context-specific).
examples: Minimum score: 70 out of 100 for scholarship eligibility
Pass mark: 40 (on a 0–60 scale) for program enrollment
Cutoff: 3 out of 5 on rubric average
validationRules: Numeric value required when using scoring rubric
Specify the scale in accompanying notes if not 0–100
Min 0, Max equal to rubric maximum

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_CAPACITY
enhancedVariables.description: The maximum number of participants, households, or units the program can accommodate during a defined period.
examples: Capacity: 50 students per semester
Program can serve up to 200 households annually
Intensive cohort limited to 12 participants per cycle
validationRules: Include timeframe context in notes (e.g., per month, per year)

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_OBJECTIVE
enhancedVariables.description: A concise statement of the program's primary goal(s) and intended outcomes for participants or the community.
