examples: Increase third-grade reading proficiency among program participants by 20% within one year
Provide career readiness training and job placement for unemployed youth ages 18–24
Reduce emergency shelter recidivism by connecting families to permanent housing and support services
validationRules: Required for program intake and evaluation templates

enhancedVariables.name: COMMITTEE_COMPOSITION
enhancedVariables.description: A description of the makeup of the review/selection committee, including roles, stakeholder representation, and any required expertise or diversity considerations.
examples: Five-member committee: Program Director, Finance Officer, Board Member, External Community Representative, Volunteer Coordinator
Selection panel must include at least one youth representative and one subject-matter expert in mental health
Three reviewers with expertise in education policy; at least one independent reviewer
validationRules: Recommend specifying number of members and role titles
If diversity or conflict-of-interest rules apply, note them explicitly

enhancedVariables.name: DECISION_MAKER
enhancedVariables.description: A single primary person or role responsible for making the final call on an individual application, hire, grant, or selection decision.
examples: Director of Programs
Grants Committee Chair
Executive Director
validationRules: Required when a single approver workflow is used
Prefer role title; allow name and role

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_BENEFITS
enhancedVariables.description: The tangible and intangible benefits participants receive from the program, such as services, stipends, certifications, or referrals.
examples: Weekly counseling sessions, transportation vouchers, and job placement support
Small stipend of $200 per month, accredited certificate upon completion
Meals during program hours, childcare support, and legal referrals
validationRules: List benefits clearly; separate items with semicolon or newline
If monetary benefits are included, specify amounts and frequency

enhancedVariables.name: PARTICIPANT_EXPECTATIONS
enhancedVariables.description: What the program expects from participants in terms of attendance, behavior, deliverables, reporting, or engagement commitments.
examples: Attend at least 80% of weekly sessions and complete pre/post surveys
Complete 20 hours of volunteer service and participate in biweekly check-ins
Provide ID verification and consent to data collection; participate in evaluation interviews
validationRules: Required for enrollment and consent-related templates
Include consequences for non-compliance if applicable

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATIONAL_VALUES
enhancedVariables.description: A brief statement of the nonprofit's core principles and values that guide decision-making, program design, and partner selection.
examples: Equity, community-led solutions, transparency, and sustainability
Client-centered approach, inclusivity, and evidence-based practice
Stewardship of resources, partnership, and innovation
validationRules: Optional but recommended for alignment checks

enhancedVariables.name: CORE_VALUE
enhancedVariables.description: A short, central organizational value or principle that guides the nonprofit's mission and decisions (e.g., equity, dignity, stewardship).
examples: Equity: ensuring fair access to services for historically underserved communities
Stewardship: responsibly managing donor funds and resources for long‑term impact
Collaboration: partnering with local groups to co-create programs

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_QUALITY_#
enhancedVariables.description: A numbered list item describing a specific personal or organizational quality sought in applicants, volunteers, partners, or program participants; multiple instances (KEY_QUALITY_1, KEY_QUALITY_2, etc.) are expected.
examples: KEY_QUALITY_1: Demonstrated commitment to community service and civic engagement
KEY_QUALITY_2: Ability to work collaboratively in diverse, multidisciplinary teams
KEY_QUALITY_3: Strong written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail
validationRules: instancePattern: KEY_QUALITY_[1-N] when multiple items used

enhancedVariables.name: SCHOLARSHIP_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The formal name of a scholarship, grant, or award administered by the nonprofit, used in communications and documentation.
examples: River Valley Community Scholarship Fund
STEM Futures Undergraduate Award
Maria Lopez Leadership and Service Scholarship

enhancedVariables.name: X_NUMBER
enhancedVariables.description: A generic numeric placeholder used for counts, limits, funding amounts, or other numeric parameters in templates (interpretation depends on context).
examples: X_NUMBER: 3 (number of scholarships available this cycle)
X_NUMBER: 5000 (maximum award amount in USD)
X_NUMBER: 12 (months of eligibility after enrollment)

enhancedVariables.name: SCHOLARSHIP_PURPOSE
enhancedVariables.description: A concise statement describing the primary goal or intended impact of the scholarship (who it benefits and why).
examples: To support first‑generation college students pursuing STEM degrees from our service area
To provide tuition relief for mid‑career educators pursuing leadership certification
To remove financial barriers for immigrant youth seeking vocational training

enhancedVariables.name: QUALITIES_OF_SUCCESSFUL_RECIPIENTS
enhancedVariables.description: A description or bulleted list of traits, experiences, or achievements that previous or ideal scholarship recipients typically possess.
examples: Demonstrated community involvement, strong academic potential (GPA 3.0+), and financial need
Leadership in school or work, resilience in overcoming barriers, and clear career goals
Commitment to returning service to local communities and pursuing applied vocational paths

enhancedVariables.name: COMMITTEE_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The official name of the committee, panel, or group responsible for reviewing applications, proposals, or making decisions.
examples: Scholarship Selection Committee
Vendor Review and Procurement Panel
Community Grants Advisory Board

enhancedVariables.name: OTHER_DECISION_FACTORS
enhancedVariables.description: Additional contextual or qualitative factors that should influence selection decisions beyond core criteria (e.g., geographic equity, strategic alignment).
examples: Preference for applicants from rural communities to improve geographic equity
Consideration of prior grantee performance and long‑term sustainability plans
Alignment with current strategic priorities such as youth employment or climate resilience

enhancedVariables.name: EVALUATION_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: A set of measurable factors and their relative importance used to score or assess applications, proposals, or candidates.
examples: Academic merit (30%), Financial need (25%), Community impact (25%), Letters of recommendation (20%)
Project feasibility (40%), Cost‑effectiveness (30%), Organizational capacity (30%)
Volunteer fit: relevant skills (50%), availability (30%), references (20%)

enhancedVariables.name: SCHOLARSHIP_MISSION
enhancedVariables.description: The mission statement or strategic objective specific to the scholarship program, explaining how it supports the nonprofit's broader mission.
examples: To remove financial barriers to higher education for low‑income students in our county
To cultivate leadership among young women pursuing careers in public service
To support adult learners seeking credentialing for in‑demand technical jobs

enhancedVariables.name: EVALUATION_RUBRIC
enhancedVariables.description: A detailed rubric that defines score ranges, descriptors, and examples for each evaluation criterion to ensure consistent reviewer scoring.
examples: Academic merit: 5 = outstanding evidence of achievement; 3 = meets expectations; 1 = insufficient support
Organizational capacity: 4 = proven track record managing similar grants; 2 = limited experience
Community impact: 5 = measurable long‑term benefits for target population; 1 = no clear impact plan
validationRules: preferStructuredFormat: true (e.g., table or numbered rubric)

enhancedVariables.name: VENDOR_PROPOSALS
enhancedVariables.description: A brief description or list of vendor proposals under review, including vendor name, proposed service, and proposed cost or scope.
examples: GreenTech Consultants — energy audit and retrofit proposal — $45,000
Community Media Co. — outreach campaign and creative services — $25,000
SafeTransit Solutions — shuttle operations for program participants — $18,500

enhancedVariables.name: PROJECT_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The formal title of a project, program, or initiative that the nonprofit is implementing or evaluating.
examples: Neighborhood Food Access Initiative
Youth Tech Pathways Pilot Program
Resilience Hubs Capacity Building Project

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_SKILL_REQUIREMENTS
enhancedVariables.description: A list of essential skills or competencies required for a role, volunteer position, or program participant to succeed.
examples: Fluent Spanish and English; client intake and case management experience; trauma‑informed practice
Basic carpentry and tool safety; ability to lift 50 lbs; reliable transportation
Data entry accuracy, experience with CRM systems, and confidentiality handling

enhancedVariables.name: RETENTION_RATE
enhancedVariables.description: A numeric percentage representing the proportion of participants, volunteers, or donors who continue engagement over a defined period (e.g., annual retention).
examples: Retention_rate: 78 (78% of program participants continued to year two)
Retention_rate: 64 (64% annual donor retention last fiscal year)
Retention_rate: 90 (90% of volunteers returned for next service season)

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_NEEDS
enhancedVariables.description: A concise list of the client, program, or community needs that a volunteer, program, or donation should address; used to tailor outreach, matching, or service delivery.
examples: Food pantry restocking and evening distribution for seniors with mobility challenges
Weekly tutoring in literacy for 2nd–4th graders reading below grade level
Transitional housing move-in support including furniture pickup and setup
validationRules: Required when used in intake or volunteer matching contexts
Prefer comma-separated or bullet-style entries for multiple needs

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_OR_ROLE
enhancedVariables.description: The specific program name or volunteer role being referenced or recruited for; identifies where a person or resource will be assigned.
examples: After-school STEM Mentorship Program - Mentor
Community Health Outreach - Vaccination Navigator
Fundraising Gala - Event Setup Volunteer
validationRules: Must match one of the organization's active program or role identifiers
If 'Other' selected, show a text field for details (max 200 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: ENGAGEMENT_ACTIVITY
enhancedVariables.description: A specific outreach, participatory, or community engagement activity (meeting, workshop, listening session) used to gather input or deliver services.
examples: Neighborhood listening session on park safety (60 min)
Volunteer orientation and training workshop (2 hours)
Community visioning workshop with breakout groups
validationRules: Prefer including format and duration when applicable

enhancedVariables.name: PRIMARY_CATEGORY_SET
enhancedVariables.description: The main taxonomy or set of high-level categories used to classify community input, program areas, or content for prioritization and reporting.
examples: Education, Health, Housing, Employment
Advocacy, Direct Services, Research
Youth Services, Senior Services, Family Support
validationRules: Maximum 10 categories; each category max 50 characters

enhancedVariables.name: PRIORITIZATION_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: The specific standards or factors (impact, urgency, feasibility, equity) used to rank issues, projects, or incoming requests for triage.
examples: Impact on vulnerable populations, Cost per beneficiary, Time-to-implement
Alignment with strategic plan, Donor interest, Urgency/Immediate risk
Volunteer capacity required, Geographic reach, Measurable outcomes
validationRules: List items separated by commas or newlines
Max 10 criteria; each criterion max 100 characters

enhancedVariables.name: CATEGORY_#
enhancedVariables.description: A single category label within a numbered set (CATEGORY_1, CATEGORY_2, CATEGORY_3, etc.) used for multi-category classification of input or themes. Multiple instances are expected and numbered.
examples: CATEGORY_1: Youth Education
CATEGORY_2: Mental Health Services
CATEGORY_3: Workforce Development
validationRules: Each numbered instance required when template expects multiple categories
Do not duplicate labels across CATEGORY_# instances

enhancedVariables.name: DONOR_LIST
enhancedVariables.description: A list or group identifier of donor prospects, prior donors, or stewardship segments targeted for outreach or ranking.
examples: Top 100 lapsed donors (last gift > 3 years, gave ≥ $250)
Major gift prospects: capacity $50k+, engaged in board events
Monthly sustaining donors: recurring gifts under $50
validationRules: Accepts comma- or newline-separated entries (name or segment)
If providing individual names, include at least 'Name' and one contact method

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_FOCUS
enhancedVariables.description: The core thematic or operational focus of a program (e.g., outcomes it targets or populations it serves) to aid in prospect matching or service alignment.
examples: Early childhood literacy for ages 3–5 in low-income neighborhoods
Job placement and skills training for unemployed adults 18–35
Mobile health clinics serving rural areas with limited primary care
validationRules: Include target population and primary service/outcome when possible

enhancedVariables.name: CAMPAIGN_PHASE
enhancedVariables.description: The current stage of a fundraising or communications campaign (e.g., planning, soft launch, active solicitation, stewardship) to contextualize messaging and triage.
examples: Planning: strategy development and leadership gifts
Active Solicitation: public ask and direct mail blitz
Stewardship: thank-you and impact reporting phase
validationRules: Allowed values: Planning, Pre-Launch, Active Solicitation, Close-Out, Stewardship
If 'Other' selected, require a short description (max 100 chars)

enhancedVariables.name: CURRENT_CAMPAIGN
enhancedVariables.description: The name or identifier of the active fundraising, outreach, or program campaign related to the template's task.
examples: Winter Emergency Relief 2025
Capital Campaign: New Community Center
Back-to-School Supplies Drive
validationRules: Prefer official campaign name as used in CRM

enhancedVariables.name: STAKEHOLDER_GROUPS
enhancedVariables.description: Key stakeholder audiences (internal and external) affected by or involved in a program, campaign, or decision — used to tailor communication and prioritize responses.
examples: Board members, Major donors, Program participants, Local government partners
Volunteers, Community leaders, Referral agencies
Media contacts, Funders, Staff leadership
validationRules: Required for communication and triage planning
Max 20 stakeholder groups; each group max 80 characters

enhancedVariables.name: DEPARTMENT_COUNT
enhancedVariables.description: The number of internal departments or teams that will be involved in handling requests, events, or campaign activities; helps determine routing and capacity.

enhancedVariables.name: RESPONSE_CAPACITY
enhancedVariables.description: A brief statement or numeric estimate of the organization's ability to respond within a given timeframe (staff hours, volunteer availability, or percent of requests that can be handled).
examples: Team can respond to 20 email inquiries per day; 2 staff available for urgent cases
Limited: 10 volunteer-hours/week available for client intake
Full capacity for outreach this month; can deploy 4 field teams
validationRules: Required for realistic triage and scheduling
When giving numeric estimates, include unit (e.g., hours, cases/day)

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIAL_CONSIDERATION
enhancedVariables.description: Any accommodations, restrictions, or unique factors (privacy, accessibility, cultural norms, legal constraints) that should influence handling of a case, event, or communication.
examples: Requires Spanish interpretation and materials in large print
Do not contact in evenings due to client safety concerns
Funding restricted to capital expenses only; cannot be used for operations
validationRules: Optional but recommended for sensitive contexts
Flag must be applied if related to safety, legal, or privacy constraints

enhancedVariables.name: PRIORITY_#
enhancedVariables.description: A numbered priority label (PRIORITY_1, PRIORITY_2, PRIORITY_3, etc.) defining the rank or ordering of items, issues, or outreach targets; multiple numbered instances are expected.
examples: PRIORITY_1: Immediate safety issues affecting clients
PRIORITY_2: High-impact program funding opportunities
PRIORITY_3: Routine operational emails and inquiries
validationRules: Each priority instance required when template expects multiple levels
Allowed values: High, Medium, Low (or custom label up to 50 chars)
Ensure uniqueness of rank (no duplicate PRIORITY_1, etc.)

enhancedVariables.name: BUSY_PERIOD_#
enhancedVariables.description: Identifies recurring high-workload periods for the organization (e.g., fundraising drives, program enrollments). Multiple numbered instances are expected (BUSY_PERIOD_1, BUSY_PERIOD_2) to capture several distinct busy periods.
examples: Year-end giving campaign (Nov 15 - Dec 31)
Summer youth program registration (May 1 - June 15)
Monthly donor stewardship report week (1st week of each month)
validationRules: Required for organizations that track operational peaks
If including dates, use ISO date ranges or clearly formatted ranges (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD - YYYY-MM-DD)

enhancedVariables.name: URGENT_CATEGORY
enhancedVariables.description: Label for items that require immediate action (same-day or within 24 hours) such as safety incidents, major donor escalation, or media crises.
examples: Safety incident reported at program site
Major donor pledge dispute requiring immediate attention
Negative press article with factual inaccuracies
validationRules: Prepopulate from organizational incident taxonomy where possible
Must be a single categorical value
Required when used within an email or case triage workflow

enhancedVariables.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CATEGORY
enhancedVariables.description: Category for high-priority items that should be addressed within 48–72 hours, such as major grant deadlines or urgent stakeholder requests.
examples: Grant application nearing deadline (72 hours)
Partner coordination required for upcoming program
Board query about financial variance
validationRules: Single selection from defined priority taxonomy
Allowed values should map to escalation protocols

enhancedVariables.name: MEDIUM_PRIORITY_CATEGORY
enhancedVariables.description: Category for routine but time-sensitive items to be handled within a standard working week (3–7 days), e.g., volunteer scheduling changes or routine media mentions.
examples: Volunteer shift swap request
Routine media mention requiring monitoring
Donor acknowledgment update (non-urgent)
validationRules: Clearly document expected response SLA (e.g., 3–7 days)

enhancedVariables.name: LOW_PRIORITY_CATEGORY
enhancedVariables.description: Category for low-urgency items that can be handled in regular workflow over weeks, such as general information requests or non-time-sensitive feedback.
examples: General information request about services
Suggestion for future event topics
Archived media mention with no action required
validationRules: Used to deprioritize in triage systems
May be left blank if not applicable

enhancedVariables.name: AUTOMATED_RESPONSE_CATEGORY
enhancedVariables.description: Indicates messages eligible for automated replies (e.g., confirmations, FAQs, donation receipts) to reduce staff workload.
examples: Donation receipt and tax acknowledgement
Volunteer sign-up confirmation with next steps
FAQ response about program hours
validationRules: Values should map to pre-approved automated templates
Only allow categories that have an associated template

enhancedVariables.name: DEPARTMENT_#
enhancedVariables.description: Name of an internal department related to the item (e.g., Development, Programs). Multiple numbered instances (DEPARTMENT_1, DEPARTMENT_2) allow tagging more than one department per item.
examples: Development (fundraising)
Programs — Youth Services
Communications & Marketing
validationRules: Accept one department per indexed variable instance
Values should come from organization’s department list
Max length 100 characters; required if routing is used

enhancedVariables.name: STAKEHOLDER_TYPES
enhancedVariables.description: List or short taxonomy of stakeholder groups relevant to the item (e.g., donors, beneficiaries, partners, volunteers).
examples: Individual donors; Major donors; Foundations
Program participants (ages 6–12); Families; Caregivers
Volunteer coordinators; Onsite volunteers; Remote volunteers
validationRules: Comma-separated list or bullet lines allowed

enhancedVariables.name: FEEDBACK_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Classifies incoming feedback (complaint, compliment, suggestion, inquiry) to guide handling and reporting.
examples: Complaint — service delivery
Suggestion — program improvement
Compliment — staff support
validationRules: Single selection from predefined feedback types
Map to escalation policies where applicable

enhancedVariables.name: KEY_VALUES
enhancedVariables.description: Core organizational values to reference when crafting communications or decisions (e.g., equity, transparency, dignity).
examples: Equity; Inclusion; Community-led solutions
Transparency; Accountability; Impact-focused
Respect; Collaboration; Sustainability

enhancedVariables.name: ORGANIZATION_SECTOR
enhancedVariables.description: Primary sector of the nonprofit (e.g., education, health, environment) used for contextualizing messaging and media tracking.
examples: Education — early childhood development
Health — community clinics and outreach
Environment — watershed restoration
validationRules: Single selection from standard sector list

enhancedVariables.name: RECENT_NEWS
enhancedVariables.description: Short summary or list of recent news items or media mentions about the organization to inform responses and monitoring.
examples: Local paper covered our summer program (Aug 10) — positive feature
Press release announcing new CEO (Jul 2)
Negative social post about service delays on Aug 18
validationRules: Summaries should include date and one-line context

enhancedVariables.name: VOICE_CHARACTERISTICS
enhancedVariables.description: Describes the organization's communication voice (e.g., warm, authoritative, hopeful) to ensure consistent tone across responses.
examples: Warm, inclusive, and community-centered
Professional, data-driven, and concise
Hopeful, empowering, and action-oriented
validationRules: Provide 1–3 short descriptors, each under 40 characters
Optional but recommended for public-facing messaging

enhancedVariables.name: TONE_GUIDELINES
enhancedVariables.description: Specific guidance on tone and phrasing (e.g., avoid jargon, emphasize impact) to use when drafting communications.
examples: Use plain language; avoid sector jargon; emphasize beneficiary impact
Acknowledge concerns first, then provide next steps; keep replies under 200 words
Express gratitude in donor communications; include clear call-to-action
validationRules: Include actionable do/don’t bullets where possible

enhancedVariables.name: TIMEFRAME_GOALS
enhancedVariables.description: Defines target timeframes and goals for actions or campaigns (deadlines, milestones, expected response windows).
examples: Secure 50 new recurring donors by Dec 31, 2025
Resolve all volunteer scheduling conflicts within 7 business days
Publish monthly impact newsletter by the 10th of each month
validationRules: Include measurable target and deadline where applicable
Use ISO dates for deadlines when providing specific dates

enhancedVariables.name: TYPE_OF_MENTIONS
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the kind of social media mentions to monitor (e.g., praise, complaint, question, media pickup, partner shout-out) so the system can prioritize and route responses appropriately.
examples: Complaint about program quality
Donation acknowledgement or donor shout-out
Media article linking to our research
validationRules: Must be one of the predefined mention types used by the org (e.g., praise, complaint, question, media, volunteer-request)
If 'other' selected, require short text explanation (max 200 characters)

enhancedVariables.name: BRACKETED
enhancedVariables.description: Indicates whether the incoming content contains bracketed metadata or tags (e.g., [URGENT], [VOLUNTEER], [PRESS]) used by staff or automated systems to flag items.
examples: [URGENT] Volunteer needs immediate support
[PRESS] Interview request from local station
[INTERNAL] Draft copy for review
validationRules: If custom bracketed tag provided, allow letters, numbers, spaces and underscores only (regex: ^[A-Za-z0-9 _-]+$)

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_#
enhancedVariables.description: Name of a program or service the nonprofit runs; multiple numbered instances (PROGRAM_1, PROGRAM_2, etc.) are expected to list up to the organization's common programs for routing, tagging or reporting.
examples: Youth Mentoring Program
Mobile Health Clinics
Community Food Pantry
validationRules: Required for each instance if referenced in the template
Disallow only punctuation; must contain at least one alphanumeric character

enhancedVariables.name: CAMPAIGN_#
enhancedVariables.description: Name of a fundraising, awareness, or advocacy campaign; multiple instances (CAMPAIGN_1, CAMPAIGN_2, etc.) allow mapping mentions to the correct active campaigns.
examples: Year-End Giving 2025
Clean Water Advocacy Month
Back-to-School Supplies Drive
validationRules: If campaign referenced, must match active campaign list or be marked as 'archived' or 'other'
Optional: normalize to standardized campaign code if available

enhancedVariables.name: HASHTAG_#
enhancedVariables.description: A social media hashtag associated with the organization, campaign, or topic; multiple instances (HASHTAG_1, HASHTAG_2, etc.) let the system track and classify posts.
examples: #FeedOurNeighbors
#CleanWaterNow
#VolunteerWithUs
validationRules: Must begin with '#' followed by letters, numbers or underscores (regex: ^#[A-Za-z0-9_]+$)

enhancedVariables.name: ROLE_#
enhancedVariables.description: A staff, volunteer, or stakeholder role relevant to the mention (e.g., Communications Director, Volunteer Coordinator); multiple instances (ROLE_1, ROLE_2, etc.) capture who should be notified or responsible.
examples: Communications Director
Volunteer Coordinator
Program Manager - Youth Services
validationRules: If selecting from org directory, must match existing role titles
Cannot be blank if mention requires escalation

enhancedVariables.name: TONE_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: A short descriptor of the tone to be used in responses or the detected tone of incoming content (e.g., apologetic, celebratory, neutral, urgent), used to guide messaging and escalation.
examples: Empathetic and apologetic for service complaints
Upbeat and celebratory for donor milestones
Informative and neutral for program updates
validationRules: Must be one of the predefined tones used by the communications team
If 'custom' selected, require short explanation (max 150 characters)

enhancedVariables.name: NUMBER_OF_CATEGORIES
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies how many categories to divide survey responses or items into for analysis or reporting (used to configure categorization workflows).

enhancedVariables.name: CATEGORIZATION_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: Defines the rules or factors used to sort content into categories (e.g., topic, sentiment, urgency, donor segment) to ensure consistent labeling and reporting.
examples: Primary topic (program vs. fundraising), sentiment (positive/negative/neutral), and urgency (low/medium/high)
Donor type (individual, corporate, foundation) and ask stage (prospect, active, lapsed)
Theme (access, advocacy, education) plus geographic region
validationRules: Should list criteria as bullet points or numbered list
At least one criterion required when enabling automated categorization

enhancedVariables.name: THEME_#
enhancedVariables.description: High-level themes or topics identified in responses or content (e.g., access, equity, mental health); multiple numbered instances capture several themes for tagging and analysis.
examples: Food Security
Volunteer Recognition
Mental Health Outreach
validationRules: If used for reporting, must map to the org's taxonomy
No special characters except hyphens and ampersands

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: Detailed quality or editorial standards to apply when reviewing content (e.g., accessibility checks, factual accuracy, donor privacy compliance).
examples: All donor names must be anonymized unless explicit consent is documented
Verify all statistics with source links and include citation
Ensure alt text for images and plain-language descriptions for accessibility
validationRules: Should be clear, actionable bullets where possible
If compliance-related, reference applicable policy ID

enhancedVariables.name: BUDGET_CONSTRAINT
enhancedVariables.description: A short statement of financial limits or constraints (e.g., maximum spend, budget line restrictions) relevant to event planning, materials or program proposals.
examples: Total event budget must not exceed $10,000; catering capped at $2,000
Marketing materials budget: $1,500 and must use in-kind printing partner
Program pilot funding limited to $25,000 from restricted grant
validationRules: Prefer numeric currency values; allow optional text explanation
If currency provided, validate format (e.g., $10,000 or 10000)

enhancedVariables.name: MATERIAL_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The title or identifier of a marketing or outreach material (e.g., flyer name, email subject line, brochure title) used for evaluation and tracking.
examples: Spring Volunteer Recruitment Flyer 2025
Year-End Appeal Email - Subject A/B Test
Community Health Outreach Brochure - Spanish
validationRules: Should include a version or date when applicable

enhancedVariables.name: MATERIAL_CONTENT
enhancedVariables.description: The body copy, summary, or key messaging of the marketing material being reviewed; used for effectiveness scoring, editing, or compliance checks.
examples: Email copy describing year-end impact with donor stories and clear CTA to donate online.
Flyer outlining volunteer shifts, requirements, and sign-up link for neighborhood clean-up.
Brochure content summarizing clinic services, hours, and eligibility with contact info.
validationRules: Should not contain unredacted personal data (PII) unless marked and authorized
If includes links, validate URL format

enhancedVariables.name: MARKETING_MATERIAL_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: The format or channel of the marketing item (e.g., email, social post, flyer, brochure) to guide review criteria and distribution recommendations.
examples: Email fundraising appeal
Instagram post (image + caption)
Printed community flyer
validationRules: Must be one of the organization's supported material types (e.g., Email, Social, Print, Video)
If 'Other' selected, require short description (max 80 characters)

enhancedVariables.name: CAMPAIGN_NAME
enhancedVariables.description: The public-facing name of a fundraising, outreach, or awareness campaign the nonprofit is running; used to tag materials, reports, and partner communications.
examples: Winter Emergency Relief 2025
Back-to-School Supplies Drive
Clean Water Awareness Month

enhancedVariables.name: PARTNER_ORGANIZATION
enhancedVariables.description: The name of an external organization (NGO, corporate partner, government agency, or community group) collaborating with the nonprofit on programs or campaigns.
examples: Sunrise Community Health Network
Acme Corporation Corporate Giving
City Department of Homeless Services

enhancedVariables.name: ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: A concise list or description of the criteria used to evaluate proposals, partners, programs, or materials (e.g., relevance, feasibility, cost-effectiveness).
examples: Relevance to community need; scalability; demonstrated impact; budget clarity
Volunteer management capacity; safeguarding policies; financial transparency
Program alignment with strategic plan; measurable outcomes; timeline realism

enhancedVariables.name: SCORE
enhancedVariables.description: A numeric or categorical score assigned against a single assessment criterion or line item during reviews or quality checks.
examples: Meets expectations

enhancedVariables.name: BRIEF_JUSTIFICATION
enhancedVariables.description: A short explanatory note describing why a given score or assessment decision was made; used to provide context and auditability.
examples: Strong monitoring framework and clear KPI definitions.
Insufficient evidence of community consultations prior to proposal.
Budget lacks line items for volunteer training.

enhancedVariables.name: TOTAL_SCORE
enhancedVariables.description: The aggregated numeric total of all individual criterion scores for a proposal, partner assessment, or program review.

enhancedVariables.name: MAXIMUM_POSSIBLE
enhancedVariables.description: The highest attainable total score for the assessment (sum of max values for each criterion) used to calculate percentages or tiers.

enhancedVariables.name: PARTNERSHIP_TIER
enhancedVariables.description: A categorical label indicating the recommended level or tier of partnership (e.g., strategic, operational, informal) based on assessment results.
examples: Strategic Partner
Project-level Collaborator
Referral Partner

enhancedVariables.name: SPECIFIC_ACTION_STEP
enhancedVariables.description: A single, actionable task recommended to improve a partner, program, or campaign (clear owner, deliverable, and expected outcome encouraged).
examples: Schedule joint field visit with partner program manager by June 15 to verify beneficiary list.
Revise budget to include a dedicated line for monitoring and evaluation within two weeks.
Develop a volunteer onboarding checklist and assign to HR lead.

enhancedVariables.name: BRIEF_NEXT_STEPS
enhancedVariables.description: A short sequence or summary of the immediate next activities the organization or partner should take following an assessment.
examples: Hold debrief with partner; finalize MOU; schedule kickoff meeting.
Request revised budget; approve funding tranche; initiate procurement.
Train volunteers; launch pilot in two communities; collect baseline data.

enhancedVariables.name: ADDITIONAL_CRITERION_#
enhancedVariables.description: A repeatable field representing extra evaluation criteria beyond the core set; multiple numbered instances (e.g., ADDITIONAL_CRITERION_1, _2) are expected for flexible assessments.
examples: Environmental sustainability practices (ADDITIONAL_CRITERION_1)
Data protection and beneficiary privacy measures (ADDITIONAL_CRITERION_2)
Capacity for local staff recruitment (ADDITIONAL_CRITERION_1)

enhancedVariables.name: STRENGTH_#
enhancedVariables.description: A numbered, repeatable field capturing distinct strengths observed during assessment (e.g., STRENGTH_1, STRENGTH_2), useful for summaries and executive notes.
examples: Strong community relationships and trust built over five years (STRENGTH_1)
Robust financial controls with audited statements (STRENGTH_2)
Experienced program leadership with local networks (STRENGTH_3)

enhancedVariables.name: RECOMMENDATION_#
enhancedVariables.description: A numbered, repeatable recommendation entry suggesting actions, follow-ups, or decisions; multiple instances (e.g., RECOMMENDATION_1..3) are expected.
examples: Proceed to pilot funding for Q3 with monitoring milestone (RECOMMENDATION_1)
Require corrective action plan on safeguarding within 30 days prior to approval (RECOMMENDATION_2)
Engage partner in capacity building for M&E and revisit after six months (RECOMMENDATION_3)

enhancedVariables.name: COMMUNITY_NEED
enhancedVariables.description: A concise statement describing the specific local need or problem the proposed program aims to address, often informed by needs assessments or beneficiary consultations.
examples: High rates of childhood malnutrition in Ward 7 with limited access to fortified foods.
Seasonal flooding displacing families and interrupting school attendance.
Lack of affordable mental health services for low-income youth in the urban center.

enhancedVariables.name: EXISTING_PROGRAMS
enhancedVariables.description: A description or list of current programs, services, or partners in the same thematic area or geography to assess overlap, complementarity, or gaps.
examples: Child nutrition program providing monthly food baskets in 3 districts; school feeding initiative in partnership with local schools.
Emergency cash transfer pilot in Flood Zone A; livelihood training for 120 beneficiaries.
Community mental health hotline and peer support groups run by two local NGOs.

enhancedVariables.name: PREVIOUS_OUTCOMES
enhancedVariables.description: Summarizes measurable results from prior rounds of the program or similar projects, including indicators, timeframe, and impact on beneficiaries.
examples: Year 1: Enrolled 120 youth in after-school tutoring; 75% improved math scores by one grade level within 9 months.
Pilot cohort (Jan–Jun 2023): 40 households received sanitation kits; reported diarrheal incidents decreased by 30% over 6 months.
Three-year program (2019–2021): Trained 250 community health workers; maternal mortality in target villages reduced from 120 to 85 per 100,000.
validationRules: Encourage numeric indicators and timeframe (e.g., include year or months)

enhancedVariables.name: RUBRIC_SOURCE
enhancedVariables.description: Specifies the origin of the evaluation rubric or scoring framework used to assess proposals or service quality (e.g., internal policy, funder guideline, sector standard).
examples: Organization internal grant review rubric v2.1 (approved May 2024)
Funder X Program Eligibility and Scoring Guidelines, section 3
Adapted from UNICEF Early Childhood Development monitoring framework
validationRules: Optional but recommended when scoring is used
If external, include source name and version or date

enhancedVariables.name: MIN_SCORE
enhancedVariables.description: The minimum numeric value allowed on the scoring scale for proposals or assessments (lower bound of rubric).
validationRules: Integer or decimal allowed depending on rubric

enhancedVariables.name: MAX_SCORE
enhancedVariables.description: The maximum numeric value allowed on the scoring scale for proposals or assessments (upper bound of rubric).
validationRules: Integer or decimal allowed depending on rubric

enhancedVariables.name: PASSING_THRESHOLD
enhancedVariables.description: The numeric cutoff or percentage that a proposal, applicant, or service review must meet or exceed to be considered acceptable or to proceed to the next stage.
examples: 70 (out of 100)
3 (out of 5)
validationRules: Must be between MIN_SCORE and MAX_SCORE (or 0–100 if expressed as percent)
If expressed as percent, clarify percent flag or store as numeric 0–100

enhancedVariables.name: PRIORITY_CRITERIA
enhancedVariables.description: Lists the strategic or operational criteria used to prioritize proposals, beneficiaries, or service delivery (e.g., geographic focus, equity, urgency, cost-effectiveness).
examples: Priority to applicants serving rural districts with >40% poverty rate and demonstrated community partnerships.
Focus on projects addressing gender-based violence and those that include survivor-led design.
Prioritize cost-effective proposals under $50,000 with clearly defined M&E plans.
validationRules: Encourage use of measurable or time-bound qualifiers where possible

enhancedVariables.name: PROGRAM_PROPOSAL
enhancedVariables.description: The full proposal document or structured summary submitted to request funding or approval for a program, including objectives, budget, activities, and M&E plans.
examples: Comprehensive proposal: 'Community Gardening Initiative' with $75,000 budget, 18-month timeline, and indicators for food security.
One-page concept note for 'Youth Digital Skills Lab' including objectives, target population, and preliminary budget.
Grant application package for 'Mobile Health Clinics' with partnership letters and staffing plan.
validationRules: Required when evaluating or archiving proposals
Max length 5000 characters or allow file attachment (PDF/DOCX)
If long-form, encourage sections: objectives, beneficiaries, activities, budget, M&E

enhancedVariables.name: PROPOSAL_TEXT
enhancedVariables.description: A shorter, plain-text extraction or summary of the proposal content used for quick review, AI analysis, or inclusion in templates.
examples: Summary: Train 200 women in sewing skills over 12 months to increase household income by 20%. Budget: $40,000.
Brief: Establish a counseling hotline for adolescents; 24/7 service for 6 months; includes training for 6 counselors.
Executive summary: Food distribution to 600 displaced families with hygiene kits and cash transfers for three months.
validationRules: Prefer plain text (no embedded images or complex formatting)
If autogenerated, include source reference to PROGRAM_PROPOSAL

enhancedVariables.name: SERVICE_DESCRIPTION
enhancedVariables.description: A clear description of a specific service offered by the nonprofit, covering purpose, target beneficiaries, delivery method, frequency, and expected outcomes.
examples: Weekly mobile clinic offering primary care and immunizations to remote villages; serves ~120 patients per clinic day.
After-school mentoring program for middle-school students meeting twice weekly to improve literacy and social skills.
Emergency food distribution: monthly parcels for families affected by flooding, including nutrition counseling.
validationRules: Encourage inclusion of target group and delivery cadence

enhancedVariables.name: QUALITY_STANDARDS
enhancedVariables.description: Defines the organization's or sector's benchmarks, policies, or indicators that services must meet to be judged high quality (e.g., CP/GBV protocols, staff-to-client ratios).
examples: Child protection standards: all staff vetted with DBS checks, staff-to-child ratio 1:8 for activities, mandatory safeguarding training.
Health service standards: clinics must follow WHO infection control guidelines and report adverse events within 24 hours.
Education program quality: curriculum aligned to national standards, teacher certification required, and pre/post assessments.
validationRules: If referencing external standards, include citation or URL
Encourage listing of measurable indicators where applicable

enhancedVariables.name: MATERIAL_TITLE
enhancedVariables.description: A concise, descriptive title for a training or educational material used internally or with beneficiaries (e.g., workshop name, module title).
examples: Volunteer Orientation: Code of Conduct & Safety Procedures
Module 2: Basic Financial Literacy for Micro-Entrepreneurs
Facilitator Guide: Trauma-Informed Care Basics
validationRules: Required when uploading or cataloging materials
Avoid special characters; capitalize main words

enhancedVariables.name: TRAINING_MATERIAL
enhancedVariables.description: The full content or summary of the training resource (slides, manual, facilitator notes) including learning objectives and audience level.
examples: 10-slide deck on 'Community Fundraising Basics' with learning objectives and participant exercises.
Facilitator manual: 30-page guide for delivering a three-day psychosocial support training, including roleplay scripts.
Participant handout: One-page checklist on emergency preparedness for community volunteers.
validationRules: Max length 5000 characters or allow file attachment (PDF/PPT/DOCX)
If summarizing, include learning objectives and target audience
If uploading full material, include filename and version/date

enhancedVariables.name: TRAINING_MATERIAL_TYPE
enhancedVariables.description: Categorizes the format or purpose of the training material (e.g., facilitator guide, participant handout, slide deck, e-learning module).
examples: Facilitator Guide
Participant Handbook
Slide Deck
validationRules: Allowed values: Facilitator Guide, Participant Handbook, Slide Deck, E-learning Module, Handout, Assessment Tool, Other
If 'Other' selected, provide description in TRAINING_MATERIAL
